analyzed: thugs rje'i stobs kyis thabs kyi spyod pa rgya che dang // shes rab kyis ni de nyid don gzigs chags bral ba //
translated: By the power of compassion, with vast skillful conduct, and by wisdom, seeing the truth of reality, free from attachment,

original: mtha' gnyis mi gnas yon tan rgya mtsho dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis mi gnas yon tan rgya mtsho dang ldan pa'i //
translated: Not abiding in the two extremes, endowed with an ocean of qualities,

original: 'gro ba kun skyob rgyal dang de sras rnams la 'dud //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun skyob rgyal dang de sras rnams la 'dud //
translated: I bow to the Jina and his Bodhisattva heirs, who protect all beings.

original: gang zhig 'gro ba mtha' dag yongs su skyob pa'i thugs rje chen po dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig 'gro ba mtha' dag yongs su skyob pa'i thugs rje chen po dang ldan zhing /
translated: He who possesses great compassion, which completely protects all beings,

original: shes rab kyis 'gro ba'i bya ba la rab tu ma rmongs pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyis 'gro ba'i bya ba la rab tu ma rmongs pa //
translated: By wisdom, is not confused about the activities of beings,

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs mtshungs pa med pas sems can gyi don spyod pa la rab tu mi ngal ba //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs mtshungs pa med pas sems can gyi don spyod pa la rab tu mi ngal ba //
translated: And by the power of incomparable diligence, is not weary in benefiting sentient beings.

original: bdag gi bde ba la mi chags shing bag yod pa spyir la rab tu gnas pa /
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba la mi chags shing bag yod pa spyir la rab tu gnas pa /
translated: They are not attached to their own happiness and are generally very well established in carefulness.

original: yon tan rin po che'i gter sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de tshogs gnyis kyi bdag nyid /
analyzed: yon tan rin po che'i gter sdud par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de tshogs gnyis kyi bdag nyid /
translated: Bodhisattvas, who are the gatherers of the precious treasure of good qualities, are the very embodiment of the two accumulations.🔽By means of their practice of the six transcendent perfections, they bring to completion their own buddha qualities and by means of those very six transcendent perfections, which are the four ways of gathering disciples, they bring other sentient beings to full maturity.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de nyid bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir gyur pas gzhan sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni rgyal ba'i sras kyi spyod pa yin la ;🔽khyad par du de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi spyod pas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de nyid bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhir gyur pas gzhan sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni rgyal ba'i sras kyi spyod pa yin la ; khyad par du de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: This is the activity of the buddhas' sons.

original: (slob dpon 'di'i bzhed pas sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la /
analyzed: (slob dpon 'di'i bzhed pas sbyin pa tshul khrims bzod pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la /
translated: In particular, the transcendent perfections of generosity, discipline and patience constitute the accumulation of merit.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin la brtson 'grus gnyi gar gtogs pa'o/) / sh'akya thub pas kyang sngon de lta bu'i spyod pa rnam pa du ma mdzad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin la brtson 'grus gnyi gar gtogs pa'o/) / sh'akya thub pas kyang sngon de lta bu'i spyod pa rnam pa du ma mdzad do //
translated: Shakyamuni also performed many such deeds in the past.

original: de'i phyogs shig tsam slob dpon dpa' bos sbyar ba yin la //
analyzed: de'i phyogs shig tsam slob dpon dpa' bos sbyar ba yin la //
translated: One part of that is the composition of the master Shantideva.🔽The meaning of the six perfections and the four means of gathering disciples, which are their very nature,

original: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po gang dag gi bdag nyid yin pa dang / slob dpon 'phags pa thogs med kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sar gsungs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gang dang gang yin pa dang ;
analyzed: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po gang dag gi bdag nyid yin pa dang / slob dpon 'phags pa thogs med kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sar gsungs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gang dang gang yin pa dang ;
translated: and whatever is the special perfection taught by the master arya Asanga in the Bodhisattvabhumi,

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par la sogs par gyur pa'i don phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par la sogs par gyur pa'i don phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya'o //
translated: and whatever is the special skill in means, and so on, I will teach just a little.

original: de la g-yung drung shes rab grags /
analyzed: de la g-yung drung shes rab grags /
translated: In that regard, the one known as Achyuta🔽Some say that this treatise is incomplete,

original: kha cig na re gzhung 'di ni slob dpon gyis yongs su ma rdzogs par mngon te /🔽lhag lus par /
analyzed: kha cig na re gzhung 'di ni slob dpon gyis yongs su ma rdzogs par mngon te /🔽lhag lus par /
translated: because it is incomplete.

original: de ltar bstan mchod brjod dang dgos 'brel la sogs pa @276a * //
analyzed: de ltar bstan mchod brjod dang dgos 'brel la sogs pa @276a * //
translated: Thus, the homage, the statement of purpose, the connection, and so forth are taught.

original: bcos rtsom pa dang 'brel ba'i yan lag yod kyang mjug tu dge ba byang chub tu bsngo ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: bcos rtsom pa dang 'brel ba'i yan lag yod kyang mjug tu dge ba byang chub tu bsngo ba la sogs pa /
translated: Although there are branches connected with the composition, such as the dedication of virtue to enlightenment at the end,

original: bstan bcos yongs su rdzogs pa'i bya ba ma byas pa'i phyir dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum la bcu bcu yod kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos yongs su rdzogs pa'i bya ba ma byas pa'i phyir dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum la bcu bcu yod kyang /
translated: since the act of completely finishing the treatise is not done, and although there are ten for each of the first three perfections,

original: brtson 'grus kyi bcu tshan yang ma tshad la bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi dbang du byas pa'i gzhung ma snang ba'i phyir dang / dang po gsum la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi bcu tshan yang ma tshad la bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi dbang du byas pa'i gzhung ma snang ba'i phyir dang / dang po gsum la /
translated: since the set of ten for effort is not complete, and since the text that takes concentration and wisdom as its topic does not appear, and since the first three

original: sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pas mjug bsdus pa la mtha'i bzhi tshan la sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te dpyad dgos so //
analyzed: sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pas mjug bsdus pa la mtha'i bzhi tshan la sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te dpyad dgos so //
translated: are concluded with a verse summarizing the set of ten, but there is no verse summarizing the set of ten for the last four, it is necessary to analyze this.

original: de la bcu tshan dang pos ni sbyin pa bstan to //🔽la bzhi tsam las /
analyzed: de la bcu tshan dang pos ni sbyin pa bstan to // la bzhi tsam las /
translated: In the first set of ten, generosity is taught.

original: bcu tshan gnyis pas tshul khrims bstan to //
analyzed: bcu tshan gnyis pas tshul khrims bstan to //
translated: In the second set of ten, ethics is taught.

original: bcu tshan gsum pas ni bzod pa bstan to //
analyzed: bcu tshan gsum pas ni bzod pa bstan to //
translated: The third set of ten shows patience.

original: de la bcu tshan dang po las dang pos ni lus ril gyis sbyin pa bstan te //🔽brtson 'grus / gnyis pas ni yan lag gi mchog sbyin zhing mthong ba'i chos nyid la 'bras bu rgya 'grel las rgyal bu zla ba'i skyes rabs brtson 'grus so lcags kyi khyim dang ma he gnyis bsam gtan no bya shing rta mo shes rab tu gsung ba 'thad par snang ngo
analyzed: de la bcu tshan dang po las dang pos ni lus ril gyis sbyin pa bstan te // brtson 'grus / gnyis pas ni yan lag gi mchog sbyin zhing mthong ba'i chos nyid la 'bras bu rgya 'grel las rgyal bu zla ba'i skyes rabs brtson 'grus so lcags kyi khyim dang ma he gnyis bsam gtan no bya shing rta mo shes rab tu gsung ba 'thad par snang ngo
translated: In the first of the first ten, he shows giving away the whole body.

original: // chen po thob pa bstan to //
analyzed: // chen po thob pa bstan to //
translated: In the second, he shows giving away the best of limbs, and the attainment of the great fruit in this very life.

original: gsum pas ni longs spyod dman pa sbyin pa yang rnam par sbyin pa dang rgyu mthun pa rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: gsum pas ni longs spyod dman pa sbyin pa yang rnam par sbyin pa dang rgyu mthun pa rgya cher bstan to //
translated: In the third, he shows giving away inferior enjoyments, and the great increase of the enjoyment that is the natural outcome of that giving.

original: mig / slar yang spyan thob pa'i /
analyzed: mig / slar yang spyan thob pa'i /
translated: He regains his eyes.

original: bzhi pas sbyin pa la bdud kyis mi phrogs par bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi pas sbyin pa la bdud kyis mi phrogs par bstan to //
translated: In the fourth, he shows how generosity cannot be taken away by demons.

original: lnga pas ni yo byad nyung bas sbyin pa las mi ldog par bstan to //
analyzed: lnga pas ni yo byad nyung bas sbyin pa las mi ldog par bstan to //
translated: In the fifth, he shows how one does not turn away from giving even when one has only a few possessions.

original: drug pas ni rten dman yang sbyin pa las mi zan changs /
analyzed: drug pas ni rten dman yang sbyin pa las mi zan changs /
translated: The sixth verse shows that even with a lowly basis, one does not exhaust one's generosity.

original: ldog pa 'byor ba chen po //
analyzed: ldog pa 'byor ba chen po //
translated: The opposite is the great prosperity.

original: bstan to // bdun pa las longs spyod yongs su mi 'dzin yang gtong ba mi zad par bstan to //
analyzed: bstan to // bdun pa las longs spyod yongs su mi 'dzin yang gtong ba mi zad par bstan to //
translated: The seventh verse shows that even without taking up enjoyments, one's generosity is inexhaustible.

original: brgyad pas ni sbyin pa la brten na sa gtan du thar pa thob par bstan to //🔽dgu pas ni longs ri bong dud 'gro'i //
analyzed: brgyad pas ni sbyin pa la brten na sa gtan du thar pa thob par bstan to // dgu pas ni longs ri bong dud 'gro'i //
translated: The eighth verse shows that by relying on generosity, one attains liberation forever.

original: spyod mchog la ma chags par bstan to //
analyzed: spyod mchog la ma chags par bstan to //
translated: The ninth verse shows that one is not attached to the supreme enjoyment of the gods and humans.

original: bcu pas ni 'tsho ba spong zhing gzhan mang po dag gi sdig pa spong ba thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: bcu pas ni 'tsho ba spong zhing gzhan mang po dag gi sdig pa spong ba thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: The tenth verse shows the special skill in means of abandoning one's livelihood and abandoning the sins of many others.

original: de dag ni phyogs re re'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni phyogs re re'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: These are from the perspective of individual aspects,

original: rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du'ang dpyad du yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du'ang dpyad du yod do //
translated: but there are other ways to analyze them.

original: gzhan yang zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zang zing gi sbyin pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, material generosity is twofold:

original: lus sbyin pa dang longs spyod sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lus sbyin pa dang longs spyod sbyin pa'o //
translated: giving one's body and giving one's possessions.

original: dang po ni le'u bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: dang po ni le'u bzhis bstan te /
translated: The first is shown by four chapters.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa dang / drug pa dang / brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa dang / drug pa dang / brgyad pa'o //
translated: The first, second, sixth, and eighth are the giving of wealth.

original: lhag ma drug ni longs spyod sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma drug ni longs spyod sbyin pa'o //
translated: The remaining six are the giving of Dharma.

original: zhing gi khyad @276b par gang la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas na /
analyzed: zhing gi khyad @276b par gang la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas na /
translated: From the point of view of the distinction of the field,

original: bzhi pa dang bcu pas ni yon tan gyi zhing la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang bcu pas ni yon tan gyi zhing la sbyin pa'o //
translated: the fourth and tenth are the giving to a field of virtues.

original: lhag ma ni sdug bsngal ba'i zhing la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sdug bsngal ba'i zhing la sbyin pa'o //
translated: The remaining six are the giving to a field of suffering.

original: bcu po thams cad la yang legs par bshad pa'i khyad par ni chos kyi sbyin pa yin la /
analyzed: bcu po thams cad la yang legs par bshad pa'i khyad par ni chos kyi sbyin pa yin la /
translated: And all ten are the giving of Dharma, since they are well explained.

original: dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / drug pa dang / brgyad pa dang / lhag ma drug ni longs spyod sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / drug pa dang / brgyad pa dang / lhag ma drug ni longs spyod sbyin pa'o //
translated: The first, second, sixth, eighth, and the remaining six are the giving of wealth.

original: zhing gi khyad par gang la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas na /
analyzed: zhing gi khyad par gang la sbyin pa'i dbang du byas na /
translated: From the point of view of the distinction of the field,

original: bzhi pa dang / bcu pas ni yon tan gyi zhing la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang / bcu pas ni yon tan gyi zhing la sbyin pa'o //
translated: the fourth and tenth are the giving to a field of virtues.

original: dgu pa dang / bcu pas ni gzhan sdug bsngal ba las skyob pa mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dgu pa dang / bcu pas ni gzhan sdug bsngal ba las skyob pa mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa yang yin no //
translated: The ninth and tenth are also the giving of fearlessness, since they protect others from suffering.

original: gtsor sbyin pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: gtsor sbyin pa yin gyi ;
translated: They are primarily the giving of Dharma.

original: ni lus sbyin pa dge ba //
analyzed: ni lus sbyin pa dge ba //
translated: The first is the virtue of giving one's body.

original: gzhan lnga dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: gzhan lnga dang yang ldan te /
translated: The other five are also virtues.

original: 'di ltar thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims yin la /
translated: All of them are the virtue of accumulating the bodhisattvas' qualities.

original: ci rigs par gzhan gyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyang yod do //🔽sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni don gyi rten nyid du rnam par pha rol tu phyin pa /🔽gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ci rigs par gzhan gyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyang yod do // sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni don gyi rten nyid du rnam par pha rol tu phyin pa / gnas pa ste /
translated: And they are the virtue of acting for the benefit of sentient beings, such as removing the suffering of others, as is appropriate.🔽The virtue of restraint is the basis for the other two virtues.🔽It is the basis for the virtue of accumulating the bodhisattvas' qualities.

original: rab tu byung ba'i rten la ni rab tu byung ba'i dge ba /🔽sdom pa yod la /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i rten la ni rab tu byung ba'i dge ba / sdom pa yod la /
translated: The virtue of the ordained is the virtue of restraint in the context of the ordained.

original: gzhan thams cad la dge bsnyen sdom pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad la dge bsnyen sdom pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The other virtues are included in the virtue of the lay practitioner.

original: thams cad la sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa yod la /
analyzed: thams cad la sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa yod la /
translated: All of them are the virtue of patiently accepting suffering.

original: dang po dang gsum pa dang / bcu pa sa snga ma gnyis gyi /
analyzed: dang po dang gsum pa dang / bcu pa sa snga ma gnyis gyi /
translated: The first, the third, and the tenth are the virtue of patiently accepting suffering.

original: ma gtogs pa lhag ma bdun la ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa yod do //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa lhag ma bdun la ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa yod do //
translated: The remaining seven are the virtue of patiently accepting the harm done to you by others.

original: thams cad la yang sems can gyi don byed pa'i brtson 'grus yod la /
analyzed: thams cad la yang sems can gyi don byed pa'i brtson 'grus yod la /
translated: And all of them have the striving which benefits sentient beings.

original: de'i rgyur dgos pas dge ba bsgrub pa dang go cha'i brtson 'grus dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de'i rgyur dgos pas dge ba bsgrub pa dang go cha'i brtson 'grus dag kyang yod do //
translated: And since that is the cause, they also have the striving for the accomplishment of virtue and the armor-like striving.

original: theg pa dman par mi g-yeng bas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
analyzed: theg pa dman par mi g-yeng bas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
translated: They have the perfection of meditation, since they are not distracted by the Individual Vehicle.

original: de ni byang chub chen por smon pas na phal cher gzhung na snang ngo //
analyzed: de ni byang chub chen por smon pas na phal cher gzhung na snang ngo //
translated: And since they aspire to great enlightenment, they are mostly mentioned in the scriptures.

original: shes rab las kyang kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la dmigs pa ni shes rab ste rgyu'i sgo nas don dam pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab ste rgyu'i sgo nas don dam pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyang yod do //
analyzed: shes rab las kyang kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la dmigs pa ni shes rab ste rgyu'i sgo nas don dam pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab ste rgyu'i sgo nas don dam pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyang yod do //
translated: And from the point of view of cause, there is also the wisdom which focuses on the ultimate.

original: 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i phan tshun rnam par nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i phan tshun rnam par nges pa'o //
translated: These are the mutual determinations of the perfections.

original: gzhan yang bdun pa ni chos smon lam /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdun pa ni chos smon lam /
translated: Moreover, the seventh perfection is the perfection of vows,

original: kyi sbyin pa gtso che ba yin te /
analyzed: kyi sbyin pa gtso che ba yin te /
translated: since it is the preeminence of the vow of Dharma.

original: brgya byin legs par bshad pas tshim par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgya byin legs par bshad pas tshim par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he satisfied Indra with his good explanations.

original: bcu pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa gtso che ba yin te /🔽dud 'gro rnams gsod pa las bskyabs shing mi rnams rgyu bzlog pas /
analyzed: bcu pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa gtso che ba yin te / dud 'gro rnams gsod pa las bskyabs shing mi rnams rgyu bzlog pas /
translated: The tenth is the giving of fearlessness, because

original: sdig pa / @277a * //🔽ngan 'gro las bskyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa / @277a * // ngan 'gro las bskyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he protected the animals from being killed and turned the men away from the bad destinies.

original: lhag ma ni zang zing gi sbyin pa gtso che zhes bya bar yang rung ngo //
analyzed: lhag ma ni zang zing gi sbyin pa gtso che zhes bya bar yang rung ngo //
translated: The rest are suitable as the giving of material things.

original: bcu tshan 'di la grangs nges pa dang go rims nges par mi bsam mo //
analyzed: bcu tshan 'di la grangs nges pa dang go rims nges par mi bsam mo //
translated: One should not think that these sets of ten are definitely fixed in number and order.

original: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas pa'i bcu tshan ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas pa'i bcu tshan ni //
translated: The sets of ten in terms of morality are

original: don gnyis kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: don gnyis kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: in terms of the two aims.

original: lus ngag gi las yongs su dag pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: lus ngag gi las yongs su dag pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: They are the complete purity of physical and verbal actions and the complete purity of mental actions.

original: dang po ni bdun no //
analyzed: dang po ni bdun no //
translated: The first is the first seven.

original: gnyis pa ni lhag ma gsum mo //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lhag ma gsum mo //
translated: The second is the last three.

original: dang po la yang gnyis te //
analyzed: dang po la yang gnyis te //
translated: The first is also twofold.

original: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba spang ba dang / bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba spang bas te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba spang ba dang / bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba spang bas te /
translated: It is the abandonment of natural evil and the abandonment of evil by prohibition.

original: dang po drug dang / gnyis pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: dang po drug dang / gnyis pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The first six and the second seven.

original: dang po la gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po la gnyis te /
translated: The first has two parts:

original: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag pa bden pa'i tshig brjod pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag pa bden pa'i tshig brjod pa ste /
translated: the purity of physical action and the purity of verbal action, which is the utterance of the truth.

original: gsum dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gsum dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three are respectively.

original: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa la gsum ste /
analyzed: lus kyi las yongs su dag pa la gsum ste /
translated: The purity of physical action has three parts:

original: srog gcod pa spong bas rab tu phye ba dang po dang / ma byin par len pa spong bas rab tu phye ba gnyis pa dang / log pa'i g-yem pa spong bas rab tu phye ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong bas rab tu phye ba dang po dang / ma byin par len pa spong bas rab tu phye ba gnyis pa dang / log pa'i g-yem pa spong bas rab tu phye ba gsum pa'o //
translated: the first is distinguished by the abandonment of killing, the second is distinguished by the abandonment of taking what has not been given, and the third is distinguished by the abandonment of sexual misconduct.

original: tha ma gsum yid kyi las yongs su dag pas //
analyzed: tha ma gsum yid kyi las yongs su dag pas //
translated: The last three are the purity of mental action.

original: gsum / rab tu phye ba ji ltar gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gsum / rab tu phye ba ji ltar gzhag ce na /
translated: How are the three respectively distinguished?

original: go rims bzhin sdig pa'i grogs pos bzlog kyang 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas yang mi 'phrogs pa dang / smon nas tshangs par spyod pa spangs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i bar chad kyis mi brdzi bas ma chags pa la sogs pa shas che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin sdig pa'i grogs pos bzlog kyang 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas yang mi 'phrogs pa dang / smon nas tshangs par spyod pa spangs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i bar chad kyis mi brdzi bas ma chags pa la sogs pa shas che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the predominance of nonattachment and so on, respectively, one is not carried away by desire realm thoughts and so on, even when stopped by sinful friends, one abandons the vow of celibacy through aspiration and one is not crushed by the obstacles of going forth.

original: dang po bdun pos ni phongs pa'i dus na yang brtan par ston te /
analyzed: dang po bdun pos ni phongs pa'i dus na yang brtan par ston te /
translated: The first seven show that one is stable even in times of poverty.

original: phongs kyang rang nyid sdig pa la mi 'jug pa ni dang po gsum gyis ston la /
analyzed: phongs kyang rang nyid sdig pa la mi 'jug pa ni dang po gsum gyis ston la /
translated: The first three show that even in poverty one does not engage in evil.

original: rang gzhan gnyi ga phongs pa las skyob pa ni bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang drug pas ston to //
analyzed: rang gzhan gnyi ga phongs pa las skyob pa ni bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang drug pas ston to //
translated: The fourth, fifth and sixth show that one protects oneself and others from poverty.

original: gzhan tshul khrims la dgod pa bdun pas ston to //
analyzed: gzhan tshul khrims la dgod pa bdun pas ston to //
translated: The seventh shows that one establishes others in ethics.

original: dang po drug gis ni lus kyi rkyen gyis mi 'phrogs pa ston la /
analyzed: dang po drug gis ni lus kyi rkyen gyis mi 'phrogs pa ston la /
translated: The first six show that one is not carried away by physical conditions.

original: tha ma gsum gyis ni sdig pa'i grogs pos mi 'phrogs par ston to //
analyzed: tha ma gsum gyis ni sdig pa'i grogs pos mi 'phrogs par ston to //
translated: The last three show that one is not carried away by sinful friends.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par gzhag ba ni mang du dpyad du yod do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par gzhag ba ni mang du dpyad du yod do //
translated: There are many other ways of classifying them.

original: gzhan yang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes pa spong pa thams cad kyang sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes pa spong pa thams cad kyang sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Moreover, all the ways of avoiding the faults of body, speech, and mind are morality as vow.

original: dge ba bsgrub pa'i bya ba yin pas thams cad kyang dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dge ba bsgrub pa'i bya ba yin pas thams cad kyang dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: And all of them are morality of gathering virtuous dharmas, because they are the activities of accomplishing virtue.

original: bdun pa ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pas gtsor sems can gyi don bya ba'i @277b tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bdun pa ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pas gtsor sems can gyi don bya ba'i @277b tshul khrims so //
translated: The seventh is morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings, because it is primarily for the benefit of others.

original: dang po gsum yang gzhan la gnod pa spong bas sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims yin no //
analyzed: dang po gsum yang gzhan la gnod pa spong bas sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims yin no //
translated: The first three are also morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings, because they are the avoidance of harm to others.

original: gzhan gsum ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pas rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan gsum ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pas rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The other three are easily understood as working for the benefit of others, because they are the benefitting of others.

original: tha ma gsum dag kyang rgyur gyur pas sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims zhes byar rung ngo //
analyzed: tha ma gsum dag kyang rgyur gyur pas sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims zhes byar rung ngo //
translated: The last three are also suitable to be called morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings, because they are the cause of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: phan tshun rnam par nges pa'i dbang du byas na tshul khrims thams cad kyang chos kyi sbyin pa'i grogs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bye brag tu legs pas bshad pa thams cad ni chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par nges pa'i dbang du byas na tshul khrims thams cad kyang chos kyi sbyin pa'i grogs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bye brag tu legs pas bshad pa thams cad ni chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: When they are considered in terms of their mutual determination, all the moralities are the friend of the giving of the Dharma.

original: dang po drug ni sdug bsngal gyis mi 'khrugs pas sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'o //🔽tha ma bzhi ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: dang po drug ni sdug bsngal gyis mi 'khrugs pas sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'o // tha ma bzhi ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: The first six are the patience of accepting suffering, because one is not disturbed by suffering.

original: sems can gyi don legs par ba sgrub pa la mi khro ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don legs par ba sgrub pa la mi khro ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: The last four are the patience of accepting the injury of others, because one is not angry at those who injure one, in the accomplishment of the aims of beings.

original: thams cad kyang dge ba bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang dge ba bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: All of them are the effort of accomplishing the good.

original: bzhi pa dang lnga ba dang drug pa dang bdun pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyang yod do//
analyzed: bzhi pa dang lnga ba dang drug pa dang bdun pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyang yod do//
translated: The fourth, fifth, sixth, and seventh are also the effort of accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus ni de dag gi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus ni de dag gi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The armor effort precedes all of them.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meditation and wisdom are as above.

original: bzod pa'i dbang du byas pa'i bcu tshan ni gtsor bzod pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i dbang du byas pa'i bcu tshan ni gtsor bzod pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The set of ten in terms of patience is mainly in terms of the two kinds of patience.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o ;
translated: Patience in accepting suffering and patience in disregarding harm done to you.

original: / chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod /
analyzed: / chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod /
translated: Patience in accepting the Dharma

original: theg pa dman par sems mi g-yeng ba /
analyzed: theg pa dman par sems mi g-yeng ba /
translated: and not being distracted by the Individual Vehicle.

original: kun rdzob dang sems can gyi don shes pa'i shes rab /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang sems can gyi don shes pa'i shes rab /
translated: Wisdom in knowing the conventional and the welfare of living beings.

original: pa yang de dag gi rgyu nyid du don gyis gnas so //
analyzed: pa yang de dag gi rgyu nyid du don gyis gnas so //
translated: And these are implicitly included as the causes of those.

original: de la gsum pa dang dgu pa ni sems can gyi log par bsgrub pa 'ba' zhig bzod pas gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de la gsum pa dang dgu pa ni sems can gyi log par bsgrub pa 'ba' zhig bzod pas gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Among them, the third and the ninth are patience in disregarding harm done to you, because they are patience in the mere wrongdoings of living beings.

original: bcu pa ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: bcu pa ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: The tenth is patience in accepting suffering.

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa ni med kyi gzhan la phan //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa ni med kyi gzhan la phan //
translated: There is no harm done by others, but there is benefit for others.

original: gnyis po // 'dogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyid bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis po // 'dogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyid bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is patience in the suffering of being labeled.

original: lhag ma bdun ni bzod pa gnyis kas bsdus te /
analyzed: lhag ma bdun ni bzod pa gnyis kas bsdus te /
translated: The remaining seven are included in both kinds of patience.

original: sems can gyi log par bsgrub pa dang des byas pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis ka bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi log par bsgrub pa dang des byas pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis ka bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is patient with both the wrongdoings of sentient beings and the suffering that they cause.

original: dang po ni nang gi khro ba nye bar zhi bas phyi rol gyi gnod pa bzlog pa'i phan yon dang ldan pa ston to //
analyzed: dang po ni nang gi khro ba nye bar zhi bas phyi rol gyi gnod pa bzlog pa'i phan yon dang ldan pa ston to //
translated: The first shows the benefit of warding off external harm by pacifying internal anger.

original: gnyis pa ni rten dman pa la yang yon tan dang bzod pa yod par ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rten dman pa la yang yon tan dang bzod pa yod par ston to //
translated: The second shows that even a lowly person can have good qualities and patience.

original: gsum pa dang bdun pa ni byas pa gzo bas gzhan yal bar mi @278a * //🔽'dor ba ston to //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bdun pa ni byas pa gzo bas gzhan yal bar mi @278a * // 'dor ba ston to //
translated: The third and seventh show that he does not neglect others because he is grateful.

original: gzhan gyis brnyas kyang yal bar mi 'dor ba dang / phongs kyang yal bar mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brnyas kyang yal bar mi 'dor ba dang / phongs kyang yal bar mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: He does not neglect those who despise him, and he does not neglect those who are in trouble.

original: yang na tshe gzhan gyi don dang tshe 'di'i don yal bar mi 'dor ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshe gzhan gyi don dang tshe 'di'i don yal bar mi 'dor ba ston pa'o //
translated: Or else, it shows that he does not neglect the welfare of others in other lives and the welfare of this life.

original: bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa ni gnod byed nyam nyes par gyur pa yal bar mi 'dor ba ston to //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa ni gnod byed nyam nyes par gyur pa yal bar mi 'dor ba ston to //
translated: The fourth, fifth, and sixth show that he does not neglect those who harm him when they are in trouble.

original: brgyad pas ni log par bsgrub pa la tshe 'di'i don bya bar ma nus kyang /
analyzed: brgyad pas ni log par bsgrub pa la tshe 'di'i don bya bar ma nus kyang /
translated: The eighth shows that even if he is unable to help those who do wrong in this life,🔽he does not give up on them.

original: bdag gi bzod pa'i 'bras bu de la thob par smon pa ston to //
analyzed: bdag gi bzod pa'i 'bras bu de la thob par smon pa ston to //
translated: He shows that he wishes to obtain the fruit of his patience in that way.

original: dgu pas ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gnas pa shin tu brtse ba'i gnas yin pa dang / gtso bo dge ba la bkod pas gzhan du ma'i don du gyur pas thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: dgu pas ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gnas pa shin tu brtse ba'i gnas yin pa dang / gtso bo dge ba la bkod pas gzhan du ma'i don du gyur pas thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par ston to //
translated: The ninth verse shows the special skill in means, since it is a basis for great compassion for those who abide in the cause of suffering, and since it is for the sake of others, since it establishes them in the principal virtue.

original: bcu pas ni ngan 'gro'i rten la gzhan du ma'i sdug bsngal skyob pas rten dman pas bzod pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mi 'dor ba ston to //
analyzed: bcu pas ni ngan 'gro'i rten la gzhan du ma'i sdug bsngal skyob pas rten dman pas bzod pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mi 'dor ba ston to //
translated: The tenth verse shows that one does not abandon the virtues of patience, etc. , even in a lowly rebirth, since one protects others from suffering in the bad rebirths.

original: de lta bu'i dgos pa rnam pa du ma dpyad du yod do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dgos pa rnam pa du ma dpyad du yod do //
translated: There are many such kinds of purpose to be analyzed.

original: bzod pa de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan lnga dang ldan te /
analyzed: bzod pa de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan lnga dang ldan te /
translated: And these patiences are endowed with the other five perfections.

original: legs par bshad pa thams cad chos kyi sbyin pa yin la bye brag tu dgu pa la sogs pa chos kyi sbyin pa shin tu yang gtso che'o //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa thams cad chos kyi sbyin pa yin la bye brag tu dgu pa la sogs pa chos kyi sbyin pa shin tu yang gtso che'o //
translated: All good explanations are the giving of Dharma, and in particular, the ninth verse is the preeminent giving of Dharma.

original: bcu pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The tenth verse is the giving of material things.

original: bcu po thams cad ni dge ba chos sdud la ci rigs par sems can gyi don byed pa dang sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni snga ma gnyis kyi rten du don gyis byed pas /
analyzed: bcu po thams cad ni dge ba chos sdud la ci rigs par sems can gyi don byed pa dang sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni snga ma gnyis kyi rten du don gyis byed pas /
translated: All ten are the virtue of gathering virtue, and they are the practice of benefiting sentient beings in whatever way is appropriate.

original: tshul khrims su gyur pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims su gyur pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of “becoming morality” is as before.

original: bcu po thams cad ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i brtson 'grus yin la /
analyzed: bcu po thams cad ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i brtson 'grus yin la /
translated: All ten are the effort of benefiting sentient beings.

original: de'i rgyur dge ba sgrub pa'i brtson 'grus dang go cha'i brtson 'grus kyang yod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyur dge ba sgrub pa'i brtson 'grus dang go cha'i brtson 'grus kyang yod pa'o //
translated: And there is the effort of accomplishing virtue, which is the cause of that, and the armor effort.

original: kun rdzob dang sems can gyi don byed ba shes pa'i shes rab //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang sems can gyi don byed ba shes pa'i shes rab //
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom of knowing the conventional and of knowing how to benefit sentient beings.

original: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi don yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi don yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of effort, concentration, and wisdom is as before.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang du byas pa'i bzhi tshan ni //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang du byas pa'i bzhi tshan ni //
translated: The four sets of effort are

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rang nyid kyis dge ba bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rang nyid kyis dge ba bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: the effort of benefiting sentient beings, and the effort of accomplishing virtue oneself.

original: dang po dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa ni dang po yin la /🔽gnyis pa theg dman par sems ma g-yeng ba'i /
analyzed: dang po dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa ni dang po yin la / gnyis pa theg dman par sems ma g-yeng ba'i /
translated: The first, third, and fourth are the first.

original: ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second is the second, the effort of one who is not distracted in the Individual Vehicle.

original: dang po yang gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang gnyis te /
translated: The first is twofold:

original: tshe 'di dang gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus dang / tshe 'di'i don bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus dang / tshe 'di'i don bsgrub pa ste /
translated: effort in accomplishing benefit for this life and for another life, and effort in accomplishing the aim of this life.

original: dang po ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: dang po ni dang po yin no //
translated: The first is the first.

original: tshe 'di'i don bsgrub pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i don bsgrub pa la gnyis te /
translated: Accomplishing the aim of this life is twofold:

original: mi gnod pa bsgrub ba dang phan pa bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnod pa bsgrub ba dang phan pa bsgrub pa ste /
translated: accomplishing non-harming and accomplishing benefit.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni rim pa bzhin no //
translated: The third and fourth are respectively the third and fourth.

original: gzhan yang dang po de nyid dang gzhan du ma la @278b phan 'dogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dang po de nyid dang gzhan du ma la @278b phan 'dogs pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the first is benefitting oneself and others.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa de nyid la phan pa tsam bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa de nyid la phan pa tsam bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The third and fourth are accomplishing benefit for oneself alone.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal bzlog pa dang de'i rgyu bzlog pa la sogs pa rnam pa mang du dpyad du yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal bzlog pa dang de'i rgyu bzlog pa la sogs pa rnam pa mang du dpyad du yod do //
translated: In this way, there are many ways to analyze the reversal of suffering and the reversal of its cause.

original: brtson 'grus de yang gzhan la legs par bshad pas sbyin pa yin la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus de yang gzhan la legs par bshad pas sbyin pa yin la /
translated: That effort is giving through explaining well to others.

original: thams cad kyang sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims yin la /
analyzed: thams cad kyang sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims yin la /
translated: All of these are the morality of benefiting sentient beings.

original: bden par smra ba dang khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par byung ba dang 'tsho ba spong ba dag ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyang yin no //
analyzed: bden par smra ba dang khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par byung ba dang 'tsho ba spong ba dag ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyang yin no //
translated: Speaking the truth, going forth from the home life, and abandoning livelihood faults are also the morality of restraint.

original: dang po gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa yin la /
translated: The first is patience in withstanding harm.

original: gnyis pa ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa ste /
translated: The second is patience in accepting suffering,

original: mngon par 'byung bas 'dod pa'i bde ba gtong zhing dka' thub kyi gnod pa bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung bas 'dod pa'i bde ba gtong zhing dka' thub kyi gnod pa bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because going forth abandons the happiness of desire and one endures the harm of austerities.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni gtsor gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni gtsor gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'o //
translated: The third and fourth are primarily patience in withstanding harm.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Concentration and wisdom are as above.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa la sogs pa de nyid gzhan du rjes su 'dzin pas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa la sogs pa de nyid gzhan du rjes su 'dzin pas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: Moreover, these very transcendent perfections of generosity and so forth are also included in the four ways of gathering disciples, since they are the means of caring for others in other lives.

original: sbyin pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa nyid gzung gi chos kyi sbyin pa ni snyan par smra ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su kun rdzob dang don dam sems can gyi don byed ba shes pa'i shes rab /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa nyid gzung gi chos kyi sbyin pa ni snyan par smra ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su kun rdzob dang don dam sems can gyi don byed ba shes pa'i shes rab /
translated: Pleasant speech is the wisdom that knows how to help beings by means of the relative and ultimate.🔽Helpful activity is the patience of not being discouraged about the vehicles of the lower yanas.

original: theg pa dman par sems mi g-yeng ba'i /
analyzed: theg pa dman par sems mi g-yeng ba'i /
translated: Consistency in behavior is the diligence of not being distracted.

original: 'gro'o // mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'ang don spyod pa'am don mthun pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'gro'o // mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'ang don spyod pa'am don mthun pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Giving fearlessness is also called helpful activity or consistency in behavior.

original: gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, in terms of the six paramitas, the paramita of generosity is generosity.

original: tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: The paramitas of discipline and patience are pleasant speech.

original: brtson 'grus ni don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: Diligence is helpful activity.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni don mthun pa'o //
translated: Concentration and wisdom are consistency in behavior.

original: gzhan la chos ston pa'i khyad par snyan par smra ba de dag gis chos kyi don ni bsdus na 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la chos ston pa'i khyad par snyan par smra ba de dag gis chos kyi don ni bsdus na 'di dag yin te /
translated: The meaning of the Dharma that is taught to others is summarized in these three:

original: dang por ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang bdag la chags pa spang ba'o //
analyzed: dang por ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang bdag la chags pa spang ba'o //
translated: The first verse teaches the abandonment of the faults of cyclic existence and of self-attachment.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang lnga pas ni sbyin pa'i bsngags pa dang ser sna'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa dang lnga pas ni sbyin pa'i bsngags pa dang ser sna'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The second, third, fourth, and fifth verses teach the praise of generosity and the faults of stinginess.

original: drug pas ni bsod nams la 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: drug pas ni bsod nams la 'bad pa'o //
translated: The sixth verse teaches the striving for merit.

original: bdun par ni theg pa chen po'i lam la gnas pa dang chog shes pa dang grogs po ngan pa spangs pa dang / dam pa dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen dang 'bral bar brtag pa'o //
analyzed: bdun par ni theg pa chen po'i lam la gnas pa dang chog shes pa dang grogs po ngan pa spangs pa dang / dam pa dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen dang 'bral bar brtag pa'o //
translated: The seventh verse teaches the abiding in the path of the Great Vehicle, the contentment, the abandonment of bad friends, and the avoidance of conditions adverse to the holy ones.

original: brgyad par ni theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa dang / sdig pa lnga spang ba dang / sbyin pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad par ni theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa dang / sdig pa lnga spang ba dang / sbyin pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The eighth verse teaches the generation of the thought of the Great Vehicle, the abandonment of the five sins, and the praise of generosity.

original: dgu par sbyin pa la 'bad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgu par sbyin pa la 'bad par bya ba'o //
translated: The ninth verse teaches the striving for generosity.

original: @279a * // bcu par sdig pa spang pa'o //
analyzed: @279a * // bcu par sdig pa spang pa'o //
translated: The tenth verse teaches the abandonment of sin.

original: bcu gcig par 'tshe ba bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig par 'tshe ba bzlog pa'o //
translated: The eleventh verse teaches the prevention of violence.

original: bcu gnyis par ngo tsha shes pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis par ngo tsha shes pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: The twelfth verse teaches the abiding in a sense of shame.

original: bcu gsum pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The thirteenth verse is the same.

original: bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa dang bcu drug par bden pa'i byin rlabs brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa dang bcu drug par bden pa'i byin rlabs brjod pa'o //
translated: In the fourteenth, fifteenth, and sixteenth chapters, he speaks of the blessings of the truth.

original: bcu bdun par chang gi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: bcu bdun par chang gi nyes pa'o //
translated: In the seventeenth, he speaks of the faults of alcohol.

original: bco brgyad par ni khyim gyi gnod pa dang 'dod pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: bco brgyad par ni khyim gyi gnod pa dang 'dod pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: In the eighteenth, he speaks of the faults of desire and the harm of householders.

original: bcu dgu par 'dod pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: bcu dgu par 'dod pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: In the nineteenth, he speaks of the faults of desire.

original: nyi shu par ni gzhan gyis yon tan dang ldan par re ba bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nyi shu par ni gzhan gyis yon tan dang ldan par re ba bsgrub pa'o //
translated: In the twentieth, he speaks of how to fulfill the hopes of others who have good qualities.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig par ni khro ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig par ni khro ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: In the twenty-first, he speaks of the faults of anger.

original: nyi shu rtsa gnyis par ni yon tan la 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gnyis par ni yon tan la 'bad pa'o //
translated: In the twenty-second, he speaks of striving for good qualities.

original: nyi shu rtsa gsum par lta ba ngan pa tshar bcad pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po spong ba dang / bsod nams la 'bad pa dang / chos kyis rgyal srid bskyang ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gsum par lta ba ngan pa tshar bcad pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po spong ba dang / bsod nams la 'bad pa dang / chos kyis rgyal srid bskyang ba'o //
translated: In the twenty-third, he speaks of how to defeat bad views, how to abandon bad friends, how to strive for merit, and how to rule a kingdom through the Dharma.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi par sdig pa spang ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi par sdig pa spang ba'o //
translated: In the twenty-fourth, he speaks of abandoning evil.

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga par ri dags la gnod pa spang ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa spang ba dang / bsod nams la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga par ri dags la gnod pa spang ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa spang ba dang / bsod nams la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: In the twenty-fifth, he speaks of how to abandon harming deer, how to abandon harming others, and how to strive for merit.

original: nyi shu rtsa drug par sdig pa spang ba dang / snying rje bskyed pa dang chos kyis srid bskyang ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa drug par sdig pa spang ba dang / snying rje bskyed pa dang chos kyis srid bskyang ba'o //
translated: In the twenty-sixth chapter, he explains the avoidance of evil, the cultivation of compassion, and the protection of the kingdom through the Dharma.

original: nyi shu rtsa bdun par byas pa drin du gzo ba dang chos kyis rgyal srid bskyang ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bdun par byas pa drin du gzo ba dang chos kyis rgyal srid bskyang ba'o //
translated: In the twenty-seventh chapter, he explains the repayment of kindness through service and the protection of the kingdom through the Dharma.

original: nyi shu rtsa brgyad par bsod nams la 'bad pa dang bag yod par bsgrub pa dang bzod pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa brgyad par bsod nams la 'bad pa dang bag yod par bsgrub pa dang bzod pa la gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: In the twenty-eighth chapter, he explains the striving for merit, the accomplishment of heedfulness, and the practice of patience.

original: nyi shu rtsa dgu par ni yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed pa'i thabs dang log par lta ba'i nyes dmigs dmyal ba'i gnod pa dang mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa dgu par ni yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed pa'i thabs dang log par lta ba'i nyes dmigs dmyal ba'i gnod pa dang mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam mo //
translated: In the twenty-ninth chapter, he explains the means of generating the correct view, the faults of wrong views, the torments of hell, and the paths to the higher realms and liberation.

original: sum cu par snying rjes gzhan dbugs dbyung ba dang smon lam chen po gdab pa'o //
analyzed: sum cu par snying rjes gzhan dbugs dbyung ba dang smon lam chen po gdab pa'o //
translated: In the thirtieth chapter, he explains the comforting of others through compassion and the making of great aspirations.

original: sum cu rtsa gcig par thos pa'i bsngags pa dang legs par bshad pa'i khyad par bzhi dang gzhan lam bzang po la sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gcig par thos pa'i bsngags pa dang legs par bshad pa'i khyad par bzhi dang gzhan lam bzang po la sbyar ba'o //
translated: In the thirty-first chapter, he explains the praise of learning, the four distinctive excellent explanations, and the application of others to the good path.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis par 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang 'chi ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis par 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang 'chi ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: In the thirty-second chapter, the faults of cyclic existence and death are cultivated.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang rtsa bzhi par bzod pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang rtsa bzhi par bzod pa'i phan yon no //
translated: In the thirty-third and thirty-fourth chapters, the benefits of patience are taught.

original: de ltar sbyin pas 'dun par byas nas snyan par smra bas gdams par byas shing don spyod pas gdams ngag gi don bsgrub pa la btsud la /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pas 'dun par byas nas snyan par smra bas gdams par byas shing don spyod pas gdams ngag gi don bsgrub pa la btsud la /
translated: Thus, having attracted them with generosity, one instructs them with agreeable speech, and having caused them to undertake the meaning of the instructions with beneficial actions, one stabilizes them in the practice of the meaning of the instructions.🔽And with equal concern for others' welfare, one stabilizes them in the practice of the meaning of the instructions.

original: don mthun pas pha rol po'i don bsgrub pa la brtan par 'gyur bas gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i thabs rnams ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi kho na'o //
analyzed: don mthun pas pha rol po'i don bsgrub pa la brtan par 'gyur bas gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i thabs rnams ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi kho na'o //
translated: These four means of attraction are the methods for accomplishing the welfare of others.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po de nyid ci rigs par rang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs @279b par byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po de nyid ci rigs par rang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs @279b par byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: These four means of attraction are the specific skillful means for perfecting the qualities of a buddha and for bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: tha na gzhan gyis rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis kyang de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de'i phyir spyod pa rmad du byung bas theg pa dman pa las log pa dang zhugs pa brtan pa dang gzhan gyi don la ched cher 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa du ma gzigs te /
analyzed: tha na gzhan gyis rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis kyang de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de'i phyir spyod pa rmad du byung bas theg pa dman pa las log pa dang zhugs pa brtan pa dang gzhan gyi don la ched cher 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa du ma gzigs te /
translated: Therefore, seeing many purposes, such as turning away from the lower vehicle, stabilizing the practice, and holding the welfare of others as paramount, through the marvelous conduct,

original: de ston pa'i gzhung nye bar bkod pas 'di ni don chen po dang ldan pas rin po che chen po lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de ston pa'i gzhung nye bar bkod pas 'di ni don chen po dang ldan pas rin po che chen po lta bu yin no //
translated: this text is endowed with great meaning, like a great jewel.

original: des na tshig 'di'i don dran par byas la rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na tshig 'di'i don dran par byas la rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should recollect the meaning of these words and rejoice.

original: bdag kyang 'di lta bu'i spyod pa rlabs po che la gnas nas ji ltar tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur snyam du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang 'di lta bu'i spyod pa rlabs po che la gnas nas ji ltar tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur snyam du yid la bya'o //
translated: One should think, “How can I, abiding in such marvelous conduct, complete the collections?”

original: gzhan dag la spyod pa rlabs po che bsgrags shing mos pa bskyed du gzhug go //
analyzed: gzhan dag la spyod pa rlabs po che bsgrags shing mos pa bskyed du gzhug go //
translated: One should proclaim this marvelous conduct to others and encourage them to generate interest in it.

original: rnam par rtog pa shas che ba la ngo mtshar dang ldan pa'i gtam rgyas par bshad pa dga' ba la yang tha mal ba'i gtam spangs te gtam 'di lta bur brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa shas che ba la ngo mtshar dang ldan pa'i gtam rgyas par bshad pa dga' ba la yang tha mal ba'i gtam spangs te gtam 'di lta bur brjod par bya ste /
translated: For those who delight in extensive discourses, one should speak this discourse, having abandoned ordinary conversation.

original: de dag kyang dad pa ma thob par thos pas kyang thar pa'i sa bon 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de dag kyang dad pa ma thob par thos pas kyang thar pa'i sa bon 'jog par byed do //
translated: Even those who have not attained faith, by listening, plant the seed of liberation.

original: mya ngan gyis gdungs pa dang yi chad cing zhum pa dag la mya ngan bsal zhing spro ba bskyed pas bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan gyis gdungs pa dang yi chad cing zhum pa dag la mya ngan bsal zhing spro ba bskyed pas bya ste /
translated: For those afflicted by sorrow, discouraged and depressed, one should dispel their sorrow and generate enthusiasm,

original: 'khor ba'i nyes pa la sogs pa dang 'phangs pa'i dus na yang bya ba de dag dang de lta bu byed na bdag ci'i phyir zhum par byed snyam ste spro ba 'thob pa'o /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes pa la sogs pa dang 'phangs pa'i dus na yang bya ba de dag dang de lta bu byed na bdag ci'i phyir zhum par byed snyam ste spro ba 'thob pa'o /
translated: thinking, If one should do such and such deeds even when in a lowly state due to the faults of cyclic existence, why should I be depressed? and thus attain enthusiasm.

original: // / da ni yi ge'i dka' ba'i gnad cung zad bshad par brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni yi ge'i dka' ba'i gnad cung zad bshad par brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Now I will begin to explain a little of the difficult points of the text.

original: rtsom pa dang 'bral ba'i yan lag tshigs su bcad pa bzhi po 'di ni don gsum du gnas te /
analyzed: rtsom pa dang 'bral ba'i yan lag tshigs su bcad pa bzhi po 'di ni don gsum du gnas te /
translated: These four verses that are branches of the treatise are contained within three topics:

original: brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi khyad par gyis bshad par dam bca' ba dang / dgos pa brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas bshad par dam bca' ba rgyas par bshad pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la mchod par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi khyad par gyis bshad par dam bca' ba dang / dgos pa brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas bshad par dam bca' ba rgyas par bshad pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la mchod par brjod pa'o //
translated: The explanation is preceded by the statement of the subject matter and the purpose, the detailed explanation of the statement of the explanation, and the expression of worship to the Three Jewels.

original: de la brjod bya'i khyad par tshig gsum gyis bstan la /
analyzed: de la brjod bya'i khyad par tshig gsum gyis bstan la /
translated: The distinction of the subject matter is taught by three verses.

original: de rjod byed ji lta bus brjod pa yang rkang pa thams bstan te 'di'i don ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i khyad par don rmad du byung ba de snyan dngags kyi tshig ngo mtshar du gyur pa me tog gi phreng ba lta bus gsal bar bya'o zhes
analyzed: de rjod byed ji lta bus brjod pa yang rkang pa thams bstan te 'di'i don ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i khyad par don rmad du byung ba de snyan dngags kyi tshig ngo mtshar du gyur pa me tog gi phreng ba lta bus gsal bar bya'o zhes
translated: The way in which the explanation is expressed is also taught by all the verses. The meaning of this is: “The marvelous meaning of the distinction of the bodhisattva conduct will be clarified by the marvelous poetic words, like a garland of flowers.”

original: bya ba'o // de la thub pa'i sku tshe snga ma'i spyod pa zhes gsungs pa'i thub pa de ji lta bu zhe na /🔽dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa dang po gnyis te thub pa nyid kyi @280a * //
analyzed: bya ba'o // de la thub pa'i sku tshe snga ma'i spyod pa zhes gsungs pa'i thub pa de ji lta bu zhe na / dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa dang po gnyis te thub pa nyid kyi @280a * //
translated: What is the Sage like, who is said to have the conduct of previous lives?

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //
translated: The first two lines, “Glorious,” and so on, are the qualities of the Sage himself.

original: de dpal ldan ni khyad par gyi gzhi ste tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'byor pa dam pa gnyis dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: de dpal ldan ni khyad par gyi gzhi ste tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'byor pa dam pa gnyis dang ldan par ston to //
translated: Glorious is the special basis, showing that he has the two excellent riches of the perfection of the two collections.

original: yon tan dam pas yongs bzung bkra shis pa ni rang don phun sum tshogs pa ste yon tan dam pas ni stobs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dam pas yongs bzung bkra shis pa ni rang don phun sum tshogs pa ste yon tan dam pas ni stobs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Blessed with sublime qualities is the perfection of one's own goal, sublime qualities being the strengths and so forth.

original: des bzung ba ni de dang ldan pa ste ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: des bzung ba ni de dang ldan pa ste ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Being blessed with them is the perfection of pristine wisdom.

original: bkra shis pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas rgud pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkra shis pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas rgud pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Blessed is the perfection of elimination, because by eliminating all obscurations one transcends all misfortune.

original: grags pa'i gzhir gyur ma smad shin tu yid du 'ong ba ni gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa ste de ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pas rab tu phye ba'i gzugs kyi sku gnyis po'o //
analyzed: grags pa'i gzhir gyur ma smad shin tu yid du 'ong ba ni gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa ste de ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pas rab tu phye ba'i gzugs kyi sku gnyis po'o //
translated: The basis of fame, the uncensured, the most delightful is the perfection of others' goals, which is the two form bodies that are distinguished by benefiting others.

original: grags pa'i gzhir gyur pa ni gnyis ka yang gzhan la grags shing gzhan gyis mthong bas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa'i gzhir gyur pa ni gnyis ka yang gzhan la grags shing gzhan gyis mthong bas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of fame is both, because it benefits others through being renowned to others and being seen by others.

original: ma smad pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste gdul bya mchog gi yul du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma smad pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste gdul bya mchog gi yul du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faultless body is the body of enjoyment, because it is the object of the best disciples.

original: shin tu yid 'ong pa ni sprul pa'i sku ste gdul bya'i bsam pa dang mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu yid 'ong pa ni sprul pa'i sku ste gdul bya'i bsam pa dang mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The very delightful body is the emanation body, because it engages in accordance with the thoughts of disciples.

original: thub pa ni spyi ming bye brag la 'jug pa ste thub pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid yang dag par bsdams pa yin la de thun mong ma yin pa dang ldan pa thub pa'i mchog la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thub pa ni spyi ming bye brag la 'jug pa ste thub pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid yang dag par bsdams pa yin la de thun mong ma yin pa dang ldan pa thub pa'i mchog la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Sage is a general term applied to a specific case, because a sage is one who is restrained in body, speech, and mind, and the supreme sage is one who possesses that restraint in an uncommon way.

original: de'i sku tshe snga ma'i spyod pa stag mo la lus byin pa la sogs pa ni rmad du byung ba ste bya dka' zhing phan 'dogs pa che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sku tshe snga ma'i spyod pa stag mo la lus byin pa la sogs pa ni rmad du byung ba ste bya dka' zhing phan 'dogs pa che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: His body in former lives, such as the gift of his body to a tigress, is marvelous, because it is difficult to do and greatly beneficial.

original: yang na dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thub pa'i sku tshe snga ma nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi spyod pa mdzad pa'i dus kyi yon tan te rang don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thub pa'i sku tshe snga ma nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi spyod pa mdzad pa'i dus kyi yon tan te rang don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, “glorious” and so on are the qualities of the time when the Sage was practicing the conduct in his previous lives, that is, the perfection of his own aim.

original: yon tan dam pas yongs su bzung ba ni zhes rab dang snying rje la sogs pas bzung ba ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dam pas yongs su bzung ba ni zhes rab dang snying rje la sogs pas bzung ba ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Possessed of the highest qualities” means that he is possessed of wisdom, compassion, and so on.

original: bkra shis pa ni ser sna la sogs pa'i dri ma bsal bas rgud pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bkra shis pa ni ser sna la sogs pa'i dri ma bsal bas rgud pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: “Auspicious” means that he has completely pacified misfortune by removing the stains of stinginess and so on.

original: ma smad pa ni bsam pa'i khyad par snying rje chen po'o //🔽shin tu yid du 'ong ba ni gzhan la phan 'dogs dga' ba'i phyir nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang sangs rgyas gsum ka la 'jug pa la las 'dir skabs kyi stobs kyis /
analyzed: ma smad pa ni bsam pa'i khyad par snying rje chen po'o // shin tu yid du 'ong ba ni gzhan la phan 'dogs dga' ba'i phyir nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang sangs rgyas gsum ka la 'jug pa la las 'dir skabs kyi stobs kyis /
translated: “Blameless” means that he has the special thought of great compassion.🔽“Extremely delightful” means that he is the object of the faith of all beings, because he delights in benefiting others.

original: sbyor ba'o // de nyid kyis ni grags pa'i gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'o // de nyid kyis ni grags pa'i gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: “The basis of fame” means that he is the object of the fame of all beings, because he is the basis of the fame of the three vehicles of the hearers, solitary realizers, and buddhas.

original: de bdag gis snyan dngags kyis mchod de rjod byed des brjod bya la dga' ba bskyed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bdag gis snyan dngags kyis mchod de rjod byed des brjod bya la dga' ba bskyed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I will praise it with poetry, and that expression will generate delight in the expressed.

original: me tog snyim pa na gnas pa phul bas dga' ba skye ba'i @280b rgyur gyur pa yin pas de dang chos mthun pas me tog snyim pas gus par mchod ces smos so //
analyzed: me tog snyim pa na gnas pa phul bas dga' ba skye ba'i @280b rgyur gyur pa yin pas de dang chos mthun pas me tog snyim pas gus par mchod ces smos so //
translated: Since the offering of a handful of flowers is the cause of the arising of delight, it is similar to that. Therefore, it is said, “I respectfully praise with a handful of flowers.”

original: dgos pa brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas dam bca' ba rgyas par bshad pa ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dgos pa brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas dam bca' ba rgyas par bshad pa ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: The extensive explanation of the thesis preceded by the statement of the purpose has two verses.

original: dgos pa brjod pa dang dgos pa de dang ldan pa brtsam par zhal gyis bzhes pa ste tshigs su bcad pa re re dang rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dgos pa brjod pa dang dgos pa de dang ldan pa brtsam par zhal gyis bzhes pa ste tshigs su bcad pa re re dang rim pa bzhin no //
translated: The statement of the purpose and the promise to compose that which possesses that purpose are each one verse, respectively.

original: grags pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa 'di rnams kyis te rtogs pas zhes bya ba la tshigs lhag ma'o //
analyzed: grags pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa 'di rnams kyis te rtogs pas zhes bya ba la tshigs lhag ma'o //
translated: By these, which are the signs of fame, I will compose this treatise.

original: grags pa ni snyan dngags so //
analyzed: grags pa ni snyan dngags so //
translated: Fame is poetry.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ni mtshan mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ni mtshan mar gyur pa'o //
translated: The sign of that is the sign.

original: bzod po ni spyod pa bzang po rmad du byung ba 'og nas byang ba 'di rnams kyis te de dag rtogs shing shes bas so //
analyzed: bzod po ni spyod pa bzang po rmad du byung ba 'og nas byang ba 'di rnams kyis te de dag rtogs shing shes bas so //
translated: The patience is the excellent, marvelous conduct, which is taught below. It is by means of these, by means of the realizations and the knowledge of them.

original: 'dir dgos pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa gsum ste /
translated: Here there are three purposes:

original: theg pa chen po'i //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i //
translated: the Great Vehicle,

original: brtsam zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: brtsam zhes sbyar ro //
translated: the commencement is to be supplied.

original: lam gsal bar byas pa dang / bstan pa lam zhugs pa dad par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa thun mong ba dang bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams chos dang mthun pa'i gtam gyis dga' ba ste /
analyzed: lam gsal bar byas pa dang / bstan pa lam zhugs pa dad par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa thun mong ba dang bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams chos dang mthun pa'i gtam gyis dga' ba ste /
translated: The path is clarified, and those who have entered the path of the teaching become faithful, and those who have entered the teaching of the common vehicle are delighted by the discourse in accord with the Dharma.

original: tshig gsum dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gsum dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is according to the three phrases and their order.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
translated: This is merely an illustration.

original: dgos pa de dang ldan pas rtsom pa ni snyan dngags 'di brtsams so zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgos pa de dang ldan pas rtsom pa ni snyan dngags 'di brtsams so zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The commencement which has that purpose is to be supplied as I composed this poetry.

original: snyan dngags de yang spros pas 'jigs pa la brjod bya bsdus pas khyad par du byas pa ste 'jig rten mchog gi spong ba dam pa'i phyogs tsam gyis shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: snyan dngags de yang spros pas 'jigs pa la brjod bya bsdus pas khyad par du byas pa ste 'jig rten mchog gi spong ba dam pa'i phyogs tsam gyis shes par bya ba ste /
translated: And that poetry is distinguished by the brevity of its subject matter for those who fear verbosity, and it is to be understood by just a portion of the excellent abandonment of the supreme in the world.

original: rdzogs po ni mtha' yas pas brjod mar mi nus so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs po ni mtha' yas pas brjod mar mi nus so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The perfection is limitless, so it cannot be expressed.

original: 'jig rten na mchog tu gyur pa'i gang zag ni byang chub sems dpa' yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na mchog tu gyur pa'i gang zag ni byang chub sems dpa' yin la /
translated: The person who is supreme in the world is the bodhisattva.

original: de'i spyod shin tu nyung ngu //
analyzed: de'i spyod shin tu nyung ngu //
translated: His conduct is very little.

original: pa ni spyod pa gzhan las dam pa'i spyod pa ste de ni mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ni spyod pa gzhan las dam pa'i spyod pa ste de ni mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conduct is the highest conduct among other conducts, because it is supreme.

original: des ni brjod bya bsdus pas khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: des ni brjod bya bsdus pas khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: By that, it is distinguished by the inclusion of what is to be expressed.

original: rjod byed rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjod byed rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the purity of the expression,

original: mnyan du rung bar bya ba'i phyir lung dang gtsug lag rig par mi 'gal lam ngag gis 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mnyan du rung bar bya ba'i phyir lung dang gtsug lag rig par mi 'gal lam ngag gis 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in order to make it suitable to be heard, it is composed with speech that is not contrary to scripture and tradition.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i /
translated: The wise people of the śrāvakas and so forth,

original: mkhas pa'i skye bas don bzang zhing tshig spel legs pas /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i skye bas don bzang zhing tshig spel legs pas /
translated: with good meaning and good composition,

original: mnyan du rung bar bya ba'i phyir ram mched du lung bla ma brgyud pa dang mi 'gal ba dang / gtsug lag ni bka' dang mi 'gal ba dang / rig pa ni tshad ma dang rang gi tshig dang mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: mnyan du rung bar bya ba'i phyir ram mched du lung bla ma brgyud pa dang mi 'gal ba dang / gtsug lag ni bka' dang mi 'gal ba dang / rig pa ni tshad ma dang rang gi tshig dang mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: In order to make it worthy of being heard, it is not in conflict with the lineage of gurus who have transmitted the teachings, it is not in conflict with the scriptures, it is not in conflict with logic, and it is not in conflict with one's own words.

original: de lta bu'i lam ni tshul te thabs su gyur pa'i tshig go //🔽de @281a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i lam ni tshul te thabs su gyur pa'i tshig go // de @281a * //
translated: Such a path is the method, the means, the words.🔽Thus, thinking that it will be of benefit in the world,

original: ltar 'jig rten pa'i don 'gyur snyam nas zhes bya ba ni snga ma dgos pa gsum dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ltar 'jig rten pa'i don 'gyur snyam nas zhes bya ba ni snga ma dgos pa gsum dang sbyar ro //
translated: one should apply the three purposes mentioned above.

original: 'di brtsams zhes bya ba ni brjod bya'i khyad par te rjod par byed pa'i ngag dri ma med pa 'og nas 'byung ba 'di ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di brtsams zhes bya ba ni brjod bya'i khyad par te rjod par byed pa'i ngag dri ma med pa 'og nas 'byung ba 'di ces bya ba'o //
translated: Having composed this, which is the particular subject matter, the stainless speech that expresses it is called this.

original: de ltar dgos pa brjod nas yul khyad par can la phyag 'tshal bas bsod nams 'phel ba (phyi nang gi bar chad zhi bas/) ni rtsom pa mthar phyin pa'i yan lag yin pas dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar dgos pa brjod nas yul khyad par can la phyag 'tshal bas bsod nams 'phel ba (phyi nang gi bar chad zhi bas/) ni rtsom pa mthar phyin pa'i yan lag yin pas dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal bar byed de /
translated: Having thus stated the purpose, the increase of merit through paying homage to the special object, which is a branch of completing the composition, is done by paying homage to the Three Jewels.

original: de la sangs rgyas ni rgyu thun mong ma yin pa dang rang gi ngo bo thun mong ba ma yin pa'i yon (phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa/) tan gyis gzhan las khyad par du 'phags par ston te /🔽de la thun mong ma yin pa'i rang don brtson pas gzhan don brtson pa /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas ni rgyu thun mong ma yin pa dang rang gi ngo bo thun mong ba ma yin pa'i yon (phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa/) tan gyis gzhan las khyad par du 'phags par ston te / de la thun mong ma yin pa'i rang don brtson pas gzhan don brtson pa /
translated: Here, Buddha is shown to be superior to others by means of his uncommon cause and his uncommon essence.

original: gang yin pa'o //🔽yon tan bsgrub pa bzang po'i rjes su mthun ma gyur //
analyzed: gang yin pa'o // yon tan bsgrub pa bzang po'i rjes su mthun ma gyur //
translated: The uncommon is the one who strives for the benefit of others through striving for his own benefit.

original: ces bya ba ste rang don brtson pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yin la /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste rang don brtson pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yin la /
translated: The one who strives for his own benefit is the Sravaka and Pratyekabuddha.

original: gzhan don brtson pa gang yin pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa bzang po ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: gzhan don brtson pa gang yin pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa bzang po ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The one who strives for the benefit of others is the Bodhisattva, who is the one who has the excellent practice of the qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa nyid yon tan bsgrub pa yin la de nyid legs shing phan pas bzang po ste yon tan de mchog yin pas nyan thos kyi rjes su mthun par ma gyur te shin tu dman pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi don du zhugs pa nyid yon tan bsgrub pa yin la de nyid legs shing phan pas bzang po ste yon tan de mchog yin pas nyan thos kyi rjes su mthun par ma gyur te shin tu dman pas so //
