translated: The bodhisattva's very engagement in the benefit of others is the accomplishment of good qualities. Since that is good and beneficial, it is excellent. Since that quality is supreme, it is not in accord with the śrāvakas, because it is far superior.

original: yang na rang don brtson pas gzhan don brtson pa gang yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan bsgrub pa de mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bzang po'i rjes su mthun par gyur ces pa'i don to
analyzed: yang na rang don brtson pas gzhan don brtson pa gang yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan bsgrub pa de mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bzang po'i rjes su mthun par gyur ces pa'i don to
translated: Or else, the bodhisattva who strives for the benefit of others with the striving for his own benefit, who accomplishes the good qualities of the six perfections, is in accord with excellent nonabiding nirvana.

original: // des na khyad par du gyur pa'i yon tan de ni rgyus bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: // des na khyad par du gyur pa'i yon tan de ni rgyus bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, that special quality is summarized by its cause.

original: rang bzhin gyi yon tan ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yon tan ni /
translated: The quality of nature is

original: thams cad mkhyen ces brjod pa ma nor gsal bar grags zhes smos te nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te shes bya'i sgrib pa yang ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen ces brjod pa ma nor gsal bar grags zhes smos te nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te shes bya'i sgrib pa yang ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “known as omniscient and clearly renowned” refers to the fact that the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are not omniscient because they have not eliminated the obscurations to knowledge.

original: des na sangs rgyas la thams cad mkhyen ces brjod pa ste /
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas la thams cad mkhyen ces brjod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha is called “omniscient.”

original: don dang ldan pa'i brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “known as omniscient and clearly renowned.”

original: yang na 'di dag ni phyi rol pa'i ston pa thams cad mkhyen par 'du shes pa drang srong chen po gzegs zan dang ser skya la sogs pa'am khyab 'jug dang tshangs pa la sogs pa las khyad par du ston te /
analyzed: yang na 'di dag ni phyi rol pa'i ston pa thams cad mkhyen par 'du shes pa drang srong chen po gzegs zan dang ser skya la sogs pa'am khyab 'jug dang tshangs pa la sogs pa las khyad par du ston te /
translated: Alternatively, this phrase distinguishes the Buddha from the non-Buddhist teachers who are regarded as omniscient, such as the great sages Kanada and Kapila, and also from Vishnu, Brahma, and so on.

original: de dag ni rang gi don la brtson te 'tshe ba la sogs pas bdag nyid kyi don bsgrub ste @281b lha las phul du byung ba'i bstod par bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi don la brtson te 'tshe ba la sogs pas bdag nyid kyi don bsgrub ste @281b lha las phul du byung ba'i bstod par bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: These teachers strive for their own benefit and accomplish their own goal through violence and so on, as explained in the hymn to the Buddha that praises him as superior to the gods.

original: gzhan gyi don la brtson pa gang yin pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa bzang po de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la brtson pa gang yin pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa bzang po de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The excellence of the accomplishment of the benefit of others is the perfect accomplishment of the benefit of others by the Tathagata.

original: de'i rjes su mu stegs byed kyi ston pa mthun pa ma yin la 'di ni thams cad mkhyen ces brjod pa ma nor gsal bar grags te brjod pa don dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mu stegs byed kyi ston pa mthun pa ma yin la 'di ni thams cad mkhyen ces brjod pa ma nor gsal bar grags te brjod pa don dang mthun pa'o //
translated: After that, the non-Buddhist teachers are not in accord, but this one is said to be omniscient, clearly renowned without error, and expressed in accord with its meaning.

original: yang na tshig rkang pa dang po gnyis kyis ni gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: yang na tshig rkang pa dang po gnyis kyis ni gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: Or else, the first two lines teach the perfect accomplishment of the benefit of others.

original: phyi rol pa dang thar (nyan thos la sogs pa/) pa thob pa'i skye bo las khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan don bsgrub pa'i thabs la gnas par ston la /
analyzed: phyi rol pa dang thar (nyan thos la sogs pa/) pa thob pa'i skye bo las khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan don bsgrub pa'i thabs la gnas par ston la /
translated: It teaches that he is superior to non-Buddhists and to beings who have attained liberation, and that he abides in the means of accomplishing the benefit of others.

original: rkang pa gsum pas ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rkang pa gsum pas ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The third line teaches the perfect accomplishment of his own goal.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni sgrib pa thams cad zad pa'i mkhyen pa yin pas spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni sgrib pa thams cad zad pa'i mkhyen pa yin pas spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Omniscience is the knowledge that all obscurations have been exhausted, and so the excellence of abandonment and the excellence of primordial wisdom are taught.

original: de nyid kyis ni mnyam med phyi rol pa 'am slob pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni mnyam med phyi rol pa 'am slob pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is by virtue of that that he is superior to all non-Buddhists and to all Buddhist trainees.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas la bstod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas la bstod nas /
translated: Having thus praised the Buddha,

original: chos dang dge 'dun zhes smos te /
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun zhes smos te /
translated: he mentions the Dharma and the Sangha.

original: ston pa de'i (chos/) bstan (dge 'dun/) pa dang slob (dge 'dun/) pa'i tshogs dag yin te /
analyzed: ston pa de'i (chos/) bstan (dge 'dun/) pa dang slob (dge 'dun/) pa'i tshogs dag yin te /
translated: The Dharma is the teaching of that Teacher, and the Sangha is the assembly of trainees.

original: dkon mchog gsum la spyi bos btud pa ni phyag 'tshal ba ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la spyi bos btud pa ni phyag 'tshal ba ste /
translated: Bowing one’s head to the Three Jewels is paying homage.

original: phyag 'tshal ba ni bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba ni bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
translated: Paying homage is a particular action.

original: mgo sa la gtugs pa ni gtso bo yin pas de smos te /
analyzed: mgo sa la gtugs pa ni gtso bo yin pas de smos te /
translated: Bowing one’s head to the ground is the main part of that action, and so it is mentioned.

original: yon tan brjod pas ngag sngon du 'gro bas yid ma smos (dngos su/) kyang grub ste /
analyzed: yon tan brjod pas ngag sngon du 'gro bas yid ma smos (dngos su/) kyang grub ste /
translated: Even though the mind is not mentioned explicitly, it is included by the expression of praise, which is preceded by speech.

original: don gyis las gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: don gyis las gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: So the homage is in fact of the nature of the three kinds of action.

original: yang na rtsom pa dang 'brel pa'i don gsum du gnas te /
analyzed: yang na rtsom pa dang 'brel pa'i don gsum du gnas te /
translated: Alternatively, it is contained in three topics related to composition:

original: rgyu'i che ba la mchod pa (bsdus don 'di legs/) brjod pa dang / dgos pa brjod pa'i sgo nas rgyu'i che ba de bshad par dam bca' ba dang / dam bcas pas mthar phyin pa'i yan lag 'bras bu dkon mchog gsum la mchod par brjod pa de /
analyzed: rgyu'i che ba la mchod pa (bsdus don 'di legs/) brjod pa dang / dgos pa brjod pa'i sgo nas rgyu'i che ba de bshad par dam bca' ba dang / dam bcas pas mthar phyin pa'i yan lag 'bras bu dkon mchog gsum la mchod par brjod pa de /
translated: the greatness of the cause is stated by way of the expression of worship, the promise to explain the greatness of the cause by way of the statement of purpose, and the expression of worship to the three jewels, the result that is the branch of completing the promise,

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig dang gnyis dang gcig gis rim pa bzhin no //🔽de la don dang po yang yul gang la gang zag gis /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig dang gnyis dang gcig gis rim pa bzhin no // de la don dang po yang yul gang la gang zag gis /
translated: respectively by one, two, and one verse.

original: mchod pa'i dngos po gang gis mchod pa ston te /
analyzed: mchod pa'i dngos po gang gis mchod pa ston te /
translated: The first topic is also shown by the object, the person, and the thing offered in worship.

original: yul ni rkang pa dang po gsum mo //
analyzed: yul ni rkang pa dang po gsum mo //
translated: The object is the first three lines.

original: gang zag ni bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The person is “I” .

original: mchod pa'i dngos po ni snyan dngags me tog snyim pa yis so //
analyzed: mchod pa'i dngos po ni snyan dngags me tog snyim pa yis so //
translated: The thing offered in worship is “with the flower-filled palms of poetry.🔽”

original: yul ni thub pa'i sku tshe snga ma'i spyod pa @282a * //🔽rmad du byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: yul ni thub pa'i sku tshe snga ma'i spyod pa @282a * //🔽rmad du byung ba rnams so //
translated: The object is the marvelous deeds of the Muni in his previous lives.

original: khyad par du byed pa'i thub pa nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par du byed pa'i thub pa nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The special explanation of the Sage himself is:

original: dpal ldan yon tan dam pa yongs bzung bkra shis pa //
analyzed: dpal ldan yon tan dam pa yongs bzung bkra shis pa //
translated: Glorious, holding the highest of virtues, auspicious,

original: grags pa'i gzhir gyur ma smad shin tu yid du 'ong //
analyzed: grags pa'i gzhir gyur ma smad shin tu yid du 'ong //
translated: the basis of fame, irreproachable, very pleasing.

original: zhes pa'o // de'i ye ge'i don snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de'i ye ge'i don snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.

original: yang na sku tshe snga ma'i spyod pa rmad du byung ba nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang na sku tshe snga ma'i spyod pa rmad du byung ba nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Or, what is the marvelous conduct of his former lives?

original: dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste yi ge'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste yi ge'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Glorious, etc. The meaning of the words is as before.

original: rgyu'i che ba de bshad par dam bca' ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i che ba de bshad par dam bca' ba ni /
translated: The vow to explain that greatness of cause is:

original: 'jig rten mchog gi spyod pa dam pa'i phyogs tsam gyis /
analyzed: 'jig rten mchog gi spyod pa dam pa'i phyogs tsam gyis /
translated: By just a portion of the conduct of the supreme ones in the world,

original: bdag gis snyan dngags 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gis snyan dngags 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I have composed this poetry.

original: yi ge'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.

original: de yang dgos pa gang gis rtsom zhe na /
analyzed: de yang dgos pa gang gis rtsom zhe na /
translated: And for what purpose is it composed?

original: grags pa'i mtshan ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig ste yi ge'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: grags pa'i mtshan ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig ste yi ge'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One verse on the sign of fame:

original: dam bcas pa de mthar phyin pa'i yan lag rgyu'i che ba de'i 'bras bu thun mong ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang de'i chos dang de sgrub pa'i dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dam bcas pa de mthar phyin pa'i yan lag rgyu'i che ba de'i 'bras bu thun mong ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang de'i chos dang de sgrub pa'i dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: The homage to the Jewel of the Buddha, his Dharma, and the community of his followers, who are endowed with the uncommon result of that cause, is the limb of the cause, the great cause for the completion of that commitment.

original: rang don bsgrub ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni gcig ste yi ge'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rang don bsgrub ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni gcig ste yi ge'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The one verse beginning with the words “having attained the aim of self and other” has the same meaning as the words above.

original: rgyu med par byams pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i byams pa'i rgyur grags pa'i mdza' bshes dang phan btags pa la sogs pa med pas (rgyu med/) yin gyi byang chub kyi sems rab tu goms pa'i rgyu mchog tu gyur pa ni med pa ma yin no
analyzed: rgyu med par byams pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i byams pa'i rgyur grags pa'i mdza' bshes dang phan btags pa la sogs pa med pas (rgyu med/) yin gyi byang chub kyi sems rab tu goms pa'i rgyu mchog tu gyur pa ni med pa ma yin no
translated: “Love without a cause” means that it is without a cause, such as a friend or benefactor, which is known as the cause of worldly love. But it is not without the supreme cause, which is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: // bla ma'i don ni gsum gyis te /
analyzed: // bla ma'i don ni gsum gyis te /
translated: The meaning of “guru” is threefold:

original: bla mar byed pa dang / bla ma mgu ba byas pa dang / bla mar gyur pa ste tshig gsum dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bla mar byed pa dang / bla ma mgu ba byas pa dang / bla mar gyur pa ste tshig gsum dang sbyar ro //
translated: to be made into a guru, to be pleased as a guru, and to be a guru.

original: skyes pa'i las byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa btsas ston dang skra mtshams dbye ba'i cho ga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i las byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa btsas ston dang skra mtshams dbye ba'i cho ga la sogs pa'o //
translated: The rites of birth are the rites of the feast of birth, the rite of the first feeding, the rite of the first walking, the rite of the first words, and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis yid gsungs pa ni skyes thob kyi yon tan gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yid gsungs pa ni skyes thob kyi yon tan gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The natural mental disposition is the special quality of the innate virtues.

original: dkon mchog gsum gong mar byed pas/(/ rang nyid kyi bsgrub pa'i mchod pa/) rang nyid gzhan ni /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gong mar byed pas/(/ rang nyid kyi bsgrub pa'i mchod pa/) rang nyid gzhan ni /
translated: The worship of the Three Jewels is the worship of the Three Jewels by oneself and others.

original: mgon skyabs kyi khyad par ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o ;
analyzed: mgon skyabs kyi khyad par ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o ;
translated: The special protection is the protection by the spiritual friend.

original: / shes pa ched cher 'dzin pa dang le lo med pa ni sbyor ba'i khyad par te gus par sbyor ba dang rgyun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: / shes pa ched cher 'dzin pa dang le lo med pa ni sbyor ba'i khyad par te gus par sbyor ba dang rgyun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The special application is the application with devotion and the continuous application.

original: rig pa'i gnas bco brgyad ni /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas bco brgyad ni /
translated: The eighteen branches of learning are:

original: rol mo dang / 'khrig pa'i thabs dang / mtshon cha dang / grangs dang / sgra dang / gso dpyad dang / chos lugs dang / @282b bzo dang / 'phangs spyad dang / gtan tshigs dang / rnal 'byor dang / thos pa dang / dran pa dang /
analyzed: rol mo dang / 'khrig pa'i thabs dang / mtshon cha dang / grangs dang / sgra dang / gso dpyad dang / chos lugs dang / @282b bzo dang / 'phangs spyad dang / gtan tshigs dang / rnal 'byor dang / thos pa dang / dran pa dang /
translated: music, sexual techniques, weapons, numbers, sounds, medicine, religion, arts, archery, logic, yoga, learning, memory,

original: skar ma'i dpyad dang / rtsis dang / mig 'phrul dang / sngon gyi rabs dang / sngon byung ba'o //
analyzed: skar ma'i dpyad dang / rtsis dang / mig 'phrul dang / sngon gyi rabs dang / sngon byung ba'o //
translated: astronomy, calculation, magic, past lives, and former events.

original: de la slob dpon gyis go 'phang thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyis go 'phang thob pa yin te /
translated: The master has attained the state of perfection in these.

original: de dag mthar phyin par lobs (mda' bo che 'phen gzhan gyi slob dpon/) pa'o//
analyzed: de dag mthar phyin par lobs (mda' bo che 'phen gzhan gyi slob dpon/) pa'o//

translated: Arts means magic, writing, calculation, numbers, accounting, memory, topknots, walking, hook techniques, sword techniques,

analyzed: zhags pa gdab pa dang / pa'i thabs dang / 'phong gi slob dpon dang / mdun du bsgyur ba dang / phyir sgyur ba dang / gcad pa dang / dran ba dang / dbug pa dang / rgyab nas rdeg pa dang / sgra grag par 'phog pa dang / gnad du phog pa dang / mi 'chor bar phog pa dang / gnas lnga la byang ba dang / mchongs pa dang / gyad kyi 'dzin stangs dang / bong dang / rgyal ba dang / glang po che'i gnyar bzhon pa dang / shing rta'i thabs dang /
translated: the lasso, the method of striking, the master of archery, turning forward, turning back, cutting, remembering, piercing, striking from behind, striking with a sound,🔽striking a vital point, striking without missing, skill in the five places, jumping, the wrestler's hold, the goat, the victor, riding an elephant's back, the method of the chariot,

original: de dag la slob dpon gyi go 'phang thob pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la slob dpon gyi go 'phang thob pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And they attain the level of master in the same way as before.🔽

original: rig byed shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni bram zes bkur ba dang ; rgyal rigs kyis bkur pa dang gang zag spyir thams cad kyis bkur pa dang slob ma'i tshogs la phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par gyis bstod de /
analyzed: rig byed shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni bram zes bkur ba dang ; rgyal rigs kyis bkur pa dang gang zag spyir thams cad kyis bkur pa dang slob ma'i tshogs la phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par gyis bstod de /
translated: The meaning of the verse beginning with “knowing the Vedas” is praised by the distinction of being revered by Brahmins, by the warrior class, by all people in general, and by the assembly of disciples.

original: rig byed shes pa'i bram ze rnams kyis tshangs pa ltar bkur pa ste /
analyzed: rig byed shes pa'i bram ze rnams kyis tshangs pa ltar bkur pa ste /
translated: Brahmins who know the Vedas revere him as if he were Brahma.

original: rig byed ni tshangs pas dran pa dang de las ches mkhas pa med par grags pa ltar /
analyzed: rig byed ni tshangs pas dran pa dang de las ches mkhas pa med par grags pa ltar /
translated: Just as Brahma is known to be remembered by the Vedas and to be the most learned in them,

original: bdag nyid chen po yang rig byed shin tu mkhas par grags pa'i phyir tshangs pa gnyis pa lta bur 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po yang rig byed shin tu mkhas par grags pa'i phyir tshangs pa gnyis pa lta bur 'du shes pa'o //
translated: the great being is also known to be very learned in the Vedas, so he is perceived as a second Brahma.

original: de la rig byed ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rig byed ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three Vedas:

original: des brjod dang / snyan dngags dang / mchod sbyin no //
analyzed: des brjod dang / snyan dngags dang / mchod sbyin no //
translated: the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, and the Sama Veda.

original: kha cig ni srid bsrung ba dang bzhi @283a * //
analyzed: kha cig ni srid bsrung ba dang bzhi @283a * //
translated: Some add the Atharva Veda as a fourth.

original: 'don no // rig byed de yan lag dang bcas pa dang nye ba'i yan lag dang bcas pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: 'don no // rig byed de yan lag dang bcas pa dang nye ba'i yan lag dang bcas pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: He recites.🔽He is skilled in the Vedas with their branches and in the subsidiary arts.

original: tshe'i rig byed gso dpyad dang skar ma'i dpyad la sogs pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i rig byed gso dpyad dang skar ma'i dpyad la sogs pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in the Vedas of longevity, medicine, astrology and so on.

original: rgyal po rnams kyis bkur bas na rgyal po'i mchog 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po rnams kyis bkur bas na rgyal po'i mchog 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa'o //
translated: He is honored by kings, like the supreme king, the universal emperor and so on.

original: skye dgus spyir mthong ba dga' zhing ngo mtshar gyi gnas su 'dzin pas brgya byin mngon sum du mthong ba lta bur 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: skye dgus spyir mthong ba dga' zhing ngo mtshar gyi gnas su 'dzin pas brgya byin mngon sum du mthong ba lta bur 'du shes pa'o //
translated: He is perceived as Indra, the lord of the gods, because he is seen by all beings as a source of joy and wonder.

original: shes 'dod ni rig byed la sogs pa slob pa don du gnyer ba'i slob ma rnams te de dag gi don spyod nus pas phas bu'i don bsgrub pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: shes 'dod ni rig byed la sogs pa slob pa don du gnyer ba'i slob ma rnams te de dag gi don spyod nus pas phas bu'i don bsgrub pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: He is a teacher of the Vedas and so on, who is able to benefit his disciples who seek to learn the Vedas and so on, like a father who accomplishes the aims of his son.

original: skal ba dang ldan pa ni skyes thob kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa ni skyes thob kyi yon tan no //
translated: He is fortunate, possessing qualities obtained at birth.

original: yon tan khyad par du gyur pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par du gyur pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
translated: He has special qualities, those obtained from training.

original: dgongs bsgrub bzhin du de'i slob mar gyur zhes bya ba la dgongs pa grub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dgongs bsgrub bzhin du de'i slob mar gyur zhes bya ba la dgongs pa grub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The meaning of just as he intended, he became his disciple is as follows: The one who has accomplished his intention is the bodhisattva.

original: de dang mthun pa de bzhin du ste de'i rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa de bzhin du ste de'i rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: In accordance with him means in accordance with that, following it.

original: bu bu zhes gnyis brjod pa mi rings pa dang ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: bu bu zhes gnyis brjod pa mi rings pa dang ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The repetition of son, son expresses slowness and amazement.

original: byams pa'i mtshams las 'das zhes bya ba ni byams pa'i mtshams ni byams pa shin tu chung yang bdag gam bdag gi bu la byams pa yin la de yang med pas de las 'das pa'o//
analyzed: byams pa'i mtshams las 'das zhes bya ba ni byams pa'i mtshams ni byams pa shin tu chung yang bdag gam bdag gi bu la byams pa yin la de yang med pas de las 'das pa'o//
translated: Having gone beyond the limit of love means that the limit of love is the love for oneself or one's son, even if it is very little, and that has been eliminated.

original: 'dam bu mes tshig bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dam bu mes tshig pa ni zhum zhing thal bar myur du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dam bu mes tshig bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dam bu mes tshig pa ni zhum zhing thal bar myur du 'gyur te /
translated: Like a reed burned by fire means that a reed burned by fire quickly withers and becomes ash.

original: de bzhin du 'gyod pas zhum zhing rtsol ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gyod pas zhum zhing rtsol ba med pa'o //
translated: Likewise, through regret, one withers and becomes inactive.

original: phrug gu bsad las gcen mo bsrung ba dang zhes bya ba ni phrug gu bsad pa las bsrung ba ni rgyu gang gis bsad pa las bsrung zhe na /
analyzed: phrug gu bsad las gcen mo bsrung ba dang zhes bya ba ni phrug gu bsad pa las bsrung ba ni rgyu gang gis bsad pa las bsrung zhe na /
translated: Protecting the elder sister from killing the infant means that the protection from killing the infant is by what cause one is protected from killing.

original: gcen mo bsrung ste gsod du mi gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: gcen mo bsrung ste gsod du mi gzhug pa'o //
translated: The mother protects her cub, and does not allow it to be killed.

original: gcen mo las kyang de'i phrug gu bsrung zhes bya ba ni gcan mo'i srog bsrungs ba las kyang ma'i nu zho'i stobs kyis phrug gu bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: gcen mo las kyang de'i phrug gu bsrung zhes bya ba ni gcan mo'i srog bsrungs ba las kyang ma'i nu zho'i stobs kyis phrug gu bsrung ba'o //
translated: The cub is protected by the strength of the mother's milk, even more than by the protection of her life.

original: sku gdung rin chen ni sku gdung nyid rin chen yin pas de'i mchod rten la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sku gdung rin chen ni sku gdung nyid rin chen yin pas de'i mchod rten la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The jewel of the body is the body itself, which is a jewel, and the stupa is so called because it contains that.

original: de 'dzin cing ldan pa'i sa gzhi khengs par byas te /
analyzed: de 'dzin cing ldan pa'i sa gzhi khengs par byas te /
translated: The ground is filled with those who hold it and possess it.

original: gang gis zhe na sngar gyi 'phreng ba la sogs pa'i char gyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhe na sngar gyi 'phreng ba la sogs pa'i char gyis so //
translated: By what? By the former rain of garlands, etc.

original: stag mo la lus byin pa'i rabs te rtogs pa brjod pa dang po'o /
analyzed: stag mo la lus byin pa'i rabs te rtogs pa brjod pa dang po'o /
translated: This is the story of the gift of his body to the tigress, the first chapter of the story.

original: // / spro ba ni bsam ba sems can gyi don la mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: // / spro ba ni bsam ba sems can gyi don la mi skyo ba'o //
translated: Exertion is the intention, the non-discouragement in the aim of sentient beings.

original: gsang tshig ni nang blon po rnams @283b la smra ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: gsang tshig ni nang blon po rnams @283b la smra ba'i khyad par te /
translated: The secret words are the special speech to the inner ministers,

original: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa 'gro ba'o //
translated: the going of what is to be done and what is not to be done.🔽 The power of majesty is the great fame of good form.

original: gzi byin gyi mthu ni gzugs bzang zhing dbang che bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: gzi byin gyi mthu ni gzugs bzang zhing dbang che bar grags pa'o //
translated: The power of splendor is having a good body and being famous for having great power.🔽

original: skal ba phun sum tshogs pa ni sngon bsod nams bsags pas rang bzhin gyis gzhan 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: skal ba phun sum tshogs pa ni sngon bsod nams bsags pas rang bzhin gyis gzhan 'dun pa'o //
translated: The excellence of fortune is the natural inclination of others due to the accumulation of merit in the past.

original: de la 'khor gsum rjes mthun yon tan tshogs //
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum rjes mthun yon tan tshogs //
translated: The assembly of qualities is in harmony with the three circles

original: phan tshun 'dren pa bzhin du gnas par gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan tshun 'dren pa bzhin du gnas par gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and abides as if mutually drawing each other.🔽Here, the three circles are the prosperity of the people, etc.

original: 'khor gsum ni 'bangs la sogs pa'i gros mthun pa'i srid dang / longs spyod kyi 'byor pa dang / yon tan gyi zhing dang / sdug bsngal ba la sbyin brgya chen po byed pa'i chos kyi 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor gsum ni 'bangs la sogs pa'i gros mthun pa'i srid dang / longs spyod kyi 'byor pa dang / yon tan gyi zhing dang / sdug bsngal ba la sbyin brgya chen po byed pa'i chos kyi 'byor pa ste /
translated: , the prosperity of wealth, the field of qualities, and the prosperity of Dharma, which is the great giving to the suffering.

original: de rjes su mthun zhing 'tsham pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs gcig pas gcig bzang pas phan tshun 'gran pa bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su mthun zhing 'tsham pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs gcig pas gcig bzang pas phan tshun 'gran pa bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: Since the assembly of qualities is in harmony with and suitable for those, they are mutually excellent as if competing with each other.

original: dngos po thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni yon tan gyi dngos po'am 'dod pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni yon tan gyi dngos po'am 'dod pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The complete perfection of all things is the thing of qualities or the thing of desire.

original: slu ba'i tshig ni rtsub mo de'i bskyin pa bsab pa ni ci yang med ces bya ba slu ba'i tshig nyid rtsub pa ste mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slu ba'i tshig ni rtsub mo de'i bskyin pa bsab pa ni ci yang med ces bya ba slu ba'i tshig nyid rtsub pa ste mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The repayment of the harsh words is the harsh words of deception, because they establish a result that is not desired.

original: de'i bskyin pa bsab pa ni ci yang med de de dge ba 'ba' zhig gis phan par 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: de'i bskyin pa bsab pa ni ci yang med de de dge ba 'ba' zhig gis phan par 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: There is no repayment at all, because there is no benefit from virtue alone.

original: ae ma'o rlabs che ba ni spyod ba khyad par can no //
analyzed: ae ma'o rlabs che ba ni spyod ba khyad par can no //
translated: “Oh, how great!” is the special conduct.

original: ae ma'o snying rje che ba ni bsam pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: ae ma'o snying rje che ba ni bsam pa'i khyad par te /
translated: “Oh, how compassionate!” is the special thought.

original: sngar gyi gtong ba'i bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi gtong ba'i bsngags pa'o //
translated: This is the praise of the previous generosity.

original: de'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i chos la mngon sum du byas pas na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i chos la mngon sum du byas pas na /
translated: The result of that is made manifest in the present life.

original: 'di'i sems ni ji ltar rnam dag ltos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sems ni ji ltar rnam dag ltos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, “Look how pure his mind is!”

original: gnyi ga'i yon tan gyis (las tshig ngan bas bskyin pa 'jal/) ae ma'o zhes bya ba phyed 'og ma'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yon tan gyis (las tshig ngan bas bskyin pa 'jal/) ae ma'o zhes bya ba phyed 'og ma'o //
translated: “Oh!” is the second half of the verse.

original: khyod kyis byin gyis rgyal ba ni dge ba byas pas dus phyis bde legs gyi khyad par thob pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis byin gyis rgyal ba ni dge ba byas pas dus phyis bde legs gyi khyad par thob pa'o //
translated: “You have been blessed by giving” means that through virtuous action one obtains a special excellence in the future.

original: byin dang spyod pas nor rnams don yod byas //
analyzed: byin dang spyod pas nor rnams don yod byas //
translated: Wealth is made meaningful by giving and by using it.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la byin pas don yod pa ni gtong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la byin pas don yod pa ni gtong ba'o //
translated: Giving it to others makes it meaningful by relinquishing it.

original: spyad pas don yod pa ni len pa pos so //
analyzed: spyad pas don yod pa ni len pa pos so //
translated: Using it makes it meaningful by the recipients.

original: yang na byin pas sbyin bdag la don yod la bdag gis spyad pas kyang bdag gi lus rtas pas dge ba la sogs pa bsgrubs pas bdag la don yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na byin pas sbyin bdag la don yod la bdag gis spyad pas kyang bdag gi lus rtas pas dge ba la sogs pa bsgrubs pas bdag la don yod pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, giving it makes it meaningful for the giver, and using it makes it meaningful for oneself, since one’s body is nourished and one can practice virtue and so on.

original: 'jig rten 'di la grags pa che ba 'byung la tshe gzhan du bde ba 'byung ba'i lam yin pas 'jig rten 'di dang zhes rkang pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di la grags pa che ba 'byung la tshe gzhan du bde ba 'byung ba'i lam yin pas 'jig rten 'di dang zhes rkang pa gnyis so //
translated: The two lines “It is the path to great fame in this world and to happiness in other lives” show that the result of generosity is the attainment of great fame in this world and the attainment of happiness in other lives.

original: de ltar rim gro bskyed de bsod nams bsags pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rim gro bskyed de bsod nams bsags pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should generate respect and accumulate merit.

original: 'bras bu @284a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu @284a * //
translated: The result

original: yid du 'ong la tshe 'di las byung bar bstan cing go bar byas pa yin no //🔽yid du 'ong ba ji lta bu zhe na me tog lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong la tshe 'di las byung bar bstan cing go bar byas pa yin no // yid du 'ong ba ji lta bu zhe na me tog lta bu'o //
translated: is shown to be desirable and to arise from this life.🔽What is desirable? It is like a flower.

original: me tog 'dra ba gang zhe na bdag gis mthu chen po thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: me tog 'dra ba gang zhe na bdag gis mthu chen po thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: What is like a flower? It is the attainment of great power.

original: smon lam gyi khyad par mchog thob pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi khyad par mchog thob pa'o //
translated: He attained the highest distinction in his prayers.

original: de'i grags pa ni dus rgyun yun ring du rjes su 'brel bas grags pas rgyun chags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i grags pa ni dus rgyun yun ring du rjes su 'brel bas grags pas rgyun chags pa'o //
translated: His fame is continuous because it is connected with a long period of time.

original: des na phyis kyi skye bo rnams bsod nams la spro ba bskyed par bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: des na phyis kyi skye bo rnams bsod nams la spro ba bskyed par bya bar bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught in order to generate enthusiasm for merit in later generations.

original: shi bi ba'i skyes pa'i rabs te gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: shi bi ba'i skyes pa'i rabs te gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter, the chapter on the birth stories of Śibi.

original: // / des dgra dregs pa rnams kyang btang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / des dgra dregs pa rnams kyang btang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He also gave up pride and arrogance.

original: rgyags pa dang dregs pa nyid dgra ste gnod pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyags pa dang dregs pa nyid dgra ste gnod pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Arrogance and pride are enemies because they are forms of harm.

original: de spangs pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de spangs pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called the one who gave them up because he abandoned them.

original: de la brten pa ni rgyal po la brten pa'i gnyen bshes rnams la de chags pa btang zhes bya bar sbyar te rjes su chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa ni rgyal po la brten pa'i gnyen bshes rnams la de chags pa btang zhes bya bar sbyar te rjes su chags pa med pa'o //
translated: He gave up attachment to his relatives who relied on him means he was not attached to the relatives who relied on the king.

original: mi mthun pa la khro ba btang zhes bya bar sbyar te khong khro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa la khro ba btang zhes bya bar sbyar te khong khro ba med pa'o //
translated: He gave up anger towards his enemies means he was not angry.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i rjes 'brang dpal de byams pas 'byor pa'i yon tan de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa'i rjes 'brang dpal de byams pas 'byor pa'i yon tan de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the quality of being rich with the glory that follows from love for all sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan rgyal po la yod pas rgyal po gzhan la de ltar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan rgyal po la yod pas rgyal po gzhan la de ltar gyur pa ste /
translated: Since the king has such qualities, he is like that for other kings.

original: rjes su chags pa med pa khong khro ba dang dregs pa med la sems can thams cad la byams pa de ltar gyur ces pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa med pa khong khro ba dang dregs pa med la sems can thams cad la byams pa de ltar gyur ces pa'o //
translated: He is without attachment, without anger, and without pride, and he is loving to all sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa ngan pa ma yin pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims yin gyi mtho ris 'dod pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa ngan pa ma yin pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims yin gyi mtho ris 'dod pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not deficient in the vow of morality, because his morality is one of renunciation, not of desire for heaven, etc.

original: gso sbyong gi yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: He is one who has taken up the eight-branched poṣadha vow.

original: nges par gnas pa ni dus khyad pas can la khas len pa'o ;🔽/ nor mang dpal yang rjes chags zhes bya ba ni nor mang po 'byor pa ni nor mang dpal lo //
analyzed: nges par gnas pa ni dus khyad pas can la khas len pa'o ; / nor mang dpal yang rjes chags zhes bya ba ni nor mang po 'byor pa ni nor mang dpal lo //
translated: He is one who is definitely established in the special time of the vow.

original: de rjes su chags shing ma btang bas rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su chags shing ma btang bas rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: He is attached to the glory of great wealth, i.e., he is attached to and does not give up the glory of great wealth.

original: don dang rgyu mtshan ma phye par zhes bya ba la don ni brjod pa'i dgos pa ste bsod nams la spro ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: don dang rgyu mtshan ma phye par zhes bya ba la don ni brjod pa'i dgos pa ste bsod nams la spro ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: the meaning is the purpose of the statement, which is to generate enthusiasm for merit.

original: rgyu mtshan de dran pa'o//
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de dran pa'o//
translated: The reason is the recollection of that.

original: yang na sgra de'i don nyid rgyu mtshan yin pas don dang rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: yang na sgra de'i don nyid rgyu mtshan yin pas don dang rgyu mtshan no //
translated: Or, since the meaning of that word itself is the reason, it is the meaning and the reason.

original: gzhan gyis brnyas shing ngal dman pa'i gal de yang /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brnyas shing ngal dman pa'i gal de yang /
translated: And that service to others, despised and lowly,🔽is engaged in, fearing that they will not live in hope of refuge.

original: skyabs su re zhing mi 'tshor dogs nas de la zhugs zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gla'i yas byed pa'i dgos pa ston te /
analyzed: skyabs su re zhing mi 'tshor dogs nas de la zhugs zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gla'i yas byed pa'i dgos pa ston te /
translated: This shows the purpose of serving others.

original: gzhan rje dpon la sogs pas brnyas shing byin pa'i rdzas dman pa @284b dang kha zas dman pa dang gos ngan pa la sogs pa de yang nga la skyabs su re zhing phan par mthong nas so //
analyzed: gzhan rje dpon la sogs pas brnyas shing byin pa'i rdzas dman pa @284b dang kha zas dman pa dang gos ngan pa la sogs pa de yang nga la skyabs su re zhing phan par mthong nas so //
translated: Even that despised and lowly substance given by others, such as a lowly meal, poor clothing, and so on, is seen as beneficial, hoping for refuge in oneself.

original: ji ltar phan 'dogs na mi 'tshor dogs nas gla'i rngan pa la ma brten na 'chi ba'i nyen yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar phan 'dogs na mi 'tshor dogs nas gla'i rngan pa la ma brten na 'chi ba'i nyen yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How does it benefit? Fearing that they will not live, if they do not rely on wages, there is the danger of death.

original: des na nga de la zhugs shing bya ba de byas so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na nga de la zhugs shing bya ba de byas so zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that I have entered into it and have done that action.

original: grags dang dpal dang sbyin pa phun sum tshogs pas 'bad //
analyzed: grags dang dpal dang sbyin pa phun sum tshogs pas 'bad //
translated: He strives for the perfection of fame, glory, and generosity.

original: zhes bya ba la grags pa phyogs su rgyas pa'i phyir dang / rgyal srid kyi 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang / 'byor pa de las gzhan phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la grags pa phyogs su rgyas pa'i phyir dang / rgyal srid kyi 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang / 'byor pa de las gzhan phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas rgyas pa'o //
translated: He strives for the perfection of fame because it spreads in all directions, for the perfection of the glory of the prosperity of his kingdom, and for the perfection of the prosperity of others.

original: sa chen skyong ba'i sa chen po de ni rgya mtsho chen po'i gos gyon pa ste /
analyzed: sa chen skyong ba'i sa chen po de ni rgya mtsho chen po'i gos gyon pa ste /
translated: The great earth, which is the support of the great earth, is clothed in the garment of the great ocean.

original: gos kyis lus g-yogs pa ltar rgya mtsho chen pos 'dzam bu' gling gi sa chen po mtha' bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos kyis lus g-yogs pa ltar rgya mtsho chen pos 'dzam bu' gling gi sa chen po mtha' bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great earth of Jambudvipa is surrounded by the great ocean, as if it were clothed with a garment.

original: rgya mtsho de nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rgya mtsho de nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that ocean like?

original: bsir ma langs pas rlabs bskyod de rlung gis g-yo bar byas pa'i rlabs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsir ma langs pas rlabs bskyod de rlung gis g-yo bar byas pa'i rlabs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is agitated by the rising of the cool wind, and it is endowed with waves moved by the wind.

original: de lta bu'i sa chen po chos kyis tshul bzhin du yun ring du skyong bas phan 'dogs pa rgya chen po yun ring du ston to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sa chen po chos kyis tshul bzhin du yun ring du skyong bas phan 'dogs pa rgya chen po yun ring du ston to //
translated: Thus, by properly and for a long time ruling over a great land, he shows great and long-lasting benefits.

original: sbyin pa las byung yon tan dga' la sogs pa sna tshogs grags dang ldan zhes bya ba la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni yon tan sna tshogs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung yon tan dga' la sogs pa sna tshogs grags dang ldan zhes bya ba la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni yon tan sna tshogs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The merit that arises from generosity has various qualities, such as delight, and is renowned.

original: dga' ba de dang gzugs bzang ba la sogs pa dag dang ldan zhes grags pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba de dang gzugs bzang ba la sogs pa dag dang ldan zhes grags pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is renowned for its vastness, since it is endowed with delight, a beautiful form, and so on.

original: byung ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byung ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Arisen means natural.

original: sbyin pa de dpe'i sgo nas bsngags pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa de dpe'i sgo nas bsngags pa ni /
translated: The praise of generosity by way of example is

original: gter dang chu dang bzhon pa dang grogs po'i sgo nas rkang pa bzhi rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gter dang chu dang bzhon pa dang grogs po'i sgo nas rkang pa bzhi rim pa bzhin no //
translated: in terms of four feet: treasure, water, vehicle, and friend.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thob pa gzhan tshigs bcad gcig go //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thob pa gzhan tshigs bcad gcig go //
translated: The attainment of excellence is in one verse.

original: 'bras bu'i che ba ni snying po len pa dang dbang phyug gi rgyu yin pa ste thar pa dang longs spyod kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i che ba ni snying po len pa dang dbang phyug gi rgyu yin pa ste thar pa dang longs spyod kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: The greatness of the result is that it is the cause of taking up the essence and of mastery, because it is the cause of liberation and of enjoyment, respectively.

original: rten gyi khyad par ni skye bo mchog gi tshul lo //
analyzed: rten gyi khyad par ni skye bo mchog gi tshul lo //
translated: The difference in support is the way of the highest person.

original: yang na rang gi ngo bo ste dam pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽shes rab chur bas rdul tsam sbyin ma nus //
analyzed: yang na rang gi ngo bo ste dam pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // shes rab chur bas rdul tsam sbyin ma nus //
translated: Or, it is the intrinsic nature, which is to say, the conduct of the holy ones.

original: zhes pas bzlog pa'i rgyu'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: zhes pas bzlog pa'i rgyu'i khyad par ston to //
translated: The difference in cause is shown by the words, “He was not able to give even a particle of wisdom.”

original: shes rab kyi khyad par ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi khyad par ni rgyu'o //
translated: The difference in wisdom is the cause.

original: zan dron changs gcig gi rabs te gsum pa'o /🔽// / yon tan dang spro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ni ldan zhes bya ba la yon tan gyi nor dang ldan pas ni sngon dge ba bsags pas sam gzhan @285a * //
analyzed: zan dron changs gcig gi rabs te gsum pa'o / // / yon tan dang spro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ni ldan zhes bya ba la yon tan gyi nor dang ldan pas ni sngon dge ba bsags pas sam gzhan @285a * //
translated: This is the third chapter on the story of the barley cake.

original: gyis bsnyen bkur byas pas so //
analyzed: gyis bsnyen bkur byas pas so //
translated: “Endowed with perfect qualities and enthusiasm” means endowed with the wealth of qualities, because of previously accumulated virtue or because of being served by others.

original: spro ba dang ldan pa ni 'bad pas tshod la sogs pa'i bya bas legs par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spro ba dang ldan pa ni 'bad pas tshod la sogs pa'i bya bas legs par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase endowed with enthusiasm means that he is well-equipped with the activities of the proper measure of effort, and so on.

original: de lag padma'i mchog ni lhung bzed thogs //
analyzed: de lag padma'i mchog ni lhung bzed thogs //
translated: He holds a lotus in his hand, the best of vessels.

original: zhes bya ba ni lag pa nyid mdzes pas padma mchog lta bu yin pas padma mchog go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lag pa nyid mdzes pas padma mchog lta bu yin pas padma mchog go //
translated: The lotus is the best of vessels.

original: yang na padma mchog gi lhung bzed thogs pas te lag pa padmas mdzes par byas pa ltar lhung bzed kyis phyag brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na padma mchog gi lhung bzed thogs pas te lag pa padmas mdzes par byas pa ltar lhung bzed kyis phyag brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, he holds a lotus in his hand, the best of vessels. The hand is adorned with a lotus, as if it were a vessel.

original: nor ni 'khor gsum khyad par rgyu yin te //
analyzed: nor ni 'khor gsum khyad par rgyu yin te //
translated: Wealth is the cause of the special three spheres.

original: zhes bya ba ni srid dang chos dang longs spyod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srid dang chos dang longs spyod do //
translated: The three spheres are: the sphere of existence, the sphere of the Dharma, and the sphere of enjoyment.

original: dmyal ba'i gshed po mi bzad 'bar ba'i lce //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i gshed po mi bzad 'bar ba'i lce //
translated: The tongue of the terrible, blazing executioner of the hells,

original: de phyir khyod ni bza' bar 'dir 'ongs so //
analyzed: de phyir khyod ni bza' bar 'dir 'ongs so //
translated: Therefore, you have come here to be eaten by me.

original: zhes bya ba la dmyal ba'i gnod pa nyid sdug bsngal bskyed pas gshed po dang 'dra bas gshed po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dmyal ba'i gnod pa nyid sdug bsngal bskyed pas gshed po dang 'dra bas gshed po'o //
translated: The suffering produced by the harm of the hells is like an executioner.

original: mi bzad 'bar pa ni sdug bsngal mi bzad 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: mi bzad 'bar pa ni sdug bsngal mi bzad 'bar ba'o //
translated: The unbearable burning is the unbearable burning of suffering.

original: ji ltar gcan gzan stag mo la sogs pas lce brkyang bas kha zas za ba ltar gnod pa drung du 'ongs te nang du 'dud pas lce dang 'dra bas lce'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gcan gzan stag mo la sogs pas lce brkyang bas kha zas za ba ltar gnod pa drung du 'ongs te nang du 'dud pas lce dang 'dra bas lce'o //
translated: Just as a carnivorous beast such as a tiger eats its prey by extending its tongue, so too does the tongue of harm come near and enter inside, and so it is like a tongue.

original: de phyir nga zhes bya ba ni gang phyir nor chud gsan pa'i sdig pa byas pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyir nga zhes bya ba ni gang phyir nor chud gsan pa'i sdig pa byas pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, “I” is that by which the sin of losing wealth is committed.

original: nyes pa byung ba'i sngon nam 'og tu yang zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: nyes pa byung ba'i sngon nam 'og tu yang zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu'o //
translated: “Before or after the fault” means immediately.

original: bde dang ldan na gus pa dran par gyis zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dor ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: bde dang ldan na gus pa dran par gyis zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dor ba'i tshe'o //
translated: “When you are happy, remember your respect” means when you are giving away your wealth.

original: yang na 'gyod bzhin ni dran par byos zhes bya ba ni ma bor ba'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: yang na 'gyod bzhin ni dran par byos zhes bya ba ni ma bor ba'i tshe na'o //
translated: Or “remember while regretting” means when you are not giving it away.🔽The white petals of the lotus flower,

original: ze'u 'bru dkar po so'i phreng ba dag / bdud la 'phya ba bzhin du dgod par gyur //
analyzed: ze'u 'bru dkar po so'i phreng ba dag / bdud la 'phya ba bzhin du dgod par gyur //
translated: like a row of teeth, will laugh as if mocking Mara.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na gzhan la khrel bas dgod pa'i tshe so'i phreng ba dkar po dang bcas pas dgod par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na gzhan la khrel bas dgod pa'i tshe so'i phreng ba dkar po dang bcas pas dgod par byed do //
translated: This is the way of the world: when one laughs at another out of shame, one laughs with a row of white teeth.

original: de bzhin du padma'i ze 'bru dkar po dag bdud la khrel bas bzhad gad byed pa lta bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du padma'i ze 'bru dkar po dag bdud la khrel bas bzhad gad byed pa lta bur gyur pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the white lotus petals laugh at Mara, as it were, out of shame.

original: bdud kyis bgegs bya bar mi nus pa'i rabs te bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: bdud kyis bgegs bya bar mi nus pa'i rabs te bzhi pa'o /
translated: The story of the inability of Mara to create an obstacle is the fourth.

original: // / rlabs che la zhes bya ba ni rgya mtshor rin po che len pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / rlabs che la zhes bya ba ni rgya mtshor rin po che len pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great waves are the taking of jewels from the ocean, etc.

original: rim pa 'di ni gtong ba'i tshul te phun sum tshogs nas cung zad sbyin no snyam pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'di ni gtong ba'i tshul te phun sum tshogs nas cung zad sbyin no snyam pa'o //
translated: This is the way of giving: having become perfect, one gives a little.🔽The same point is taught in detail in the verse beginning with:

original: de'i don nyid tshigs su bcad pas rgyas par ston pa ni ltos shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don nyid tshigs su bcad pas rgyas par ston pa ni ltos shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Look!

original: nor bsgrub pa'i rgyu ni bdag gi blo yis lcogs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rkang @285b pa gsum mo //
analyzed: nor bsgrub pa'i rgyu ni bdag gi blo yis lcogs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rkang @285b pa gsum mo //
translated: The cause for the accomplishment of wealth is the three lines beginning with:

original: rkang pa dang pos ni zhing las kyi khyad par te bsam pa ma yengs shing sbyor ba grims pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dang pos ni zhing las kyi khyad par te bsam pa ma yengs shing sbyor ba grims pa'o //
translated: The first line refers to the excellence of the field, i.e., the giver is not distracted in mind and is firm in practice.

original: rkang pa gnyis pa ni tshong gi khyad par te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pa ni tshong gi khyad par te /
translated: The second line refers to the excellence of the gift.

original: rigs dang mthun pa'i rigs bzang pos tshod dman pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs dang mthun pa'i rigs bzang pos tshod dman pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The giver is of good family, i.e., of a good class, in order to avoid the low class.

original: de nyid grags pa'i rgyu yin te gzhan gyis dpyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid grags pa'i rgyu yin te gzhan gyis dpyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is the cause of fame, i.e., of praise by others.

original: las kyi yon tan bzo dang gso dpyad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi yon tan bzo dang gso dpyad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The excellence of action is craftsmanship, medicine, etc.

original: mngon par chags bzhin dpal gyis 'byung bar gyur //
analyzed: mngon par chags bzhin dpal gyis 'byung bar gyur //
translated: May there be prosperity for those who are attached to it.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag par chags bzhin 'byor pa mang po dang mi 'bral bar gyur na zhes pa'i bde ba'i rim pa ni longs spyod pa'i rim pa ste longs spyod chung ba la spyad drags pa yang dman par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag par chags bzhin 'byor pa mang po dang mi 'bral bar gyur na zhes pa'i bde ba'i rim pa ni longs spyod pa'i rim pa ste longs spyod chung ba la spyad drags pa yang dman par ston to //
translated: The sequence of enjoyments is the sequence of enjoyments for those who are attached to it, i.e., for those who are not separated from many enjoyments. The sequence of enjoyments is taught for those of little wealth who are over-indulgent.

original: sdom zhing mi g-yeng ba ni sbyin pa'i dus bsam pa'o //
analyzed: sdom zhing mi g-yeng ba ni sbyin pa'i dus bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought of the giver at the time of giving is to be restrained and not distracted.

original: sbyin dgos pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi tshe gzhan gyi 'di sbyin pa la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin dgos pa'i zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi tshe gzhan gyi 'di sbyin pa la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase to be given means that one's own life is dependent on giving to others.

original: de ltar thob pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni dam pas sngon spyad pa'i phyir de las gzhan du mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar thob pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni dam pas sngon spyad pa'i phyir de las gzhan du mi rigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the path of attainment means that it is not reasonable to do otherwise, because the holy ones have practiced it in the past.

original: nga yis bslus pa ni brgya byin bdag gis so //
analyzed: nga yis bslus pa ni brgya byin bdag gis so //
translated: The phrase I have deceived means that I have deceived Indra.

original: zil gyis mi non pa ste lnga pa'o /🔽// / bdag gis pags pa aa dznyi gyon //
analyzed: zil gyis mi non pa ste lnga pa'o / // / bdag gis pags pa aa dznyi gyon //
translated: The phrase I am invincible means that I am invincible.🔽The phrase I have worn the skin of an ajna means that I have worn the skin of a deer.

original: rang gi spu yis shun lpags byas //🔽zhes bya ba ni dgon pa na gnas pa'i drang srong ri dags krishna la sogs pa'i pags pa gyon /🔽shing shun gyi ske rags yod pa dang chos mthun pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi spu yis shun lpags byas // zhes bya ba ni dgon pa na gnas pa'i drang srong ri dags krishna la sogs pa'i pags pa gyon / shing shun gyi ske rags yod pa dang chos mthun pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase I have made a garment of my own hair means that I have worn the bark of a tree.

original: des na thub pa bzhin du zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na thub pa bzhin du zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase I have been like a sage means that I have been like a sage.

original: gcig la gcig slob pa ni yid gcugs pas mi phod pa med pa'o //🔽dul ba ni nges pa ste 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig slob pa ni yid gcugs pas mi phod pa med pa'o // dul ba ni nges pa ste 'jam pa'o //
translated: The phrase I have been a teacher of others means that I have been a teacher of others.🔽The phrase I have been self-controlled means that I have been self-controlled.🔽The phrase I have been restrained means that I have been restrained.

original: sdom pa ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa ni tshul khrims so //
translated: The phrase I have been celibate means that I have been celibate.

original: spyod pa ni bsgrub pa'i dge ba gzhan no //
analyzed: spyod pa ni bsgrub pa'i dge ba gzhan no //
translated: The other virtues are the practice.

original: yang na sdom pa nyid ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yang na sdom pa nyid ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Or else, the vow itself is the synonym.

original: bde dang mthun zhing yon tan mi mthun tshul ni skye bo dman pa ste 'phral gyi bde ba'i phyir yon tan 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: bde dang mthun zhing yon tan mi mthun tshul ni skye bo dman pa ste 'phral gyi bde ba'i phyir yon tan 'dor ba'o //
translated: The way of being in harmony with virtue and not in harmony with happiness is the inferior person, who abandons virtue for the sake of immediate happiness.

original: yon tan mthun zhing bde dang mi mthun tshul ni skye bo dam pa ste 'phral sdug bsngal yang yon tan mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan mthun zhing bde dang mi mthun tshul ni skye bo dam pa ste 'phral sdug bsngal yang yon tan mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: The way of being in harmony with virtue and not in harmony with happiness is the superior person, who does not abandon virtue even for the sake of immediate suffering.

original: de ltar gnyis yod pa las mi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis yod pa las mi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are two kinds of people.

original: yon tan rjes 'gro ni sbyor ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan rjes 'gro ni sbyor ba'i yon tan no //
translated: The one who follows virtue is the one who practices virtue.

original: rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ni skyes thob po //
analyzed: rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa ni skyes thob po //
translated: The one who is naturally perfect is the one who is born with virtue.

original: yang na yon tan gyi rjes su byed pa'i grags pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na yon tan gyi rjes su byed pa'i grags pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, the one who follows virtue is the one who has fame.

original: gang gis grags pa zhe na rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ste de'i @286a * //
analyzed: gang gis grags pa zhe na rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ste de'i @286a * //
translated: By what is he famous? By his natural perfection.

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //
translated: That is his virtue.

original: de yis bskrad pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpal min te rgud pa'o //
analyzed: de yis bskrad pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpal min te rgud pa'o //
translated: He is like one driven away by it.

original: de dang mi mthun drung du zhes bya ba ni bsod nams che ba dang 'gal ba bsod nams ma yin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun drung du zhes bya ba ni bsod nams che ba dang 'gal ba bsod nams ma yin pa la bya'o //
translated: In the presence of one who is not like that means in the presence of one who is not like that, that is, in the presence of one who is not endowed with great merit.

original: khro bzhin du de phung bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khro bzhin du de phung bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is angry will destroy him.

original: bkur sti bya ba yongs su bzung zhing ni bkur sti bdag gir bya ba'o //
analyzed: bkur sti bya ba yongs su bzung zhing ni bkur sti bdag gir bya ba'o //
translated: Having taken up honor means having made honor one's own.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni dben pa dang nyams dga' ba'i gnas te dgon pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni dben pa dang nyams dga' ba'i gnas te dgon pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Peaceful means a solitary and delightful place, that is, a forest.

original: de'i rjes su bzung ba yang bdag gis bdag gir bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su bzung ba yang bdag gis bdag gir bya ba'o //
translated: Taking care of him means making him one's own.

original: skyin gor zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi khyad par shi ba'i ro bzar rung ba'o //
analyzed: skyin gor zhes bya ba ni srog chags kyi khyad par shi ba'i ro bzar rung ba'o //
translated: A corpse is a particular living being, a dead body suitable to be eaten.

original: tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze la bod pa ste tshangs pa'i bu thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze la bod pa ste tshangs pa'i bu thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Brahma refers to a Brahmin, because he is the eldest son of Brahma.

original: rig pa'i mchog zhes bya ba ni rig byed la sogs pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i mchog zhes bya ba ni rig byed la sogs pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme knowledge means knowing the Vedas and so on.

original: mud ka ni 'bru'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: mud ka ni 'bru'i khyad par ro //
translated: Mudga is a particular grain.

original: sbyin par bya ba dang ldan pa ni yul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang ldan pa ni yul dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with what is to be given means endowed with objects.

original: dman ma zhes bya ba ni gos la sogs pa rnying pa'am /
analyzed: dman ma zhes bya ba ni gos la sogs pa rnying pa'am /
translated: The inferior means old clothes, etc., or the leftovers of food.

original: zas kyi lhag ma dag kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zas kyi lhag ma dag kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: yon tan goms pa bsgoms pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yon tan goms pa bsgoms pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is the cultivation of the practice of virtue.

original: dam pa'i spyad pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i spyad pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result is the practice of the holy life.

original: ri bong gi rabs te drug pa'o /
analyzed: ri bong gi rabs te drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixth chapter, called the Rabbit.

original: // / mkhas pa'i phyir na de yi grags pa dang / gtong ba dang ni dpa' bas lhag par gyur //
analyzed: // / mkhas pa'i phyir na de yi grags pa dang / gtong ba dang ni dpa' bas lhag par gyur //
translated: Because of his wisdom, his fame, generosity, and courage became preeminent.

original: zhes bya ba la mkhas pa'i phyir pradm nya yis de'i grags pa phyogs su rgyas la de yang gtong ba dang brtan pa dang babs pas lhag par grags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mkhas pa'i phyir pradm nya yis de'i grags pa phyogs su rgyas la de yang gtong ba dang brtan pa dang babs pas lhag par grags pa'o //
translated: Here, because of his wisdom, his fame spread in all directions. And that fame became preeminent because of his generosity, steadfastness, and courage.

original: de nyid nam mkha' dri ma med pa dang zla ba nya ba gnyis kyis lhag par mdzes pa dper bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid nam mkha' dri ma med pa dang zla ba nya ba gnyis kyis lhag par mdzes pa dper bya'o //
translated: That very thing is made into an example, with the stainless sky and the full moon, to show its preeminence.

original: srid pa'i yon tan ni 'jig rten pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang / rig byed la sogs pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i yon tan ni 'jig rten pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang / rig byed la sogs pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The worldly virtues are skill in worldly activities and skill in the Vedas, etc.

original: spyod dang dbang po rab tu zhi zhing du la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyod dang dbang po rab tu zhi zhing du la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse says, With conduct, senses well-pacified, and mind,

original: spyod pa rab tu zhi ba ni lus kyi spyod pa gzhan gyis dpyas byar med pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa rab tu zhi ba ni lus kyi spyod pa gzhan gyis dpyas byar med pa'o //
translated: “Very peaceful conduct” means that one’s physical conduct is beyond reproach.

original: brtul zhugs bsdams la nges byas ni tshul khrims yang dag par (blangs pa/) brtan pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs bsdams la nges byas ni tshul khrims yang dag par (blangs pa/) brtan pa'o //
translated: “Having taken up the discipline of observances” means that one’s moral discipline is firm.

original: blo yi mthu chung rnams kyis thub pa zhes pa ste dgra bcom pa yin snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: blo yi mthu chung rnams kyis thub pa zhes pa ste dgra bcom pa yin snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: “The weak-minded think that he is a sage” means that they think that he is an arhat.

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni brten pa'i bdag nyid can no //🔽khros pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni khros pa dag gnod pa sgrub par bde ba dang mthun pas sam /
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni brten pa'i bdag nyid can no // khros pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni khros pa dag gnod pa sgrub par bde ba dang mthun pas sam /
translated: “Having a nature that is certain” means that he has a stable nature.🔽“Like one who is angry” means that he is like one who is angry, who is happy to inflict harm.

original: khro ba'i ma dpyad pa gzu lu mas kyis bya ba byed @286b pa de dang chos mthun pa'i sgo nas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: khro ba'i ma dpyad pa gzu lu mas kyis bya ba byed @286b pa de dang chos mthun pa'i sgo nas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or, it means that he is like one who is angry, who acts rashly without thinking.

original: phongs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phongs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir //
translated: Because he is a source of misfortune,

original: byis pa tha ma yin par 'dod ces tha ma ste dman pa sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: byis pa tha ma yin par 'dod ces tha ma ste dman pa sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: he is considered to be the worst of the worst, the lowest of the low.

original: des na snying rje'i yun yin pas byis pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ji ltar byas kyang byis pa la /
analyzed: des na snying rje'i yun yin pas byis pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // ji ltar byas kyang byis pa la /
translated: Therefore, they are the objects of compassion.🔽Even if you try, you cannot help

original: phan gdags par ni mi nus te //
analyzed: phan gdags par ni mi nus te //
translated: foolish people.

original: zhes bya ba'i don ni slob dpon sh'anta de pas ji skad du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don ni slob dpon sh'anta de pas ji skad du /
translated: The meaning of this is as stated by Master Śāntideva:

original: byis dang skal ba mnyam spyod na //
analyzed: byis dang skal ba mnyam spyod na //
translated: If you act like a fool,

original: nges par ngan 'gror 'gro 'gyur te //
analyzed: nges par ngan 'gror 'gro 'gyur te //
translated: you will definitely go to a bad rebirth.

original: skal ba mnyam par khrid byed na //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam par khrid byed na //
translated: If you lead them by being their equal,

original: byis pa bsten pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: byis pa bsten pas ci zhig bya //
translated: what is the use of associating with fools?

original: skad cig gcig gis mdza' 'gyur la //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis mdza' 'gyur la //
translated: In one moment they become friends,

original: yud tsam gyis ni dgrar yang 'gyur //
analyzed: yud tsam gyis ni dgrar yang 'gyur //
translated: in another moment they become enemies.

original: dga' ba'i gnas khro bar byed bas //
analyzed: dga' ba'i gnas khro bar byed bas //
translated: They get angry at the very ones they love,

original: so so'i skyes bu mgu bar dka' //
analyzed: so so'i skyes bu mgu bar dka' //
translated: it is hard to please a fool.

original: phan par smras na'ang khro bar byed //
analyzed: phan par smras na'ang khro bar byed //
translated: Even when you speak for their benefit, they get angry.

original: bdag kyang phan la bzlog par byed //
analyzed: bdag kyang phan la bzlog par byed //
translated: They even stop you from doing what is beneficial.

original: de dag ngag ni ma mnyan na //
analyzed: de dag ngag ni ma mnyan na //
translated: If you do not listen to their words,

original: khros na ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khros na ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: they get angry and you go to a bad rebirth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: slob dpon 'di nyid kyis kyang de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni //
analyzed: slob dpon 'di nyid kyis kyang de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni //
translated: This very master [Nāgārjuna] also explains that extensively:

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsal bar byed do //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: de lta bu la phan gdags par mi nus la /
analyzed: de lta bu la phan gdags par mi nus la /
translated: One who is not able to benefit such a person,

original: nus na / bdag cag lta bus ji ltar na //
analyzed: nus na / bdag cag lta bus ji ltar na //
translated: if able, how could one like me

original: de la phan pa brtson mi byed //
analyzed: de la phan pa brtson mi byed //
translated: not strive to benefit him?

original: ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what it says.

original: tshul ma yin pa ni bya ba tshul ma yin pa ste mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: tshul ma yin pa ni bya ba tshul ma yin pa ste mi dge ba'o //
translated: Improper is an improper action, which is non-virtuous.

original: tshul ma yin pa de nyid ni dus dang drang po'i rim pa dang mi mthun pa ste nyes par spyod pa dang g-yo dang sgyu kun tu spyod pa'o //🔽mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug mes bsregs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul ma yin pa de nyid ni dus dang drang po'i rim pa dang mi mthun pa ste nyes par spyod pa dang g-yo dang sgyu kun tu spyod pa'o // mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug mes bsregs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That very impropriety is contrary to the sequence of time and straightforwardness, which is the practice of evil conduct, deceit, and pretense.🔽Burned by the fire of delusion of the pride of being learned

original: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal phyed pa'i kun tu rmongs pa nyid me dang 'dra ste phan pa'i gdams ngag nyid sreg cing chud gson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i nga rgyal phyed pa'i kun tu rmongs pa nyid me dang 'dra ste phan pa'i gdams ngag nyid sreg cing chud gson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that the very delusion of the pride of being learned is like fire, because it burns and destroys the very beneficial instructions.

original: 'dul ba brtson 'grus chung ba ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'am legs par spyod pa la 'bad mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba brtson 'grus chung ba ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'am legs par spyod pa la 'bad mi nus pa ste /
translated: Those who are diligent in the Vinaya are unable to restrain the doors of their senses or to strive for good conduct.

original: de dag gis ni gzu lums can te legs par dpyod pa'i shes rab med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gzu lums can te legs par dpyod pa'i shes rab med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are rash, because they lack the wisdom to investigate well.

original: de ltar bshad nas mjug bsdus pa ni lha'i gtso bo de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad nas mjug bsdus pa ni lha'i gtso bo de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: Having explained it in this way, the conclusion is the verse beginning “Therefore, O chief among gods…”

original: legs par smras pas rin che ba //
analyzed: legs par smras pas rin che ba //
translated: It is valuable because it is well spoken.

original: rin ni ci yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: rin ni ci yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no price for it at all.

original: zhes bya ba ni yon dbul bar 'os kyang de med pa'o //🔽'on kyang dga' ba'i me tog snyim pas 'thor bkang bzhin te legs @287a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yon dbul bar 'os kyang de med pa'o // 'on kyang dga' ba'i me tog snyim pas 'thor bkang bzhin te legs @287a * //
translated: Even though one is worthy of receiving gifts, there is none.🔽Nevertheless, one should fill one’s cupped hands with the flowers of joy and offer them.

original: spyad la dka' zhing rjes su yi rang pa nyid me tog snyim pas bkang nas 'bul ba lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyad la dka' zhing rjes su yi rang pa nyid me tog snyim pas bkang nas 'bul ba lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One should fill one’s cupped hands with the flowers of joy and offer them, as if they were flowers.

original: 'on kyang khyod la tshe ring ba 'am yo byad 'phel ba la sogs pa'i mchog sbyin gyis slong shig ces 'dir yang khyod la mchog sbyin zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyod la tshe ring ba 'am yo byad 'phel ba la sogs pa'i mchog sbyin gyis slong shig ces 'dir yang khyod la mchog sbyin zhes smras so //
translated: Here, too, you are addressed as you who are granted the supreme gift.

original: skyes bu dam pa gnas skabs thams cad du bde ba brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gnas skabs thams cad ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang 'grogs pa dang smra ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa gnas skabs thams cad du bde ba brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gnas skabs thams cad ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang 'grogs pa dang smra ba'o //
translated: Because the holy person is the support of happiness in all circumstances, all circumstances are seeing, hearing, associating with, and speaking to.

original: de nyid bsten pa mthong zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bsten pa mthong zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: That very support is seeing, etc. is stated in the verse beginning with seeing.

original: bsten pa de ni dge ba bsgrub pa la bsam pa'am sbyor ba thams cad brten pa ste dge ba'i bshes gnyen no //
analyzed: bsten pa de ni dge ba bsgrub pa la bsam pa'am sbyor ba thams cad brten pa ste dge ba'i bshes gnyen no //
translated: That support is the spiritual teacher, who is the support of all intentions and preparations for accomplishing virtue.

original: de smros shig zhes bya ba ni bsten pa de'o //
analyzed: de smros shig zhes bya ba ni bsten pa de'o //
translated: Say that! means say that support!

original: bsten pas khyod la ci zhig ces bya ba ni de mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsten pas khyod la ci zhig ces bya ba ni de mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is the use of that support for you? means what is the use of seeing that, etc.?

original: 'od srungs zhes bram ze'i rigs kyi sgo nas bod pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs zhes bram ze'i rigs kyi sgo nas bod pa'o //
translated: Kāśyapa is addressed from the perspective of his Brahmin caste.

original: bsten pa gzhan 'dod pas khyod mi bsten pa lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: bsten pa gzhan 'dod pas khyod mi bsten pa lta bur gyur te /
translated: You are not to be relied upon, like someone who is devoted to others.

original: brtan pa ni mi g-yo ba yin na khyod ni bsten pa gzhan 'dod pas g-yo pa dang bcas pas mi bsten pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni mi g-yo ba yin na khyod ni bsten pa gzhan 'dod pas g-yo pa dang bcas pas mi bsten pa'o //
translated: One who is steadfast is unwavering, but you are not to be relied upon because you are fickle, devoted to others.

original: bsten pa de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par te de dang phrad pa la sogs pa ni don che ba'i phyir ro zhes bsten pa ni gro gas po nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽de'i tshig ni phan pa dang ldan pa yin zhes pa ni mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug mes bsregs pa /
analyzed: bsten pa de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par te de dang phrad pa la sogs pa ni don che ba'i phyir ro zhes bsten pa ni gro gas po nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // de'i tshig ni phan pa dang ldan pa yin zhes pa ni mkhas pa'i nga rgyal gti mug mes bsregs pa /
translated: That reliance is a special spiritual teacher, and meeting with him, etc. is of great benefit.🔽His words are beneficial.

original: phan par smra las khro bas rtsub 'gyur ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: phan par smra las khro bas rtsub 'gyur ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: He is the opposite of one who is harsh due to anger at the words of one who speaks for one's benefit.

original: g-yo sgyu med pa'i dul bas rtag tu brgyan cing 'dul la brtson 'grus chung bas gzu lums can las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo sgyu med pa'i dul bas rtag tu brgyan cing 'dul la brtson 'grus chung bas gzu lums can las bzlog pa'o //
translated: He is always adorned with humility free from deceit and hypocrisy, and the opposite of one who is rash due to little effort in self-discipline.

original: de ltar phan pa dag kyang brtan par nus pa ni de lta bu dag la phan gdags par nus pa'o zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar phan pa dag kyang brtan par nus pa ni de lta bu dag la phan gdags par nus pa'o zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Thus, one who is able to benefit in that way is able to help such people.

original: yang grogs skal ba dang ldan pa dag la ni bdag gis kyang phan pa brtan pas phan gdags par nus pa smos zhes pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yang grogs skal ba dang ldan pa dag la ni bdag gis kyang phan pa brtan pas phan gdags par nus pa smos zhes pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Moreover, for those friends who are fortunate, I am able to help them with stable benefit, the opposite of what was said above.

original: de bas bdag gis yon tan brtan pa'i dge ba rab tu gzhol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas bdag gis yon tan brtan pa'i dge ba rab tu gzhol bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, I will apply myself to virtue that is stable in terms of its qualities.

original: dgos pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: dgos pa gang gis she na /
translated: For what purpose?
