original: bdag kyang yon tan de la rab tu dga' ba'i phyir te grogs bzang po'i yon tan ni bdag la bgo ba ste /
analyzed: bdag kyang yon tan de la rab tu dga' ba'i phyir te grogs bzang po'i yon tan ni bdag la bgo ba ste /
translated: Because I delight in those qualities myself. The qualities of good friends are shared with me.

original: 'og nas ji skad du /
analyzed: 'og nas ji skad du /
translated: As it is said below:

original: dam pa rnams ni sus kyang mi bsring do //
analyzed: dam pa rnams ni sus kyang mi bsring do //
translated: The holy ones cannot be separated from anyone.

original: dul ba'i tshul gyis dge ba bsnyen par bya //
analyzed: dul ba'i tshul gyis dge ba bsnyen par bya //
translated: By the method of self-discipline, one should approach virtue.

original: de dang nye na de yi yon tan rdul //
analyzed: de dang nye na de yi yon tan rdul //
translated: If one is close to them, the dust of their qualities

original: ched du ma byas @287b pa yang 'gro bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ched du ma byas @287b pa yang 'gro bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: will be picked up, even without intention.

original: sbyin pa'i tshogs pa tshang par smon pa'i so nas sbyin pa la rab tu dga' ba de brtan pa'i phyir smras pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshogs pa tshang par smon pa'i so nas sbyin pa la rab tu dga' ba de brtan pa'i phyir smras pa zhes smos so //
translated: Having wished for the assembly of generosity to be complete, in order to stabilize the delight in generosity, it is said.

original: tshogs pa tshang ba ni gsum gyis te /
analyzed: tshogs pa tshang ba ni gsum gyis te /
translated: The assembly is complete in three ways:

original: dngos po dang bsam pa dang zhing gi khyad par gsum /
analyzed: dngos po dang bsam pa dang zhing gi khyad par gsum /
translated: The three special features are the thing given, the attitude, and the field.

original: kha zas bzang po nyes pa spangs pa zhes bya ba dang / yid kyang sbyin la dga' dang mthun gyur zhing //
analyzed: kha zas bzang po nyes pa spangs pa zhes bya ba dang / yid kyang sbyin la dga' dang mthun gyur zhing //
translated: The verse “Good food, free of faults,🔽”

original: zhes pa dang / slob pa rnams kyang tshul khrims rnam dag brgyan //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / slob pa rnams kyang tshul khrims rnam dag brgyan //
translated: and “The trainees, too, are adorned with pure morality”

original: zhes pa dang rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa dang rim pa bzhin no //
translated: correspond to these three, respectively.

original: khyod kyis 'di dag bdag la yid gyur mchog slong ngo //🔽zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di dag bdag la yid gyur mchog slong ngo // zhes sbyar ro //
translated: “You have asked me for these, the best of gifts.”

original: de nas nam nangs zhes pa la sogs pa la sbyin pa'i tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas nam nangs zhes pa la sogs pa la sbyin pa'i tshogs pa'o //
translated: “Then, at dawn” and so forth is the accumulation of generosity.

original: mchog bslang ba las gcig ni byang chub sems dpa' la yod pa yin la gzhan gnyis byin pas sbyin pa rgya chen po byas pa'o //
analyzed: mchog bslang ba las gcig ni byang chub sems dpa' la yod pa yin la gzhan gnyis byin pas sbyin pa rgya chen po byas pa'o //
translated: Of the three gifts asked for, one is possessed by the bodhisattva, and the other two are given, so the generosity is vast.

original: dka' thub can dang mthun pa'i tshul dag gis gnas pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: dka' thub can dang mthun pa'i tshul dag gis gnas pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa'o ;
translated: “Dwelling in the way that accords with ascetics” means dwelling in the qualities of training.

original: / bsam gtan tshad med sdom dang zhi ba'i tshul gyis gnas zhes bya ba la bsam gtan tshad med ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: / bsam gtan tshad med sdom dang zhi ba'i tshul gyis gnas zhes bya ba la bsam gtan tshad med ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: The line they abide by the way of concentration, the immeasurables, vows, and peace means that the immeasurables are the actual practice of concentration.

original: sdom pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: The vows are the cause.

original: zhi ba ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa de'i ched du'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa de'i ched du'o //
translated: Peace is nirvana, the result for which they practice.

original: aa gastya'i rabs te bdun pa'o /
analyzed: aa gastya'i rabs te bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the seventh chapter, on the benefactors, in the Bodhisattva Jewel Cloud Scripture.

original: // / rgyal po de yang de dag bzhin du gyur zhes bya ba ni de dag la de bzhin du gyur pa ste bde na bde zhing sdug bsngal na sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: // / rgyal po de yang de dag bzhin du gyur zhes bya ba ni de dag la de bzhin du gyur pa ste bde na bde zhing sdug bsngal na sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The line the king was just like them means that he was just like them, happy when they were happy and sad when they were sad.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore means because of that.

original: mtshon chas goms pa ni mtshon cha'i thabs la goms pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon chas goms pa ni mtshon cha'i thabs la goms pa'o //
translated: The line they were skilled in weapons means that they were skilled in the techniques of weapons.

original: gtsug lag ni rgyal po'i spyod tshul ston pa'i gtsug lag pa'o ;
analyzed: gtsug lag ni rgyal po'i spyod tshul ston pa'i gtsug lag pa'o ;
translated: The line they were skilled in the scriptures means that they were skilled in the scriptures that teach the conduct of kings.

original: /'bangs de rnams rgyal po'i bka' la gnas pas phan tshun 'tshe ba med pas mtshon cha mi dgos mod kyis mdzes pa'i phyir mtshon cha thogs par byed pas /
analyzed: /'bangs de rnams rgyal po'i bka' la gnas pas phan tshun 'tshe ba med pas mtshon cha mi dgos mod kyis mdzes pa'i phyir mtshon cha thogs par byed pas /
translated: The line they did not need weapons means that although they did not need weapons because they did not harm each other, they carried weapons for the sake of beauty.

original: de'i mtshon cha rgyan dang 'dra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i mtshon cha rgyan dang 'dra bar 'gyur /
translated: His weapons become like ornaments.

original: 'jig rten la phan pa bsgrub pa 'byung ba'i snyan dngags kyi tshul lugs kyi bstan bcos don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la phan pa bsgrub pa 'byung ba'i snyan dngags kyi tshul lugs kyi bstan bcos don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The treatise on the system of poetry that accomplishes the benefit of the world is meaningful.

original: des na gtsug lag gsal bar snang ba ni de la brten nas bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa kun shes pa'o //
analyzed: des na gtsug lag gsal bar snang ba ni de la brten nas bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa kun shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of the light of the scriptures is the complete understanding of what should and should not be done based on that.

original: tshar gcod pa'i bya ba ni chos dang 'gal bar mi byed pa ni gsod par mi byed pa dang gang la gang 'os pa las lhag par mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: tshar gcod pa'i bya ba ni chos dang 'gal bar mi byed pa ni gsod par mi byed pa dang gang la gang 'os pa las lhag par mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: The activity of subduing is not to act contrary to the Dharma, not to kill, and not to transgress what is appropriate for a particular person.

original: @288a * // phan btags pa la chos dang 'gal ba'i bya ba mi byed pa ni phan gdags par 'os pa la mi 'dogs pa'am cher btags pa la rgyu chung du tsam las mi byed pa ste de mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: @288a * // phan btags pa la chos dang 'gal ba'i bya ba mi byed pa ni phan gdags par 'os pa la mi 'dogs pa'am cher btags pa la rgyu chung du tsam las mi byed pa ste de mi byed pa'o //
translated: The activity of benefiting is not to act contrary to the Dharma in benefiting others, not to fail to benefit those who should be benefited or to benefit them only slightly when they should be greatly benefited.

original: tshul mkhas pa ni rgyal po'i spyod tshul la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul mkhas pa ni rgyal po'i spyod tshul la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in means is skill in the conduct of a king.

original: yang na pha rol po'i spyod tshul gang phan gnod du gyur pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na pha rol po'i spyod tshul gang phan gnod du gyur pa shes pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is knowing what is beneficial or harmful in the conduct of others.

original: des skye dgu 'bangs kyi don la rtogs mkhas pas don dang mthun pa'i bya ba byed pas pha bzang pos bu lam bzang po la sbyor ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: des skye dgu 'bangs kyi don la rtogs mkhas pas don dang mthun pa'i bya ba byed pas pha bzang pos bu lam bzang po la sbyor ba lta bu'o //
translated: Since he is skilled in understanding the welfare of the people, he acts in accordance with their welfare, like a good father who sets his son on the right path.

original: bden pa dang gtong ba dang nye bar zhi ba dang shes rab ni byin gyis brlabs bzhi ste /
analyzed: bden pa dang gtong ba dang nye bar zhi ba dang shes rab ni byin gyis brlabs bzhi ste /
translated: Truth, generosity, tranquility, and wisdom are the four blessings.

original: de bzhi dang ldan pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' byin gyis brlabs pa ltar snod du rung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhi dang ldan pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' byin gyis brlabs pa ltar snod du rung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Endowed with these four, one becomes a suitable vessel, like the blessings of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: bden pa ni bden par smra ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni bden par smra ba'o //
translated: Truth means speaking truthfully.

original: gtong ba ni gtong ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba ni gtong ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Generosity means being skilled in giving.

original: nye bar zhi ba ni dbang po mi rgod cing dul ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba ni dbang po mi rgod cing dul ba'o //
translated: Tranquility means having disciplined senses that are not agitated.

original: shes rab ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa la mi rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa la mi rmongs pa ste /
translated: Wisdom means being undeluded about what should and should not be done.

original: gzhan na gcig tu phan na bden //
analyzed: gzhan na gcig tu phan na bden //
translated: The one that is always beneficial is truth.

original: mi phan phyir na cig shos brdzun //
analyzed: mi phan phyir na cig shos brdzun //
translated: The other is false because it is not beneficial.

original: ji ltar rgyal po'i nyes pa dag / sbyin stsal gcig gis sbed pa ltar //🔽nye bar zhi ba thob pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po'i nyes pa dag / sbyin stsal gcig gis sbed pa ltar //🔽nye bar zhi ba thob pa'i phyir //
translated: Just as a king's faults are concealed by a single act of generosity,🔽so too are the faults of the wise concealed by a single good quality.

original: mchog tu gus pa byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog tu gus pa byed par 'gyur //
translated: and will be most respectful.

original: shes rab ldan pas blo mi phrogs //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pas blo mi phrogs //
translated: The wise are not carried away by their minds,

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing brtan //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing brtan //
translated: are not dependent on others, and are steadfast.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis rin po che'i 'phreng ba nas bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis rin po che'i 'phreng ba nas bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is explained in Nāgārjuna’s Precious Garland.

original: khyad par du gyur pa ni sems yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa ni sems yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: The special is the ripening of the mind.

original: rlabs che ba'i rim pas dar ba ni rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rlabs che ba'i rim pas dar ba ni rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The flourishing of the great stages is the completion of one’s own buddha qualities.

original: yang na skye dgu rnams kyis yongs su skyong bas na de rnams dar ba ste de dag bde legs thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang na skye dgu rnams kyis yongs su skyong bas na de rnams dar ba ste de dag bde legs thob pa'o //
translated: Or, since the people are protected, they flourish, and they attain well-being.

original: yang dag de'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin gnyis pa'o ;
analyzed: yang dag de'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin gnyis pa'o ;
translated: The cause of that is the two as before.

original: / gnod pa thams cad med pa ni phyi nang gi nye bar 'tshe ba med pa'o //
analyzed: / gnod pa thams cad med pa ni phyi nang gi nye bar 'tshe ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of all harm is the absence of inner and outer calamities.

original: dge ba sna tshogs yod pa ni lus dang longs spyod kyi 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba sna tshogs yod pa ni lus dang longs spyod kyi 'byor pa'o //
translated: The existence of various virtues is the wealth of body and possessions.

original: phun sum tshogs pa mchog dang ldan pa ni rgyal po'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa mchog dang ldan pa ni rgyal po'o //
translated: The supreme perfection is the king.

original: ming ni don dang mthun ma gyur //
analyzed: ming ni don dang mthun ma gyur //
translated: The name does not correspond to the meaning.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin zhes bya ba gzhan la gnod pa sbyin zhing mdangs 'phrog pa la sogs pa byed pa yin na de'i nus pa med pas sgra don mi gnas so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin zhes bya ba gzhan la gnod pa sbyin zhing mdangs 'phrog pa la sogs pa byed pa yin na de'i nus pa med pas sgra don mi gnas so snyam pa'o //
translated: This means that if a yaksha is one who harms others and steals their radiance, etc., then since he has no power to do that, the meaning of the word does not apply.

original: gang las thar bar 'gyur ba rab dka' zhes pa ni mi sha dang tshil dag za ba'i srin po zhes bya ba dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gang las thar bar 'gyur ba rab dka' zhes pa ni mi sha dang tshil dag za ba'i srin po zhes bya ba dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: From what is it difficult to be liberated? From the rakshasas who eat human flesh and fat.

original: ji lta bu dag kyang thar bar dka' na rig sngags kyis bsrungs pa'am de'i @288b bzlas brjod byas pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu dag kyang thar bar dka' na rig sngags kyis bsrungs pa'am de'i @288b bzlas brjod byas pa'o //
translated: If it is difficult to be liberated from them, how much more so if one is protected by a spell or has recited it.

original: dka' thub ni tshul khrims dang smyung bar gnas pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: dka' thub ni tshul khrims dang smyung bar gnas pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Asceticism means by means of morality, fasting, etc.

original: bde legs te yongs su bskyabs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: bde legs te yongs su bskyabs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Well-being is the special protection.

original: des ni mi ma yin pa'i srung ba'o //
analyzed: des ni mi ma yin pa'i srung ba'o //
translated: This is the protection by non-humans.

original: mi'i srung ba ni grogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i srung ba ni grogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The protection by humans is stated by friends, etc.

original: de dag ni gzhan gyi stobs ma yin la rang gi stobs ni dpa' la 'jigs pa med zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan gyi stobs ma yin la rang gi stobs ni dpa' la 'jigs pa med zhes bya bas so //
translated: Those are not the power of others, but one's own power is called heroic and fearless.

original: gang du thar par dka' zhe na /
analyzed: gang du thar par dka' zhe na /
translated: Where is it difficult to escape?

original: nags tshal rab tu dben zhing zab pa yang ba 'jigs pa'i sa na zhes bya ba ste de ni gzhan gyi rkyen dang rang gi rgyu yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nags tshal rab tu dben zhing zab pa yang ba 'jigs pa'i sa na zhes bya ba ste de ni gzhan gyi rkyen dang rang gi rgyu yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the forest, which is very secluded and deep, on a frightening ground, that is, even though there are other conditions and one's own causes,

original: bde legs chen po zhes bya ba ni rig sngags dang dka' thub thams cad pas mchog tu gyur pas rgyal po'o //
analyzed: bde legs chen po zhes bya ba ni rig sngags dang dka' thub thams cad pas mchog tu gyur pas rgyal po'o //
translated: Great well-being is the king because it is supreme over all knowledge mantras and austerities.

original: rnam par gnon pa gzhan zil gyis gnon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa gzhan zil gyis gnon par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the conqueror that overwhelms other conquerors.

original: nyid kyi rgyal po'i mthu de lta bu ni rang gi che ba nyid kyis thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi sngon bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i khyad par gyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi rgyal po'i mthu de lta bu ni rang gi che ba nyid kyis thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi sngon bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i khyad par gyis thob pa'o //
translated: That kind of royal power of one's own is obtained by one's own greatness means it is obtained by the special accumulation of one's own merit in the past.

original: de dpung byams pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa ni byams pa nyid kyis dgra rnams mi 'byung bas dgra'i dpung bzlog pa ni sems can thams cad la byams pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dpung byams pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa ni byams pa nyid kyis dgra rnams mi 'byung bas dgra'i dpung bzlog pa ni sems can thams cad la byams pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The army called “loving kindness” is as follows: since enemies do not arise through loving kindness itself, the army that wards off enemies is loving kindness toward all sentient beings. This is the meaning.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: byams pa'i stobs kyis thub pa yongs bsrungs te zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i stobs kyis thub pa yongs bsrungs te zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Sage was fully protected by the power of loving kindness.

original: 'o na rgyal po de la dpung gi tshogs shing rta la sogs pa med dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyal po de la dpung gi tshogs shing rta la sogs pa med dam zhe na /
translated: Well then, did that king not have an army of chariots and so on?

original: ru mtshon khra bo dpung ni go cha tsam zhes pa ste ba dan dang rgyal mtshan khra bos thog drangs pa'i dpung yod kyang ltad mo tsam du zad kyi dgra 'dul ba la mi dgos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ru mtshon khra bo dpung ni go cha tsam zhes pa ste ba dan dang rgyal mtshan khra bos thog drangs pa'i dpung yod kyang ltad mo tsam du zad kyi dgra 'dul ba la mi dgos zhes pa'o //
translated: The army with variegated banners is just armor. Although he had an army led by variegated banners and victory banners, it was just for show. It was not necessary for subduing enemies.

original: de ni mi khro tshig rtsub mi smra yang /
analyzed: de ni mi khro tshig rtsub mi smra yang /
translated: He did not get angry and did not speak harsh words.

original: legs par bsrungs zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba rtsub pas nan tur bya mi dgos kyi byams pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyis gzhan nyes pa las zlog par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: legs par bsrungs zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba rtsub pas nan tur bya mi dgos kyi byams pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyis gzhan nyes pa las zlog par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Well-guarded” means that, without the need for harsh thoughts and actions, one turns others away from faults by means of loving physical and verbal actions.

original: khyed der dong na rgyal po'i yon tan rgya cher shes par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyed der dong na rgyal po'i yon tan rgya cher shes par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: “If you go there, you will know the king’s virtues in detail.”

original: gang gi sgo nas shes zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi sgo nas shes zhe na /
translated: How will you know?

original: 'bangs la yod pa'i legs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas de las dpags pas rgyal po'i yon tan shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bangs la yod pa'i legs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas de las dpags pas rgyal po'i yon tan shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: “By inference from the people, who possess the special excellence of being endowed with the king’s virtues.”

original: 'bangs kyi yon tan ni skye bo rnams rang gi chos la dga' bas ya rabs kyi tshul la gnas pa la sogs pa'o //🔽yon tan brjod pas gzhan las thos pas mthong bar 'dod la mthong zhing legs @289a * //
analyzed: 'bangs kyi yon tan ni skye bo rnams rang gi chos la dga' bas ya rabs kyi tshul la gnas pa la sogs pa'o // yon tan brjod pas gzhan las thos pas mthong bar 'dod la mthong zhing legs @289a * //
translated: The people’s virtues are that they are happy in their own Dharma, they are upright, and so on.

original: par brtags pas nges par mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: par brtags pas nges par mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “By hearing about them from others, one wishes to see them. By seeing them and examining them well, one will know them directly.”

original: brtul zhugs ma nyams padma'i spyan //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ma nyams padma'i spyan //
translated: “His eyes are like lotus petals.”

original: zhes bya ba rgyal po la bos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyal po la bos pa'o //
translated: This is the address to the king.

original: snying rje med kyang pha rol gsad par mi nus na yang 'bad pa don med par 'gyur /
analyzed: snying rje med kyang pha rol gsad par mi nus na yang 'bad pa don med par 'gyur /
translated: Even if one is without compassion, if one cannot kill another, then the effort is useless.

original: gal te gsad par nus na bdag la phan par byed pa la goms pa yin na yang de la dka' ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te gsad par nus na bdag la phan par byed pa la goms pa yin na yang de la dka' ba ci zhig yod /
translated: If one can kill, then one is accustomed to benefiting oneself, so what is difficult about that?

original: de lta bu gsad par dka' ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta bu gsad par dka' ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like that, difficult to kill.

original: de dag gis ni zas bsgrub pa'i dus kyi gnod pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de dag gis ni zas bsgrub pa'i dus kyi gnod pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the harm at the time of obtaining food,

original: 'bras bu'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir snying rje med cing ma zhi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir snying rje med cing ma zhi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: in order to teach the fault of the result, it says, without compassion, not peaceful, and so on.

original: bcos pa'i sdug bsngal ni ched du bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: bcos pa'i sdug bsngal ni ched du bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The suffering of correction is deliberately accomplished.

original: shin tu bzang po ni don che ba ste 'di gzhan gyi srog rten pa dang gzhan du bdag gi byang chub chen po nye bar brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bzang po ni don che ba ste 'di gzhan gyi srog rten pa dang gzhan du bdag gi byang chub chen po nye bar brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Very good means great purpose, because it supports the life of another and in another way supports one's own great enlightenment.

original: lhas 'di dag mi mkhyen pa yang ma lags te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhas 'di dag mi mkhyen pa yang ma lags te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that the gods do not know this, and so on.

original: 'di dag bsam pa gang gis slong ba'i bsam pa mkhyen pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: 'di dag bsam pa gang gis slong ba'i bsam pa mkhyen pa'i rigs te /
translated: These are the thoughts by which they are motivated.

original: des na gtang bar mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: des na gtang bar mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to give.

original: bsam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thought?

original: skye dgu rnams la gnod pa gang dang gang de dang de dag gis gnod sbyin rnams la dga' bas rgyal po la gnod pas gzhan rnams la yang gnod pa'i phyir slong ba yin gyi rgyal po la slong ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye dgu rnams la gnod pa gang dang gang de dang de dag gis gnod sbyin rnams la dga' bas rgyal po la gnod pas gzhan rnams la yang gnod pa'i phyir slong ba yin gyi rgyal po la slong ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Whatever harm there is to living beings, by that very harm the yakshas are delighted. Because of the harm to the king, they also harm others. They are motivated by that, not just by asking the king.

original: de'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //🔽skyes bu dpa'o bo khyod kyi mthus bskyab pa'i //
analyzed: de'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir // skyes bu dpa'o bo khyod kyi mthus bskyab pa'i //
translated: In order to clarify that meaning, it says:🔽By your power, O hero, the world is protected.

original: 'jig rten gdon mi za bar 'dis mi bzod //
analyzed: 'jig rten gdon mi za bar 'dis mi bzod //
translated: Undoubtedly, this is unbearable for them.🔽This means they are motivated by that cause.

original: ces bya ba ste de'i rgyus slong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / tshul gyis tshul min skye dgu phung bar 'dod //
analyzed: ces bya ba ste de'i rgyus slong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / tshul gyis tshul min skye dgu phung bar 'dod //
translated: By that method, they desire the destruction of living beings.

original: ces bya ba ni gus par slong ba'i tshul gyis blangs pas rgyal po grongs par 'gyur ba dang skyabs med pa'i skye dgu rang dbang du phung bar byed /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gus par slong ba'i tshul gyis blangs pas rgyal po grongs par 'gyur ba dang skyabs med pa'i skye dgu rang dbang du phung bar byed /
translated: This is the way to respectfully request the king to give his body.

original: da lta rgyal po la brten nas ma nus so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: da lta rgyal po la brten nas ma nus so snyam pa'o //
translated: The demons think that they are unable to harm the king now because he is protected by his royal status.

original: rgyal po'i sha khrag tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing de tsam don du gnyer ba ma yin par cis shes she na ;
analyzed: rgyal po'i sha khrag tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing de tsam don du gnyer ba ma yin par cis shes she na ;
translated: How do we know that the demons are not satisfied with just the king's flesh and blood and are not seeking just that?

original: mchod sbyin tshe na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'ang /🔽tshil dang zhag la sogs pa bsregs pas mgu //
analyzed: mchod sbyin tshe na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'ang / tshil dang zhag la sogs pa bsregs pas mgu //
translated: When making offerings to the gods, the demigods are satisfied

original: zhes bya ba ste /🔽lha rten la mchod sbyin byed pa'i tshe na gnod sbyin pas bzang ba'i su bcu rtsa gsum pa la yang de tsam gyis mgu na gzhan lta ci smos pa las da lta ni khyod @289b kyis zhal zas phun sum tshogs ba dag gus par byin yang 'di dag
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / lha rten la mchod sbyin byed pa'i tshe na gnod sbyin pas bzang ba'i su bcu rtsa gsum pa la yang de tsam gyis mgu na gzhan lta ci smos pa las da lta ni khyod @289b kyis zhal zas phun sum tshogs ba dag gus par byin yang 'di dag
translated: with the burning of fat, marrow and so forth.🔽When making offerings to the gods, the demigods are satisfied with just that much.🔽What need is there to mention others?

original: 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But now, even though you respectfully give them abundant food, they are not satisfied.

original: chos kyi bka' khrims dag la thog mar 'gro ba ni gang gis lhag par bya dgos pa'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bka' khrims dag la thog mar 'gro ba ni gang gis lhag par bya dgos pa'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
translated: The king, who is to be honored above all others, is the one who first establishes the royal law of Dharma.

original: gnas skabs ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ngan pa'i spyod pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ngan pa'i spyod pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: “What will happen to the people?” means that they will only engage in evil conduct.

original: gtong ba 'di yang skye dgu rnams kyi don gyi phyir te de la rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pas slob tu gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtong ba 'di yang skye dgu rnams kyi don gyi phyir te de la rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pas slob tu gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This generosity is also for the sake of beings, in order to encourage them to train in rejoicing and so forth.

original: des ni gong du skye dgu la gnod par 'gyur snyam pa'i lan don gyis btab pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni gong du skye dgu la gnod par 'gyur snyam pa'i lan don gyis btab pa yin no //
translated: This implicitly answers the question, “Wouldn’t that harm beings?”

original: dge ba'i gzi ci 'dra ste gzi nyams par 'gyur te zla ba gzas zin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i gzi ci 'dra ste gzi nyams par 'gyur te zla ba gzas zin pa lta bu'o //
translated: “What will the splendor of virtue be like?” means that it will be diminished, like the moon when it is eclipsed.

original: legs sam gal te ma legs kyang //
analyzed: legs sam gal te ma legs kyang //
translated: Whether it is good or not,

original: zhes bya ba ni slong ba po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slong ba po'o //
translated: this refers to the beggar.

original: de ltar byed pa ci 'drar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa ci 'drar 'gyur //
translated: “What will happen to those who act like that?”

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa'i nyes pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i gegs byed pa'i nyes pa ston to //
translated: This shows the fault of obstructing generosity.

original: the tshom za na rgya cher mi 'gyur ba gtong ngam mi gtong zhes the tshom za na dge ba rgya cher mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: the tshom za na rgya cher mi 'gyur ba gtong ngam mi gtong zhes the tshom za na dge ba rgya cher mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one hesitates, one does not give extensively. If one hesitates, thinking, “Should I give or not? ” one does not give extensively.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni shin tu nges pas gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni shin tu nges pas gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: The giving of the bodhisattva is very certain, and cannot be taken away by others.

original: 'jungs shing zhum pa ni ser snas mi gtong bar nges bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'jungs shing zhum pa ni ser snas mi gtong bar nges bar byas pa ste /
translated: Stinginess and timidity are the certainty of not giving due to avarice.

original: de ni byang chub kyi lam gtong ba la shin tu sgrib pas mun pa'i mchog ste mun pa bas ches mun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub kyi lam gtong ba la shin tu sgrib pas mun pa'i mchog ste mun pa bas ches mun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that is a very great obstruction to the giving which is the path to enlightenment, it is the greatest darkness, called “blacker than black. ”

original: dka' ba mchog dang ldan pas lus ma nyams te ma 'gyel ba'o //
analyzed: dka' ba mchog dang ldan pas lus ma nyams te ma 'gyel ba'o //
translated: Endowed with the greatest difficulty, he does not collapse, his body does not fail.

original: brtan pa dang ldan pas sems ma brgyal ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang ldan pas sems ma brgyal ba'o //
translated: Endowed with firmness, his mind does not fail.

original: lus kyi yon tan ldan pas te lus rgyas pas khrag gi rgyun yang ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi yon tan ldan pas te lus rgyas pas khrag gi rgyun yang ma zad pa'o //
translated: Endowed with physical excellence, his body being well developed, the flow of his blood does not fail.

original: sdug bsngal mang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni spyir lus don med pa gnod pa'i gnas yin yang bdag gi lus don dang bcas par mthong bas lus la yang drin dran pa lta bur gyur to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni spyir lus don med pa gnod pa'i gnas yin yang bdag gi lus don dang bcas par mthong bas lus la yang drin dran pa lta bur gyur to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The body is a basis of much suffering, as shown in the Sūtra on the Wise and Foolish and in the master Śāntideva’s statement:🔽Even though you have protected it for a long time,🔽it will leave you and go elsewhere.🔽The body is ungrateful, as shown in the Sūtra on the Wise and Foolish and in the master Śāntideva’s statement:

original: lus sdug bsngal mang po'i gnas yin pa dang byas pa mi gzo ba dpas byin gyi mdo la sogs pa dang / slob dpon sh'anta de bas kyang //
analyzed: lus sdug bsngal mang po'i gnas yin pa dang byas pa mi gzo ba dpas byin gyi mdo la sogs pa dang / slob dpon sh'anta de bas kyang //
translated: Even though you have protected it for a long time,🔽it will leave you and go elsewhere.🔽The body is ungrateful, as shown in the Sūtra on the Wise and Foolish and in the master Śāntideva’s statement:

original: 'jigs gnas chung la 'jigs skye ba //
analyzed: 'jigs gnas chung la 'jigs skye ba //
translated: Even though you have protected it for a long time,

original: zhes pas bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pas bstan to //
translated: it will leave you and go elsewhere.🔽The body is ungrateful, as shown in the Sūtra on the Wise and Foolish and in the master Śāntideva’s statement:🔽Even though you have protected it for a long time,🔽it will leave you and go elsewhere.

original: ral gri rnon pos lus bcad pas sdug bsngal drangs pa dang byin pas dga' bas yang yun ring du bskrad pa dang de'i sdug bsngal yid la byed pa dang 'jug pa chung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ral gri rnon pos lus bcad pas sdug bsngal drangs pa dang byin pas dga' bas yang yun ring du bskrad pa dang de'i sdug bsngal yid la byed pa dang 'jug pa chung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The body is ungrateful, as shown in the Sūtra on the Wise and Foolish and in the master Śāntideva’s statement:

original: don gang la skyo zhing @290a * //🔽lan de la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa chung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: don gang la skyo zhing @290a * //🔽lan de la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa chung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Even though you have protected it for a long time,🔽it will leave you and go elsewhere.

original: gus pa'i dbang gis skye bo khyod kyi grags pa sgrogs pa ni ba lang rdzi la sogs pa rgyal po la bstod pa dag go / thog tu bab pa ni bden par nges pa ste snying rje'i spyod pa rlabs po che mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pa'i dbang gis skye bo khyod kyi grags pa sgrogs pa ni ba lang rdzi la sogs pa rgyal po la bstod pa dag go / thog tu bab pa ni bden par nges pa ste snying rje'i spyod pa rlabs po che mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth is confirmed by the great wave of compassionate conduct that is seen.

original: dpal ni yid du 'ong ba'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa padma'i nags tshal ku mu ta'i skyed mos tshal lta bu la grags na de ni skye bo rnams kyi dga' ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: dpal ni yid du 'ong ba'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa padma'i nags tshal ku mu ta'i skyed mos tshal lta bu la grags na de ni skye bo rnams kyi dga' ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: When glory, the perfect abundance of what is pleasing, like a lotus grove or a garden of kumuta flowers, is proclaimed, it is the cause of joy for people.

original: rgyal po nyid skye dgu dgra rnams la phan 'dogs pas dpal nyid rgyal po la brten pa thog tu bab ste yid ches so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po nyid skye dgu dgra rnams la phan 'dogs pas dpal nyid rgyal po la brten pa thog tu bab ste yid ches so zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the king himself benefits beings, glory itself depends on the king. This is confirmed.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams brgya byin mngon sum du gyur kyang de la mi rnams kyis smon par mi 'os kyi rgyal po khyod kyi mthus bskyabs pa'i lha mi 'di mtho ris sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi mi'i rgyal po dang bcas ba mthong
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams brgya byin mngon sum du gyur kyang de la mi rnams kyis smon par mi 'os kyi rgyal po khyod kyi mthus bskyabs pa'i lha mi 'di mtho ris sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi mi'i rgyal po dang bcas ba mthong
translated: But these gods and humans who are protected by your power, O King, are worthy of the aspiration and desire of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three and the humans of the king's realm.

original: bar smon cing 'dod par nges te gal te bag yod pas bsgrub pa'i mi rnams la mi smon par bag med pa'i lha la smon na bslus pa lags te 'khrul pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar smon cing 'dod par nges te gal te bag yod pas bsgrub pa'i mi rnams la mi smon par bag med pa'i lha la smon na bslus pa lags te 'khrul pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If they were to aspire to the careless gods rather than to the humans who practice with carefulness, they would be deceived and mistaken.

original: ji skad du mdo las 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par dga' ba na gnas pa'i mi rnams gang gi tshe sum cu rtsa gsum du phyin pa de'i tshe lha rnams la smon par mi byed de /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par dga' ba na gnas pa'i mi rnams gang gi tshe sum cu rtsa gsum du phyin pa de'i tshe lha rnams la smon par mi byed de /
translated: As it says in a sutra, the humans who live in the Abhirati world-system do not aspire to the gods when they go to the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag cag gi longs spyod 'di dag la mi sman la bdag cag lhag par de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag gi longs spyod 'di dag la mi sman la bdag cag lhag par de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We do not enjoy these enjoyments, but the Tathagata does.

original: lha rnams mi'i nang du 'ongs pa'i tshe ni smon par byed de mi rnams kyi longs spyod bdag cag las mi dman gyi steng du ni 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes sems so zhes 'byung ba dang 'dra'o snyam du bsams pa yin no
analyzed: lha rnams mi'i nang du 'ongs pa'i tshe ni smon par byed de mi rnams kyi longs spyod bdag cag las mi dman gyi steng du ni 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes sems so zhes 'byung ba dang 'dra'o snyam du bsams pa yin no
translated: When the gods come among humans, they aspire to human enjoyments, thinking, “Human enjoyments are not inferior to ours, and on top of that, the Tathagata dwells here.”

original: // thams cad pa'i bdag po ni thams cad kyi bdag po ste 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: // thams cad pa'i bdag po ni thams cad kyi bdag po ste 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'o //
translated: The lord of all is the universal monarch.

original: nor gyis phyug pa ni rnam thos so //
analyzed: nor gyis phyug pa ni rnam thos so //
translated: The wealthy are the extremely wealthy.

original: rnam par grol ba ni thar pa ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni thar pa ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gnyis so //
translated: Liberation is the two enlightenments of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sa'i bdag po dang nor gyis phyug pa mi 'dod pa ni srid pa'i longs spyod bde mi 'dod ces pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i bdag po dang nor gyis phyug pa mi 'dod pa ni srid pa'i longs spyod bde mi 'dod ces pa'o //
translated: Not desiring the lord of the earth or the wealthy is not desiring the happiness of worldly enjoyments.

original: dbang po dang tshangs pa mi 'dod pa ni lha dbang dpal yang 'dod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //🔽rnam par grol ba mi 'dod pa ni bdag gi sdug bsngal zad pa @290b tsam gyi phyir nga yi yid ni mgu bar 'gyur ma yin zhes so //🔽'o na ci 'dod pa na 'gro ba'i don gyi byang chub chen po 'dod par ston pa ni sdug bsngal mi zad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽khyod kyi mdzad pa 'di kun ni //
analyzed: dbang po dang tshangs pa mi 'dod pa ni lha dbang dpal yang 'dod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o // rnam par grol ba mi 'dod pa ni bdag gi sdug bsngal zad pa @290b tsam gyi phyir nga yi yid ni mgu bar 'gyur ma yin zhes so // 'o na ci 'dod pa na 'gro ba'i don gyi byang chub chen po 'dod par ston pa ni sdug bsngal mi zad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // khyod kyi mdzad pa 'di kun ni //
translated: The non-acceptance of Indra and Brahma is also not the acceptance of the Lord of the gods, Indra.🔽The non-acceptance of liberation is because of the mere exhaustion of suffering, as is said:🔽“My mind is not satisfied with mere exhaustion of suffering.”🔽🔽Now, in order to show the desire for the great enlightenment for the sake of going to the world, he says, “If suffering is inexhaustible,” and so on.🔽All of these deeds of yours🔽

original: 'jig rten phan pa'i phyir lags kyi //🔽bdag cag rang la phan 'tshal bas //🔽de tshe bdag la dgongs su gsol //🔽zhes bya ba la chos kyi lam la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa de khas blangs pa'o //🔽bdag gi don yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzod pa gsol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //

original: lam 'di ni nga la phan pa yin gyi gnod pa ma yin pas mi bzod du dogs pa ma skyed cig zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lam 'di ni nga la phan pa yin gyi gnod pa ma yin pas mi bzod du dogs pa ma skyed cig zhes pa'o //
translated: This path is beneficial for me, not harmful, so do not give rise to impatience.

original: khyod kyi bka' yang bdag cag la 'dzem pa med pas stsal ba'i rigs te /🔽dper na rgyal po nyid kyis rjes su bzung ba'i 'os su gyur pa'i blon po dag la bka' stsal pa zhes pa de'i lan ni /
analyzed: khyod kyi bka' yang bdag cag la 'dzem pa med pas stsal ba'i rigs te / dper na rgyal po nyid kyis rjes su bzung ba'i 'os su gyur pa'i blon po dag la bka' stsal pa zhes pa de'i lan ni /
translated: It is fitting for you to give us your command without hesitation.

original: de ni de la dga' bar shes byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de la dga' bar shes byas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The reply to that is the verse beginning Having understood that he is pleased with them.

original: de na gnas pa'i rnga rnams zhes bya ba ni gser gyi ri rab la gnas pa'i lha'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i rnga rnams zhes bya ba ni gser gyi ri rab la gnas pa'i lha'i sgra'o //
translated: The drums that reside there are the sounds of the gods who reside on Mount Meru.

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i rlabs rang bzhin las lhag pa ni dus su g-yo ba'i rlabs pas ches lhag par dus ma yin par g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i rlabs rang bzhin las lhag pa ni dus su g-yo ba'i rlabs pas ches lhag par dus ma yin par g-yo ba'o //
translated: The waves of the great ocean are naturally excessive, and the waves that move at the right time are even more excessive when they move at the wrong time.

original: 'gro ba brdzun pa'i lus ni gzi mdangs can zhes bya ba ni rgyal po ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba brdzun pa'i lus ni gzi mdangs can zhes bya ba ni rgyal po ste /
translated: The world's false body is radiant, where radiant refers to the king.

original: 'gro ba la brdzun pas de 'gro ba la phan 'dogs par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la brdzun pas de 'gro ba la phan 'dogs par brtson pa'o //
translated: He is a liar in regard to going, since he strives to benefit beings by going.

original: de lta bu sa'i bdag pos bzlog cing spran pa lta bur rgya mtsho'i shugs kyis rlabs kyi sgra 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu sa'i bdag pos bzlog cing spran pa lta bur rgya mtsho'i shugs kyis rlabs kyi sgra 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sound of the waves in the ocean is like the sound of the lord of the earth calling out and like the sound of his reply.

original: ae ma'o skye bo dam pa'i cho rigs bzang zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang 'bras bu bzang ba ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o skye bo dam pa'i cho rigs bzang zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang 'bras bu bzang ba ste /
translated: How excellent is the good family of the holy person! means that it is firm and has a good result,

original: gzhan la phan pa'i 'bras bu dang byang chub chen po'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i 'bras bu dang byang chub chen po'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the result which is the benefit of others and of great enlightenment.

original: ae ma'o yon tan goms pas rgya re che zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i yon tan de rgyu yun ring du goms par ma byas par gtong ba de lta bu mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ae ma'o yon tan goms pas rgya re che zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i yon tan de rgyu yun ring du goms par ma byas par gtong ba de lta bu mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How great is the extent of the virtue of practice! means that such a gift cannot be made without a long time of practice of the cause of that virtue.

original: ae ma'o gzhan la phan pas blo re bde //
analyzed: ae ma'o gzhan la phan pas blo re bde //
translated: How happy is the mind of the one who benefits others!

original: ces bya ba ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: means that it is not carried away by others, either in thought or in action.

original: ;/ de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pas sa 'di khyod la gtad pa ste rgyal por bskos pa'o //
analyzed: ;/ de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pas sa 'di khyod la gtad pa ste rgyal por bskos pa'o //
translated: 1. Since he has such virtues, this earth is entrusted to you, i.e., you are appointed king.

original: mi rnams ni mgon dang bcas pa ste gnod pa rnams las skyob pa'i bya ba @291a * //
analyzed: mi rnams ni mgon dang bcas pa ste gnod pa rnams las skyob pa'i bya ba @291a * //
translated: Men are protected, i.e., saved from harm.

original: byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gzengs bstod pa ni spro ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gzengs bstod pa ni spro ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Encouragement is the arousing of enthusiasm.

original: snying rje'i yon tan bsngags pa ni snying rjes gzhan la phan pa dang rang gi tshogs rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje'i yon tan bsngags pa ni snying rjes gzhan la phan pa dang rang gi tshogs rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The praise of the virtues of compassion is because of the benefit to others and the completion of one's own stores.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba ni rgyu'i che ba'i sgo nas ste nyan thos la sogs pa la ni rgyu de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba ni rgyu'i che ba'i sgo nas ste nyan thos la sogs pa la ni rgyu de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of the Tathagata is from the point of view of the greatness of his cause, because the Disciples, etc., do not have such a cause.

original: bsti stang byas te chos mnyan pa ni de ltar tshogs bsags pa'i rgyal ba rnyed par dka' bas de'i chos thos par dka' zhing don che bar shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsti stang byas te chos mnyan pa ni de ltar tshogs bsags pa'i rgyal ba rnyed par dka' bas de'i chos thos par dka' zhing don che bar shes bar bya'o //
translated: The Dharma is to be listened to with reverence, because the Victorious One, having thus accumulated the stores, is difficult to find, and his Dharma is difficult to hear and is of great meaning.

original: gzhan yang gnod sbyin de dag gis chos thos pa de dag gi yang don du 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnod sbyin de dag gis chos thos pa de dag gi yang don du 'gyur bas na /
translated: Moreover, since those yakṣas are also for the sake of those who hear the Dharma,

original: chos thos pa don che bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thos pa don che bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: one should also apply “greatly meaningful to hear the Dharma.”

original: dge slong lnga po 'di dag ces bya ba ni lnga sde bzang po ste /
analyzed: dge slong lnga po 'di dag ces bya ba ni lnga sde bzang po ste /
translated: “These five monks” are the five excellent monks,

original: koo din+ya dang / rta thul dang // rlangs pa dang // ming chen dang // bzang ldan no //
analyzed: koo din+ya dang / rta thul dang // rlangs pa dang // ming chen dang // bzang ldan no //
translated: Kauṇḍinya, Aśvajit, Bāṣpa, Mahānāman, and Bhadrika.

original: 'di dag mang du byed byed zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la phan pa mang du byas pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa stag phrug lnga shas gsos pa dang shu to la kar ne la sogs pa'i rtogs pa brjod pa dang sbyar bar
analyzed: 'di dag mang du byed byed zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la phan pa mang du byas pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa stag phrug lnga shas gsos pa dang shu to la kar ne la sogs pa'i rtogs pa brjod pa dang sbyar bar
translated: “They did much for me” refers to the Tathāgata’s doing much for their benefit, such as raising five tiger cubs, and the avadānas of Śūrpī, Karṇa, and so on.

original: bya'o // chos kyi bdud rtsi sbyin pa ni thog mar chos bshad pas chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bya'o // chos kyi bdud rtsi sbyin pa ni thog mar chos bshad pas chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The gift of the nectar of the Dharma is the purity of the eye of Dharma with respect to phenomena through first explaining the Dharma.

original: byams pa'i stobs kyi rabs te brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: byams pa'i stobs kyi rabs te brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the eighth chapter, on the family of the power of love.

original: // / dbang po dul ba la sogs pa ni rgyu'i yon tan te tshe rabs du mar rang dbang po bsdams pa de'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: // / dbang po dul ba la sogs pa ni rgyu'i yon tan te tshe rabs du mar rang dbang po bsdams pa de'i sgo nas so //
translated: The qualities of the cause are having disciplined faculties and so forth. For many lifetimes, one has restrained one’s faculties.

original: dpa' ba ni snying stobs so //
analyzed: dpa' ba ni snying stobs so //
translated: Heroic means having courage.

original: tshul ni rgyal po'i spyod tshul lugs kyi bstan bcos bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: tshul ni rgyal po'i spyod tshul lugs kyi bstan bcos bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Etiquette is the treatise on the system of royal conduct.

original: dul ba phun sum tshogs pa ni bzod cing des pa'o //
analyzed: dul ba phun sum tshogs pa ni bzod cing des pa'o //
translated: Being fully disciplined is being patient and gentle.

original: de lta bu dag gis gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyal srid rnam par rgyal ba'i dpal thob pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag gis gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyal srid rnam par rgyal ba'i dpal thob pa'o //
translated: By being such, one attains the glory of a completely victorious kingdom that is superior to others.

original: brtag pa'i don gyi de kho na nyid ni rta brtag pa dang glang po che brtag pa la sogs pa brtag pa bco brgyad la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa'i don gyi de kho na nyid ni rta brtag pa dang glang po che brtag pa la sogs pa brtag pa bco brgyad la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The reality of the meaning of investigation is being skilled in the eighteen investigations, such as the investigation of horses and the investigation of elephants.

original: nang gi 'khor rnams kyis bka' khrims bzang po bsgrags pa zhes sbyar te nang gi blon po dag gis rgyal po'i bka' khrims bcas shing bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi 'khor rnams kyis bka' khrims bzang po bsgrags pa zhes sbyar te nang gi blon po dag gis rgyal po'i bka' khrims bcas shing bsgrags pa'o //
translated: The proclamation of good royal laws by the inner retinue is the proclamation of the royal laws that are established by the inner ministers.

original: blon po de dag gi yon tan yang rang gi chos dang las la 'bad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blon po de dag gi yon tan yang rang gi chos dang las la 'bad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities of those ministers are stated in the lines beginning “They are diligent in their own duties and in the Dharma” and so on.

original: chos ni tshe gzhan gyi ched du bsod nams brtsam pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni tshe gzhan gyi ched du bsod nams brtsam pa'o //
translated: The Dharma refers to the cultivation of merit for the sake of future lives.

original: las ni tshe 'di'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: las ni tshe 'di'i bya ba'o //
translated: Duties refer to the activities of this life.

original: yid ma byung ba ni bya ba la skyo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yid ma byung ba ni bya ba la skyo ba med pa'o //
translated: Not discouraged means not weary of activities.

original: bde @291b bar 'tsho ba ni legs par 'tsho ba ste nyon mongs shing sdig pa dang ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bde @291b bar 'tsho ba ni legs par 'tsho ba ste nyon mongs shing sdig pa dang ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: Living happily means living well, without being afflicted or involved in evil.

original: snying nye ba ni rgyal po bka' stsal pa bsgrub par sems pa'o //
analyzed: snying nye ba ni rgyal po bka' stsal pa bsgrub par sems pa'o //
translated: Close to the heart means thinking of carrying out the king’s orders.

original: dpal snying nye ba ni 'khor dang 'byor pa bdag gi bsam pa dang mthun par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: dpal snying nye ba ni 'khor dang 'byor pa bdag gi bsam pa dang mthun par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Glorious and close to the heart means engaging in accordance with the king’s thoughts in terms of retinue and wealth.🔽For example, it is like a noble wife,

original: dper na rigs ldan chung ma bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te rgyal po'i btsun mo dam pa la sogs pa rgyal po'i bsam pa dang mthun par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rigs ldan chung ma bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te rgyal po'i btsun mo dam pa la sogs pa rgyal po'i bsam pa dang mthun par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: as stated in the lines beginning “Just as a king’s chief queen and so on.”

original: dka' thub ni tshul khrims dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub ni tshul khrims dang sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Ascetic means possessing ethical discipline and the qualities of training.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas par goms pas na mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas par goms pas na mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is a scholar because he is accustomed to being learned in the five sciences.

original: sgyu rtsal ni /
analyzed: sgyu rtsal ni /
translated: Arts are

original: dgra thul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra thul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the skills of subduing enemies and so forth.

original: rgyal tshab tu gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'khrungs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal tshab tu gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'khrungs par gyur pa'o //
translated: He became the crown prince means he was born.

original: de rim gyis nar son te de'i yon tan gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rim gyis nar son te de'i yon tan gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He gradually grew up and his other qualities are mentioned beginning with

original: grags ngan chos la ma bltas par bya ba ni gzhan la phrag dog gis slong du bcug pa grags pa ngan pa'i rgyu yin zhing sdig pa'i rgyu yin yang tshe 'di la grags pa ngan pa dang tshe gzhan gyi gnod pa la mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: grags ngan chos la ma bltas par bya ba ni gzhan la phrag dog gis slong du bcug pa grags pa ngan pa'i rgyu yin zhing sdig pa'i rgyu yin yang tshe 'di la grags pa ngan pa dang tshe gzhan gyi gnod pa la mi lta ba'o //
translated: He did not care about the bad reputation that would come from asking for the elephant out of jealousy for others, and he did not care about the bad reputation and harm in other lives that would come from the sin of asking for the elephant.

original: khyod kyi rgyal ba ni rgyal bar byed pas rgyal ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhi de nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyod kyi rgyal ba ni rgyal bar byed pas rgyal ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi gzhi de nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is that reality which is the basis of all perfect victory, the one who causes victory?

original: gzugs can zhes te glang po che nyid la brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can zhes te glang po che nyid la brjod pa'o //
translated: It is the one called “having form,” which refers to the elephant.

original: 'khor gsum rten la mkhas pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang phan 'dogs pa dang yon tan gyi zhing la bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum rten la mkhas pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang phan 'dogs pa dang yon tan gyi zhing la bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
translated: Skill in the three spheres is to honor those who are suffering, who are benefactors, and who are fields of good qualities.

original: yang na yul dang bsam pa dang tshul la mi lta ba ni rgyal srid bsgrub pa'i tshul lugs kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba yin la de yang mi lta zhing de'i rjes su byed pa ma yin gyi chos kyi rjes su byed pa'o ;
analyzed: yang na yul dang bsam pa dang tshul la mi lta ba ni rgyal srid bsgrub pa'i tshul lugs kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba yin la de yang mi lta zhing de'i rjes su byed pa ma yin gyi chos kyi rjes su byed pa'o ;
translated: Or else, not looking at the country, the intention, or the method is to not look at and not follow the treatises on the methods for acquiring a kingdom, but to follow the Dharma.

original: /'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i lam mi 'gro ni gzhan gyis bcas pa'i khrims mi 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: /'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i lam mi 'gro ni gzhan gyis bcas pa'i khrims mi 'jig pa'o //
translated: Not going by a path that is contrary to the Vinaya is to not destroy the rules that others have laid down.

original: bag med pa la mi dga' ba ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa la mi dga' ba ni bsam pa'o //
translated: Disliking carelessness is the intention.

original: nyes ba byas pa ma mthong ba ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nyes ba byas pa ma mthong ba ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: Not seeing faults is the application.

original: 'dod chags bdo ba'i slob dpon gyis //
analyzed: 'dod chags bdo ba'i slob dpon gyis //
translated: The peacock dances when the master of passion🔽teaches.

original: bstan pa'i rma bya gar byed ces pa ni ji ltar mi rnams kyi gar mkhas pa'i khyad par ni slob dpon gyis slob pa ltar rma bya yang chags pa'i stobs kyis gar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i rma bya gar byed ces pa ni ji ltar mi rnams kyi gar mkhas pa'i khyad par ni slob dpon gyis slob pa ltar rma bya yang chags pa'i stobs kyis gar byed pa'o //
translated: Just as the special skill of humans in dancing is taught by a master, so the peacock dances through the power of passion.

original: ma smad pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma smad pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Not reproached means not becoming a cause of afflictions.

original: 'bras bu zhim po yod pa'i grib shing dag ni shing aa mra'i sdong po'am bza' shing gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhim po yod pa'i grib shing dag ni shing aa mra'i sdong po'am bza' shing gi khyad par ro //
translated: Trees with delicious fruit and shade are mango trees or special fruit trees.

original: de'i 'bras bu dang grib mas @292a * //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang grib mas @292a * //
translated: From those which benefit people with their fruit and shade,

original: skye bo la phan 'dogs pa yod pa las skyes bu byis pa'i rang bzhin can gyis gcad pa'i phyir sta re gzas pa las 'dzin pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni shing dang mi brten pa'i sa phyogs so //
analyzed: skye bo la phan 'dogs pa yod pa las skyes bu byis pa'i rang bzhin can gyis gcad pa'i phyir sta re gzas pa las 'dzin pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni shing dang mi brten pa'i sa phyogs so //
translated: a person of childish nature would cut them down with an axe. The place where the axe is held is called the ground, which is a place that does not support trees or people.

original: ngo mtshar ma gyur pa ni 'dir byar mi rung zhes mi bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar ma gyur pa ni 'dir byar mi rung zhes mi bzlog pa'o //
translated: Not becoming amazed means not stopping, saying This is not suitable here.

original: de ni sa la sems med cing bems po yin pas mi bzlog gi bsam pa yod na de ci ste mi bzlog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sa la sems med cing bems po yin pas mi bzlog gi bsam pa yod na de ci ste mi bzlog ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since the ground has no mind and is inanimate, it does not stop. If it had intention, why would it not stop?

original: yang na byis pa shing gi khyad par gcod pa shing de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs dang bcas pa ngo mtshar du mi 'dzin cing chud gzon pa'i mi de sems med pa bzhin du blun par mngon no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na byis pa shing gi khyad par gcod pa shing de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs dang bcas pa ngo mtshar du mi 'dzin cing chud gzon pa'i mi de sems med pa bzhin du blun par mngon no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, the fool is like a person who does not consider it a wonder, and does not value the place where there is a tree with such and such characteristics, and who destroys it.

original: dpe de bzhin du rgyal po thams cad sgrol dbul po thams cad kyi bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa skyed par byed cing gces par mi 'dzin pa ni de 'dra'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe de bzhin du rgyal po thams cad sgrol dbul po thams cad kyi bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa skyed par byed cing gces par mi 'dzin pa ni de 'dra'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just so, King Viśvantara, the cause of the happiness of all the poor, does not value what he has given.

original: dpe gzhan yang chu gtsang zhing zhim po bsil bas gang ba'i rdzing bu 'dral ba dag kyang mi 'gag pa'i skyes bu byis pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa ltar rgyal po skrod pa la mi 'gog pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: dpe gzhan yang chu gtsang zhing zhim po bsil bas gang ba'i rdzing bu 'dral ba dag kyang mi 'gag pa'i skyes bu byis pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa ltar rgyal po skrod pa la mi 'gog pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as a person of childish nature, who does not stop the digging of a pond filled with pure, sweet, cold water, so also the king who does not stop the expulsion of the king.

original: 'jig rten skyong rnams ming ni don med gyur pa ni sgra'i don mi gnas pas yul na blon po la sogs pa mdzangs pa med par mngon no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong rnams ming ni don med gyur pa ni sgra'i don mi gnas pas yul na blon po la sogs pa mdzangs pa med par mngon no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The protectors of the world, whose names are meaningless, are like a country where the ministers and so on are not wise, because the meaning of the words is not established.

original: bzang po grags pa zad dam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten skyong ba grags pa zad dam ste thams cad shi bar gyur tam //
analyzed: bzang po grags pa zad dam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten skyong ba grags pa zad dam ste thams cad shi bar gyur tam //
translated: Is the fame of the good exhausted? means Is the fame of the protectors of the world exhausted? that is, have they all died?

original: 'on te gud du song ste gzhan re zhig song ngam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te gud du song ste gzhan re zhig song ngam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or have they gone elsewhere? means Have they gone somewhere else for a while?

original: slong mo pa'i srog la rgol ba ste rgyal po bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: slong mo pa'i srog la rgol ba ste rgyal po bskrad pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the mendicants is the expulsion of the king.

original: de mi srung zhing de las mi skyob pas de la slong mo pa phung byed mkhas pa med de de nyid phung ba'i rgyu chen po'o //
analyzed: de mi srung zhing de las mi skyob pas de la slong mo pa phung byed mkhas pa med de de nyid phung ba'i rgyu chen po'o //
translated: Since he does not protect them and does not save them from that, there is no skilled destroyer of the mendicants in him. That itself is the great cause of destruction.

original: gang na 'di ltar glo bur du 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni nags tshal gyi mthu'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: gang na 'di ltar glo bur du 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ni nags tshal gyi mthu'i khyad par ston to //
translated: The verse beginning Where such a guest shows the special power of the forest.

original: nags tshal gang na zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: nags tshal gang na zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The line In which forest means

original: byams pa'i rtsa ba zug ste phan 'dogs pa'i rtsva 'jam po skyes pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i rtsa ba zug ste phan 'dogs pa'i rtsva 'jam po skyes pa'o //
translated: the forest in which the root of love is planted and soft grass that benefits grows.

original: gzhan yang ri nags kyi mchog bdag cag gi shing rtas 'dren pa la sogs pa gnas shing 'khod pa dang / dka' thub can gyis gnas byin gyis brlabs pas lha la sogs pas bkur sti bya ba'i gnas su bya ba'i nags tshal mthu chen khyad par 'phags pa 'di la ltos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ri nags kyi mchog bdag cag gi shing rtas 'dren pa la sogs pa gnas shing 'khod pa dang / dka' thub can gyis gnas byin gyis brlabs pas lha la sogs pas bkur sti bya ba'i gnas su bya ba'i nags tshal mthu chen khyad par 'phags pa 'di la ltos zhes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, look at this forest, which is the best of mountains and forests, where we are staying, and which is a place of worship for gods and so forth, because it is blessed by the sages who dwell there.🔽Then the queen said, “This is not the quality of the forest, but it is the power of your own roots of virtue.”

original: de nas btsun mos 'di ni nags tshal gyi yon tan ma yin gyi khyod nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs yin @292b no zhes ston pa ni dam pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas btsun mos 'di ni nags tshal gyi yon tan ma yin gyi khyod nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs yin @292b no zhes ston pa ni dam pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To teach this, it says in the root text, “The good qualities of the holy ones,” and so forth.

original: rab tu goms kyang zhes bya ba ni rab tu goms pa ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rab tu goms kyang zhes bya ba ni rab tu goms pa ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Even though they are not cultivated” means even though they are not cultivated.

original: ched du ma gnyer ba yang skye bo phal pa dang mi 'dra bas nye bar mkho ba'i yo byad 'byung gi gzhan la ni 'dod kyang mi 'byung bas bdag gi bsams na mthu chen de ste /
analyzed: ched du ma gnyer ba yang skye bo phal pa dang mi 'dra bas nye bar mkho ba'i yo byad 'byung gi gzhan la ni 'dod kyang mi 'byung bas bdag gi bsams na mthu chen de ste /
translated: “Even though they are not sought” means that they are not like ordinary people. Therefore, the necessary articles arise, but for others, even though they are desired, they do not arise. Therefore, I think that the great power of the holy ones is like this.

original: ri dags bzhi shing rta khur ba ni rgyal po khyod kyi lags pa snyam mo //
analyzed: ri dags bzhi shing rta khur ba ni rgyal po khyod kyi lags pa snyam mo //
translated: The four deer who pull the chariot are yours, O King.

original: de lta bu'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu dmigs pas sngar byas pa'i yin par shes par bya ba'i dpe ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu dmigs pas sngar byas pa'i yin par shes par bya ba'i dpe ni /
translated: The example of the effect of merit that is to be known as the result of previous action is stated:

original: mtsho yi nang na skar ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams //
analyzed: mtsho yi nang na skar ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams //
translated: The reflections of the stars in the lake

original: ku mud rgyas pa rab tu mdzes gyur pa //
analyzed: ku mud rgyas pa rab tu mdzes gyur pa //
translated: are very beautiful with the blooming kumuda flowers,

original: zla ba'i 'od zer ltad mo lta ba bzhin //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer ltad mo lta ba bzhin //
translated: like the spectacle of the moon’s rays.

original: zhes smos te mtsho'i nang na skar ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams zla ba'i 'od zer bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan nam mkha'i skar ma la ltad mo lta ba bzhin mtsho'i nang du byung ba ni nam mkha'i zla ba dang skar ma la brten te byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes smos te mtsho'i nang na skar ma'i gzugs brnyan rnams zla ba'i 'od zer bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan nam mkha'i skar ma la ltad mo lta ba bzhin mtsho'i nang du byung ba ni nam mkha'i zla ba dang skar ma la brten te byung ba'o //
translated: The reflections of the stars in the lake are like the spectacle of the reflections of the moon and stars in the sky, which arise in the lake in dependence on the moon and stars in the sky.

original: mtsho'i nang du gzugs brnyan byung ba de ku mud rgyas pa'i mtsho'am skyed mos tshal bas kyang rab tu mdzes te /
analyzed: mtsho'i nang du gzugs brnyan byung ba de ku mud rgyas pa'i mtsho'am skyed mos tshal bas kyang rab tu mdzes te /
translated: The arising of the reflections in the lake is more beautiful than the lake with blooming kumuda flowers or a garden.

original: skar ma'i gzugs brnyan yang me tog dkar po dang 'dra bas de skad smras so //
analyzed: skar ma'i gzugs brnyan yang me tog dkar po dang 'dra bas de skad smras so //
translated: The reflection of the star is like a white flower, so it is said.

original: 'dir mchi ba'i ri dags rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa yang khyod nyid lags pa snyam mo //
analyzed: 'dir mchi ba'i ri dags rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa yang khyod nyid lags pa snyam mo //
translated: I think that you alone are the cause of the deer coming here.

original: thams cad sgrol gyi rabs te dgu pa'o /
analyzed: thams cad sgrol gyi rabs te dgu pa'o /
translated: The Story of Viśvantara

original: // / gdugs zla med pa ni rang gi rgyal srid la dbang ba la rgyal po de las gnyis pa dang lhan cig tu yul dbang byed pa ma yin pas rgyal po de'i spyi bor gdugs chen po lta bu'i gzugs can gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: // / gdugs zla med pa ni rang gi rgyal srid la dbang ba la rgyal po de las gnyis pa dang lhan cig tu yul dbang byed pa ma yin pas rgyal po de'i spyi bor gdugs chen po lta bu'i gzugs can gzhan med pa'o //
translated: The unrivaled sun is the king, for there is no other great umbrella-like form that rules over his own kingdom together with a second king.

original: bgo skal gyi rim par thob pa ni rang gi bgo skal gyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: bgo skal gyi rim par thob pa ni rang gi bgo skal gyis thob pa'o //
translated: The one who has attained his share is the one who has attained his own share.

original: dbang po'i dgra ni dbang po ma bsdams pa nyid dgra yin la de legs par bsdams pas thub pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i dgra ni dbang po ma bsdams pa nyid dgra yin la de legs par bsdams pas thub pa'o //
translated: The enemy of the senses is the uncontrolled senses themselves, and he is the sage who has well controlled them.

original: de ni sa'i mgon te de ni sa la gnas pa rnams kyi skye dgu rnams kyi mgon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sa'i mgon te de ni sa la gnas pa rnams kyi skye dgu rnams kyi mgon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the lord of the earth, for he is the protector of the people who dwell on the earth.

original: 'bras bu smin pas dge ba'i 'bras bu dang longs spyod kyi 'byor pa la ma chags par spyod pas /🔽rang don rnam smin sred spangs pas //
analyzed: 'bras bu smin pas dge ba'i 'bras bu dang longs spyod kyi 'byor pa la ma chags par spyod pas / rang don rnam smin sred spangs pas //
translated: By the ripening of the fruit, he enjoys the wealth of the enjoyment of the fruit of virtue, without attachment.🔽He is established in the verse:

original: dge ba kun tu bsrungs par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba kun tu bsrungs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: “He guards all virtue by abandoning craving for the ripening of his own benefit.”

original: dngos po kun gyis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po kun gyis so //🔽thub pa sangs rgyas ltar gcig tu sems @293a * //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po kun gyis so // thub pa sangs rgyas ltar gcig tu sems @293a * //
translated: By all things means by all the things of giving, etc. and the things of gathering.

original: can la chos kyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: can la chos kyi don byed pa'o //
translated: Like the Sage, the Buddha, he is intent on the benefit of the Dharma for beings.

original: de yang gzhan mang po la phan par mthong ba ni skye dgu rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan mang po la phan par mthong ba ni skye dgu rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And that is seen to benefit many others, as in the verse beginning “For the multitude of beings. . . ”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan nor yang sbyin zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan nor yang sbyin zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: He gives the wealth of the virtues of the six perfections. This is the station of giving.

original: de tshul khrims kyi spyod pa ma nos te yang dag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi spyod pa ma nos te yang dag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with right morality, having taken up the practice of morality.

original: bzod pa brten pa bdag gi sdug bsngal dang log par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa brten pa bdag gi sdug bsngal dang log par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: He is patient, enduring his own suffering and others’ misdeeds.

original: 'gro ba'i don yang spyod ba ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don yang spyod ba ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: And the benefit of beings is the practice of diligence.

original: 'gro la phan sems byams pa la sogs pa dang ldan zhing ma thong na zhi bar snang ba'i gzugs can de bsam gtan la legs par gnas pa'o//
analyzed: 'gro la phan sems byams pa la sogs pa dang ldan zhing ma thong na zhi bar snang ba'i gzugs can de bsam gtan la legs par gnas pa'o//
translated: And the form of the Buddha, which appears to be peaceful to those who are not vessels, is the good abiding in concentration, endowed with love and so on, the intention to benefit beings.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni shes rab kyis te de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni shes rab kyis te de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mdzes pa'o //
translated: The gift of Dharma is through wisdom. Thus he is beautiful with the six perfections.

original: de'i sdug bsngal mi bzod pas de las thar pa'i thabs dris so zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i sdug bsngal mi bzod pas de las thar pa'i thabs dris so zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Since he cannot bear the suffering of beings, he asks about the method of liberating them.

original: bgyi ba nges pa ni nges par bgyi ba'o //
analyzed: bgyi ba nges pa ni nges par bgyi ba'o //
translated: The definite to be done is the definite to be done.

original: sa gzhi thob pa ni thog mar ro //
analyzed: sa gzhi thob pa ni thog mar ro //
translated: The attainment of the ground is the first.

original: yongs su bskyang ba ni de dag gi rgyun no //
analyzed: yongs su bskyang ba ni de dag gi rgyun no //
translated: The protection is the continuity of those.

original: yang na thob pa ni thob pa'i rgyu ste chos so //
analyzed: yang na thob pa ni thob pa'i rgyu ste chos so //
translated: Or, attainment is the cause of attainment, which is the Dharma.

original: bskyangs pa ni de'i 'bras bu bde ba mi nyams par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bskyangs pa ni de'i 'bras bu bde ba mi nyams par bya ba'o //
translated: Protection is the result of that, the non-degeneration of happiness.

original: de dag khyod kyis dus las 'da' mi mdzad //
analyzed: de dag khyod kyis dus las 'da' mi mdzad //
translated: You do not pass beyond the time for those.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dus su chos sgrub cing 'bras bu'i dus na bde ba bskyangs ba la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dus su chos sgrub cing 'bras bu'i dus na bde ba bskyangs ba la'o //
translated: This is the practice of Dharma at the time of the cause and the protection of happiness at the time of the result.

original: sbyin zhes bya ba ni spyir de ltar yin pas char phab pa'i bde ba thob pa'i ched du mchod sbyin gyi chos bsgrub dgos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin zhes bya ba ni spyir de ltar yin pas char phab pa'i bde ba thob pa'i ched du mchod sbyin gyi chos bsgrub dgos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Giving is generally like that. Therefore, for the sake of obtaining the happiness of rainfall, one must practice the Dharma of sacrifice.

original: de sgrub pa la rgyal po mthu dang ldan par ston pa ni 'khor gsum rten la mkhas par gyur pa dang / 'bangs la phan phyir gnam ru bsnams pa de zhes bya ba ste 'khor gsum ni srid dang longs spyod dang chos bsten pa la mkhas shing 'bangs la phan pa'i phyir gnam ru ni gzhu ste /
analyzed: de sgrub pa la rgyal po mthu dang ldan par ston pa ni 'khor gsum rten la mkhas par gyur pa dang / 'bangs la phan phyir gnam ru bsnams pa de zhes bya ba ste 'khor gsum ni srid dang longs spyod dang chos bsten pa la mkhas shing 'bangs la phan pa'i phyir gnam ru ni gzhu ste /
translated: In order to show that the king is powerful in practicing that, it says skilled in the three spheres and he who holds the bow for the benefit of the people. The three spheres are skill in relying on power, wealth, and Dharma, and for the benefit of the people, the bow is the arrow.

original: gzhu bdungs pa ltar bsam pa brtan pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhu bdungs pa ltar bsam pa brtan pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Like drawing a bow, the intention is firm, so it is called that.

original: khyod ni dbang bskur zhes bya ba ni khyod nyid las dge ba'i dri ma med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyod ni dbang bskur zhes bya ba ni khyod nyid las dge ba'i dri ma med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: You are consecrated means although you yourself are virtuous and stainless.

original: spyir bcangs pa dang bcas pa la lha mi mnyes pas char mi 'bebs pa la mnyes par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyir bcangs pa dang bcas pa la lha mi mnyes pas char mi 'bebs pa la mnyes par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In general, when one is contemptuous and arrogant, the gods are displeased and do not send rain.

original: de la brdzun zhes pa'i 'thad pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa'i pha rol su zhig 'thob ces bya ba ste ma byas pa dang phrad par thal ba'i //
analyzed: de la brdzun zhes pa'i 'thad pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa'i pha rol su zhig 'thob ces bya ba ste ma byas pa dang phrad par thal ba'i //
translated: The logical argument for the falsity of that is: “Who would obtain the other-fruit of what was not done?” It follows that one would encounter the result of what one did not do.

original: gal te dud 'gros kyang bde 'gro'i las byas pas zhe na legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te dud 'gros kyang bde 'gro'i las byas pas zhe na legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it is asked, “But animals also do the action of a happy rebirth,”

original: rang gi rigs la gnod pa ni rang gi rigs @293b kyi skye bo nyung ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs la gnod pa ni rang gi rigs @293b kyi skye bo nyung ba'o //
translated: “Harm to one’s own kind” is the decrease of one’s own kind.

original: yul la gnod pa ni yul la gnas pa'i skye bo ri dags la sogs pa dang bcas pa la'o //
analyzed: yul la gnod pa ni yul la gnas pa'i skye bo ri dags la sogs pa dang bcas pa la'o //
