translated: “Harm to the country” is to the people living in the country, together with the deer and so on.

original: mchod sdong lus btags zhes bya ba ni mchod sdong la lus btags pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sdong lus btags zhes bya ba ni mchod sdong la lus btags pa'o //
translated: “The body is tied to the caitya” means that the body is tied to the caitya.

original: grim zhing skam pa zhes bya ba ni nyams grims shing sha skam pa'o //
analyzed: grim zhing skam pa zhes bya ba ni nyams grims shing sha skam pa'o //
translated: “Tight and dry” means that the body is tight and the flesh is dry.

original: 'di ltar ci nas nga'i yul nas ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar ci nas nga'i yul nas ni //
translated: In this way, in my country,

original: g-yen spyod dbul ba nor ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yen spyod dbul ba nor ni med par 'gyur //
translated: the poor will be destitute and have no wealth.

original: zhes tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes tshig sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the text is to be construed.

original: gnam gyi 'jigs pa ni then pa dang char ches pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnam gyi 'jigs pa ni then pa dang char ches pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dangers from the sky are lightning, excessive rain, and so on.

original: rgyal po dge ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas skye bo mang po dge ba la bkod pas mang po'i dge ba'i mthus gnod pa rnams zad par ston pa ni de ltar gnod pa rnams kyi mthus tshegs med par zad par 'gyur zhes tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dge ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas skye bo mang po dge ba la bkod pas mang po'i dge ba'i mthus gnod pa rnams zad par ston pa ni de ltar gnod pa rnams kyi mthus tshegs med par zad par 'gyur zhes tshig sbyar ro //
translated: The king, endowed with virtuous intentions, establishes many beings in virtue. By the power of the virtue of many, the calamities are exhausted. Thus, the text is to be construed: “The calamities are exhausted without difficulty by the power of many.”

original: dus tshigs dus bzhin mthun pa ni dus 'khrul ba med par char gyi dus su char pa 'bab pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus tshigs dus bzhin mthun pa ni dus 'khrul ba med par char gyi dus su char pa 'bab pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The seasons are in harmony, as they were in the beginning. The seasons are not confused. Rain falls in the rainy season, and so on.

original: skye bo phongs pa ni sdug bsngal dang gnod pa ni rab tu zhi bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis sngar gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i don rnams ji ltar mthun mthun du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo phongs pa ni sdug bsngal dang gnod pa ni rab tu zhi bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis sngar gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i don rnams ji ltar mthun mthun du bsdus pa'o //
translated: The distress of beings and the harm are completely pacified. Thus, the text is to be construed. The meaning of the previous verse is summarized according to the appropriate order.

original: gong nas gong du spyod pa ni thog mar 'tshe ba bzlog pa dang bar du dge ba la bkod pa dang tha mar zhing khyad par du gyur pa la mchod sbyin rgya chen po byas te de dag gi dge ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por gyur
analyzed: gong nas gong du spyod pa ni thog mar 'tshe ba bzlog pa dang bar du dge ba la bkod pa dang tha mar zhing khyad par du gyur pa la mchod sbyin rgya chen po byas te de dag gi dge ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por gyur
translated: The virtue that comes from those is small, middling, and great.

original: pas mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i dgos pa rtag tu gzigs pas na zhes smos so //
analyzed: pas mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma'i dgos pa rtag tu gzigs pas na zhes smos so //
translated: The one who always sees the purpose of the highest, middling, and lowest is mentioned.

original: krishn 'dzin ma gsol zhes bya ba ni zla ba dkar ba bzhin du ri dags dkar po bzhin du mi dge ba med pa'o //
analyzed: krishn 'dzin ma gsol zhes bya ba ni zla ba dkar ba bzhin du ri dags dkar po bzhin du mi dge ba med pa'o //
translated: The one who is not like a white deer, like the white moon, is without nonvirtue.

original: dbang bskur ldan pas rang bzhin mdzes pa'i spyod pa yod ma zhum zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gzhan gyis dbang bskur zhing 'bangs rnams kyis rgyal por bskos pas rgyal po'i gzi brjid che bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ldan pas rang bzhin mdzes pa'i spyod pa yod ma zhum zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gzhan gyis dbang bskur zhing 'bangs rnams kyis rgyal por bskos pas rgyal po'i gzi brjid che bar ston pa'o //
translated: The one who has the conduct of natural beauty endowed with consecration, who is not depressed, is the one who is consecrated by other kings and appointed king by his subjects.

original: dbu mdzes dkyil mo ba ni dbu mdzes pas mtho ba'o //
analyzed: dbu mdzes dkyil mo ba ni dbu mdzes pas mtho ba'o //
translated: The one with a beautiful head, with a beautiful middle, is the one with a beautiful head, with a high middle.

original: de ltar tshig rkang bzhis ni /
analyzed: de ltar tshig rkang bzhis ni /
translated: Thus, with four lines,

original: nyes pas mgos pa dang // gzi brjid dang ldan pa dang / sku lus mdzes pa dang / gtong ba'i grags pa dang ldan pa bzhi rim pa bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: nyes pas mgos pa dang // gzi brjid dang ldan pa dang / sku lus mdzes pa dang / gtong ba'i grags pa dang ldan pa bzhi rim pa bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The four are taught in order: being bowed to by the wicked, being endowed with splendor, having a beautiful body, and being endowed with the fame of generosity.🔽The supreme gift is the gift of the Dharma, because it is the cause of the highest human ends.

original: mchog sbyin gzhan gsod cing 'bras bu dman pa ngan 'gro la sogs pa 'byung bas /🔽'bras bu bzang po 'byung ba sus shes pa mchod sbyin lags kyi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mchog sbyin gzhan gsod cing 'bras bu dman pa ngan 'gro la sogs pa 'byung bas / 'bras bu bzang po 'byung ba sus shes pa mchod sbyin lags kyi zhes pa'o //
translated: The gift of fearlessness is the gift of protection from the fear of lions, tigers, and so on, or the gift of protection from the fear of kings, robbers, and so on.🔽The gift of love is the gift of one's wife and so on.🔽The gift of the Dharma is the gift of the scriptures and the explanation of their meaning.

original: sbyin pa @294a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa @294a * //
translated: The gift of generosity is the gift of material things.

original: rang gi don du gtong ba tsam yang nor yod pa dang gtong ba'i skye bo la yod kyis gzhan la med la /
analyzed: rang gi don du gtong ba tsam yang nor yod pa dang gtong ba'i skye bo la yod kyis gzhan la med la /
translated: The gift of generosity is the mere giving for one's own sake, which is found among those who have wealth and are generous, but not among others.

original: rang gi don du tshul khrims bsrung ba yang 'jig rten bde ba la phyogs te pha rol la gnod pa spong la mtho res 'dod la chags shing mtho ris 'dod pa dang ldan pa ste gzhan la med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don du tshul khrims bsrung ba yang 'jig rten bde ba la phyogs te pha rol la gnod pa spong la mtho res 'dod la chags shing mtho ris 'dod pa dang ldan pa ste gzhan la med pa'o //
translated: The gift of morality is the protection of morality for one's own sake, which is found among those who are attached to worldly happiness and avoid harming others, but not among others.

original: sems can thams cad kyi ched du de gnyis bsgrub pa ni skye bo dam pa 'ga' zhig las gzhan la med par ston pa ni gzhan don bsgrub phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ched du de gnyis bsgrub pa ni skye bo dam pa 'ga' zhig las gzhan la med par ston pa ni gzhan don bsgrub phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of those two for the sake of all sentient beings is shown to be absent in anyone but a few holy beings.🔽🔽For the sake of accomplishing the aims of others, etc.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug bsdu ba'i tshul gyis gdams pa ni don lnga'i sgo nas te go sla'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug bsdu ba'i tshul gyis gdams pa ni don lnga'i sgo nas te go sla'o //
translated: The statement that the accomplishment of those two for the sake of all sentient beings is not found in anyone else except for a few holy beings is the instruction by way of the fifth point, the manner of conclusion, which is easy to understand.

original: mchod sbyin gyi rabs te bcu pa'o /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi rabs te bcu pa'o /
translated: The lineage of sacrifice is the tenth.

original: // / lha dbang dpal ni spyir lha'i lus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / lha dbang dpal ni spyir lha'i lus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The glory of the lord of gods is in general the perfection of the body of a god.

original: de la rten bcas pas zhes bya ba ni brgya byin de la rten bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten bcas pas zhes bya ba ni brgya byin de la rten bcas pa'o //
translated: The statement, “having taken him as a support” means having taken that Śakra as a support.

original: gang phyir lha ma yin rnams tsham tshom med par ni /
analyzed: gang phyir lha ma yin rnams tsham tshom med par ni /
translated: Because the demigods, without hesitation,

original: phyogs kyi glang chen mche bas lto ba zed 'ong ba //
analyzed: phyogs kyi glang chen mche bas lto ba zed 'ong ba //
translated: come with the tusks of the elephants of the directions opened wide.

original: zhes bya ba la rgyu mtshan gang gi phyir lha ma yin rnams tsham tshom med par lha rnams la 'thab tu 'ong pa ni lha rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa mi bzod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rgyu mtshan gang gi phyir lha ma yin rnams tsham tshom med par lha rnams la 'thab tu 'ong pa ni lha rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa mi bzod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: For what reason do the demigods fearlessly come to fight with the gods? It is because they cannot bear the gods' excellence.

original: phyogs kyi glang chen ni lha rnams kyi dpung gi glang po che rab brtan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi glang chen ni lha rnams kyi dpung gi glang po che rab brtan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elephants of the directions are the gods' war elephants such as firm and so on.

original: de rnams kyi mche ba dang ldan pa'i dbung gi gnod pa lha ma yin rnams kyis lto ba zed cing sron pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mche ba dang ldan pa'i dbung gi gnod pa lha ma yin rnams kyis lto ba zed cing sron pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The demigods open their bellies and bear the harm of the tusks of those elephants.

original: lha'i phun sum tshogs pa nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: lha'i phun sum tshogs pa nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The excellence of the gods is shown:

original: skal ba che bas bde ba thob pa'i dpal de ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skal ba che bas bde ba thob pa'i dpal de ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The glory of obtaining happiness through great fortune

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba du ma bsags pas legs par 'thob pa'i lus dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba du ma bsags pas legs par 'thob pa'i lus dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: is the excellence of body and resources well obtained through accumulating many roots of virtue.

original: de'i snying dregs pa'i dri ma can du byed pa ni lha ma yin gyi snying dregs pa ni de la phrag dog gi dri mar byas shing lhag par 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i snying dregs pa'i dri ma can du byed pa ni lha ma yin gyi snying dregs pa ni de la phrag dog gi dri mar byas shing lhag par 'khrug pa'o //
translated: The heart of the asura is made to be stained by pride, since the pride of the asura is a stain of jealousy and is especially agitated.

original: chos kyi bdag nyid yin zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag nyid yin zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'o //
translated: The one who is of the nature of Dharma is the king.

original: rgyal po de la lha ma yin nang rtsod pa de rol pa ni bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po de la lha ma yin nang rtsod pa de rol pa ni bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The asura who is in conflict with that king is the one who is well situated.

original: de'i gegs su gyur par mthong ba dang yid byung ba ni skyo ba'o //🔽'gro ba lha dang de'i phyogs su gtogs pa lha ma yin gyi gnod pas 'jigs par mthong nas gzhi brjid can gyi byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i stobs kyi tshul bzhin @294b te legs par bzlog par rigs pas na lha'i dbang po'i snying ni dmag drangs kyi phyogs
analyzed: de'i gegs su gyur par mthong ba dang yid byung ba ni skyo ba'o // 'gro ba lha dang de'i phyogs su gtogs pa lha ma yin gyi gnod pas 'jigs par mthong nas gzhi brjid can gyi byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i stobs kyi tshul bzhin @294b te legs par bzlog par rigs pas na lha'i dbang po'i snying ni dmag drangs kyi phyogs
translated: Seeing that as an obstacle, he is disgusted, which is the weariness.🔽Seeing that the world, the gods and those belonging to their faction, are in danger from the harm of the asura, it is proper that the bodhisattva, who is the one with the power of compassion, should properly ward them off with the method of his great power.

original: la g-yel bar gyur te de bzlog dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la g-yel bar gyur te de bzlog dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the heart of the lord of the gods, who is the one who leads the army, is distracted from the side of the asura and needs to be turned back.

original: shing rta dam pa'i steng du 'dug nas zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: shing rta dam pa'i steng du 'dug nas zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Having mounted the excellent chariot, one should apply.

original: rgya mtsho'i 'gram ni rol mtsho'i 'gram mo //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i 'gram ni rol mtsho'i 'gram mo //
translated: The ocean shore is the shore of the pleasure ocean.

original: lha rnams dga' ba'i 'khor gyi nang du song zhes bya ba ni 'khor rnams grong khyer lta na sdug gi nang du song ba'o //
analyzed: lha rnams dga' ba'i 'khor gyi nang du song zhes bya ba ni 'khor rnams grong khyer lta na sdug gi nang du song ba'o //
translated: Having gone into the midst of the assembly of the gods who are delighted means that the assembly has gone into the midst of the city of Sudarśana.

original: de nyid zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i rgyur bdag nyid kyi srog lam chags pa'i spyod pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste des tsho 'di la phan pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i rgyur bdag nyid kyi srog lam chags pa'i spyod pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste des tsho 'di la phan pa thob pa'o //
translated: That itself is the cause of compassion means that very conduct of giving away one’s own life is the cause of compassion. By that, one obtains benefit in this life.

original: de bas gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni lung las so //
analyzed: de bas gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni lung las so //
translated: Therefore, it is said means in the scriptures.

original: rgya mtsho dus bzhin zhes bya ba rgya mtsho'i rlabs zhag bdun gyi dus las mi yol ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dus bzhin zhes bya ba rgya mtsho'i rlabs zhag bdun gyi dus las mi yol ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Like the ocean in time means like the waves of the ocean, which do not go beyond the time of seven days.

original: brgya byin gyi rabs te bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi rabs te bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter on Śakra.

original: // / thos pa ldob pa ni myur du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: // / thos pa ldob pa ni myur du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Swift retention is quickly grasping what is heard.

original: 'dzin gsal ni gsal bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin gsal ni gsal bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Clear retention is clearly grasping it.

original: de dag gis ni shes rab myur ba dang gsal bar 'jug pas dbang po rno bar bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni shes rab myur ba dang gsal bar 'jug pas dbang po rno bar bstan to //
translated: By these, it is shown that one has sharp faculties due to engaging in swift and clear wisdom.

original: rang gi rigs bzang por grags pa dang bla ma la gus shing dbang po dul ba dang lang tsho dang ldan yang rgyags pa spangs pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs bzang por grags pa dang bla ma la gus shing dbang po dul ba dang lang tsho dang ldan yang rgyags pa spangs pas zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peaceful because, although one is well known for one's good family, one is devoted to the guru and one's faculties are subdued, and although one is in one's prime, one has abandoned pride.

original: chos bzang ba ni dkar po'i chos la legs par gnas pa ste tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'o //
analyzed: chos bzang ba ni dkar po'i chos la legs par gnas pa ste tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'o //
translated: It is good in terms of Dharma because one is well established in the bright dharmas, that is, one has taken up morality.

original: ji ltar sngags kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i mthus sbrul gdug pa'am 'byung po la sogs pa la dbang byed pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar sngags kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i mthus sbrul gdug pa'am 'byung po la sogs pa la dbang byed pa ltar /
translated: Just as one has power over a poisonous snake or a spirit, etc. through the power of a special mantra,

original: gnyen po stobs che bas rang gi sems la dbang byed pa ni yon tan dbang du byed pa'i sngags de rdzas dang 'dra ba'i byams pa la sogs pa goms pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po stobs che bas rang gi sems la dbang byed pa ni yon tan dbang du byed pa'i sngags de rdzas dang 'dra ba'i byams pa la sogs pa goms pa'o //
translated: one has power over one's own mind through the power of the antidotes, and this is the mantra that controls the good qualities. It is the cultivation of love, etc. which is like a substance.

original: de rtag tu ma nyams zhe sdang mthu dang ldan pas zhe sdang 'khrug pa'i rgyu gnod pa byung yang de la rang gi sems dbang du byed cing khong khro ba'i dbang du mi 'gyur na tha mal ba'i sems nyon mongs pa'i rkyen shas chen po med na lta
analyzed: de rtag tu ma nyams zhe sdang mthu dang ldan pas zhe sdang 'khrug pa'i rgyu gnod pa byung yang de la rang gi sems dbang du byed cing khong khro ba'i dbang du mi 'gyur na tha mal ba'i sems nyon mongs pa'i rkyen shas chen po med na lta
translated: Since he is always free of that, and since he is powerful in his freedom from hatred, he is not affected by anger even when he is harmed, the cause of the disturbance of hatred.

original: ci smos te shin tu rang gi sems la dbang yod pa'o //
analyzed: ci smos te shin tu rang gi sems la dbang yod pa'o //
translated: He is in control of his own mind, and so he is not affected by anger.

original: dbul ba 'bras bu re ba med //
analyzed: dbul ba 'bras bu re ba med //
translated: He has no hope for the fruits of poverty.

original: ces bya ba ni tshe 'di la yang zong gis bsgrubs pa'i nor gyi 'bras bu'am zhing la sogs pas bsgrubs pa'i 'bru'i khyad par la re ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni tshe 'di la yang zong gis bsgrubs pa'i nor gyi 'bras bu'am zhing la sogs pas bsgrubs pa'i 'bru'i khyad par la re ba med pa'o //
translated: He has no hope for the fruits of wealth, which are acquired through commerce, or for the fruits of grains, which are acquired through farming.

original: bdag gis mi la'ang smrar med pa ni bdag dbul bas gzhan gyi re ltos kyi sar ma gyur pas zhum par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis mi la'ang smrar med pa ni bdag dbul bas gzhan gyi re ltos kyi sar ma gyur pas zhum par gnas pa'o //
translated: He is not a source of hope for others, because he is poor.

original: dga' ston chen na'ang dga' mi @295a * //🔽myong ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ston chen na'ang dga' mi @295a * //🔽myong ba ni /
translated: He does not rejoice in great festivities.

original: dbul bas bdag la dga' ston byar med pa dang / ka zhan gyis kyang mi ster ba dang / byin yang bdag la kha len med pas zhum zhum por 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: dbul bas bdag la dga' ston byar med pa dang / ka zhan gyis kyang mi ster ba dang / byin yang bdag la kha len med pas zhum zhum por 'dug pa'o //
translated: One is dispirited because of poverty, thinking I have no means of celebrating a festival, or because of weakness, thinking I am not given to others, or because of being given to others, thinking I am not my own master.🔽One is dispirited because of being praised for giving, thinking I am not praised for not giving, or because of being praised for not giving, thinking I am not praised for giving, or because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither.🔽One is dispirited because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither, or because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for both.

original: sbyin pa'i gtam yang zhen pa ni bdag nyid sbyin pa byar med bar bsngags pa brjod kyang kha gsag lta bur mngon pa'o //🔽de rnams kyis sma bab pa lta bu yin la yo byang chung du 'tsho ba yang sdug bsngal dang bcas pas nyon mongs ngal ba'i gzhi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gtam yang zhen pa ni bdag nyid sbyin pa byar med bar bsngags pa brjod kyang kha gsag lta bur mngon pa'o // de rnams kyis sma bab pa lta bu yin la yo byang chung du 'tsho ba yang sdug bsngal dang bcas pas nyon mongs ngal ba'i gzhi zhes pa'o //
translated: One is dispirited because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for both, or because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither.🔽 One is dispirited because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither, or because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for both.🔽 One is dispirited because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for both, or because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither.🔽 One is dispirited because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither, or because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for both.🔽 One is dispirited because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for both, or because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither.

original: ngo tsha shes pa'i bsngags pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sbyar bar bya ba ni mdo sde'i don yang 'dis gsal bar bsgrub ba'am 'di yang mdo sde dang mthun pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa'i bsngags pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sbyar bar bya ba ni mdo sde'i don yang 'dis gsal bar bsgrub ba'am 'di yang mdo sde dang mthun pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: One is dispirited because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither, or because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for both.🔽 One is dispirited because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for both, or because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither.🔽 One is dispirited because of being praised for both, thinking I am not praised for neither, or because of being praised for neither, thinking I am not praised for

original: 'jig rten lha dbang byed pa ni gzhan gyi dpyas pas 'jigs nas sdig pa la 'dzem pa ste khrel yod pa yin la de'i dbang du byas pa'i mdo sde yang de dang mthun no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten lha dbang byed pa ni gzhan gyi dpyas pas 'jigs nas sdig pa la 'dzem pa ste khrel yod pa yin la de'i dbang du byas pa'i mdo sde yang de dang mthun no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The world is ruled by the gods, and so, fearing the reproach of others, one should avoid sin. The sutra is in agreement with this.

original: bram ze'i rabs te bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: bram ze'i rabs te bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: The Brahmana's Lineage is the twelfth chapter.

original: // / khyim na gnyi gas yang zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i khyim dang khyim thab kyi khyim mo //
analyzed: // / khyim na gnyi gas yang zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i khyim dang khyim thab kyi khyim mo //
translated: Both in the house of the parents and in the house of the husband.

original: 'di ci ku mu ta yin nam zhes bya ba ni lha mo'i khyad par zhig go //
analyzed: 'di ci ku mu ta yin nam zhes bya ba ni lha mo'i khyad par zhig go //
translated: Is this a kumuda? is a particular goddess.

original: khyim 'di lha yin zhes bya ba ni khyim 'di lha mo'i yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim 'di lha yin zhes bya ba ni khyim 'di lha mo'i yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This house is divine means Is this house of the goddess?

original: de yi lus bzangs bcas shing 'greng dang lta ba la /
analyzed: de yi lus bzangs bcas shing 'greng dang lta ba la /
translated: When she stands with her excellent body, and when she looks,

original: chags pas cha cig yid du gyur cig 'dug pa'i tshe //
analyzed: chags pas cha cig yid du gyur cig 'dug pa'i tshe //
translated: with passion, at one part of her body, at that time,

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar lam du myos byed ma dang phrad pa'i ste'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar lam du myos byed ma dang phrad pa'i ste'o //
translated: it is said that she is like the one met on the road by Madhu.

original: don sgrub go rims sbyin pa'i chab tshod sgra grags pa'i //
analyzed: don sgrub go rims sbyin pa'i chab tshod sgra grags pa'i //
translated: The sound of the bell of the gift of the sequence of the accomplishment of the goal,

original: chab tshod zhes bya ba ni bgrod pa'i gnas su 'gro bar don sgrub cing rim gyis 'gro bar spron pa'i chu tshod kyi tshad 'dzin pa'i rnga rdung ba'i sgra grag pa dang dung 'bud pa'i sgra grag pas 'gro dgos shing rta khrid pa de'i cho /
analyzed: chab tshod zhes bya ba ni bgrod pa'i gnas su 'gro bar don sgrub cing rim gyis 'gro bar spron pa'i chu tshod kyi tshad 'dzin pa'i rnga rdung ba'i sgra grag pa dang dung 'bud pa'i sgra grag pas 'gro dgos shing rta khrid pa de'i cho /
translated: The “time of departure” is the time when the sound of the drum is heard to announce the time for the daily work, and the sound of the conch is heard to announce the time for the gradual departure to the place of work.

original: nga'i sems la zhes sdang ldang ste /
analyzed: nga'i sems la zhes sdang ldang ste /
translated: “My mind” is the mind of anger.

original: ma rangs par gyur te /
analyzed: ma rangs par gyur te /
translated: “Displeased” is the state of not being satisfied.

original: yul 'das kyang myos byed pa la ltar yod na dga'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul 'das kyang myos byed pa la ltar yod na dga'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “I would be happy if the intoxicating liquor were present” means that even though the country is passed, one is happy if the intoxicating liquor is present.

original: chos spyad pa las bya ba ni sngon dge ba byas pa las so //
analyzed: chos spyad pa las bya ba ni sngon dge ba byas pa las so //
translated: “From the practice of Dharma” means from the practice of virtue in the past.

original: dpal thob pa ni lus dang longs spyod kyi 'byor pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: dpal thob pa ni lus dang longs spyod kyi 'byor pa thob pa'o //
translated: “Obtaining glory” means obtaining the wealth of body and possessions.

original: de nyid la yang gnod pa byed pa ni tshe gzhan du de nyams pa'i rgyu sdig ba brten pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la yang gnod pa byed pa ni tshe gzhan du de nyams pa'i rgyu sdig ba brten pa'o //
translated: “Causing harm to that very thing” means relying on the cause of the destruction of that very thing in another life, which is non-virtue.

original: des na gzhan du yang //
analyzed: des na gzhan du yang //
translated: Therefore, in another life as well,

original: ji ltar khyod la rtag tu sku 'phongs pa bzhin du chos 'phongs par mdzod @295b ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod la rtag tu sku 'phongs pa bzhin du chos 'phongs par mdzod @295b ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: just as you are always deprived of the body, so be deprived of the Dharma.

original: 'di dang pha rol sreg par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di dang pha rol sreg par 'gyur //
translated: He will be burned in this life and the next.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir ni rgyal po'i chad pas yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir ni rgyal po'i chad pas yin no //
translated: Here, he is burned by the king’s punishment.

original: pha rol tu ni nyes pa med pa'i bud med bor zhing smad pa'i las la sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu ni nyes pa med pa'i bud med bor zhing smad pa'i las la sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the next life, he is burned by the sin of abandoning a blameless woman and engaging in the action of defiling her.

original: dus tshigs mchod pa'i yon tan ni shing gi 'bras bu smin pa'i dus su 'bras bu de 'bul ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus tshigs mchod pa'i yon tan ni shing gi 'bras bu smin pa'i dus su 'bras bu de 'bul ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The quality of worship at the right time is the offering of fruit when the fruit of the tree ripens, and so on.

original: lha dang dpal gyis rab tu spangs par 'gyur //
analyzed: lha dang dpal gyis rab tu spangs par 'gyur //
translated: He will be abandoned by the gods and by glory.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhas kyang mi srung la dge ba'i 'bras bu yang thag ring ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhas kyang mi srung la dge ba'i 'bras bu yang thag ring ba'o //
translated: The gods will not protect him, and the fruits of virtue will be far away.

original: khyod ni de ltar zhi gyur pa //
analyzed: khyod ni de ltar zhi gyur pa //
translated: You have become like that, tranquil,

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'o //
translated: means that he has restrained the doors of his senses.

original: de la ngo mtshar che mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de la ngo mtshar che mi 'gyur //
translated: There is nothing amazing about that.

original: zhes bya ba mkhas pa'i skye bos brtags na de la ngo mtshar med de yon tan la goms pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mkhas pa'i skye bos brtags na de la ngo mtshar med de yon tan la goms pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When examined by the wise, there is nothing amazing about that, because he is accustomed to virtue.

original: myos byed ma'i rabs te bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: myos byed ma'i rabs te bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the thirteenth chapter, called “On Intoxication.”

original: // / bdag cag yul ni gnyi ga las //
analyzed: // / bdag cag yul ni gnyi ga las //
translated: Both of us, he said, are from the same country.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul dang rin po che blang ba'i gnas las so //🔽aan da rnyil gyi mdog ni mthil ka'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul dang rin po che blang ba'i gnas las so // aan da rnyil gyi mdog ni mthil ka'o //
translated: He meant that they were from the same country and from the same place where jewels were obtained.🔽 The soles of her feet were the color of sapphires.

original: margad ni ljang gu'o //
analyzed: margad ni ljang gu'o //
translated: Her ankles were the color of emeralds.

original: lha mo nyid la zhes bya ba ni tsan dhi ste dbu au ma la'o //
analyzed: lha mo nyid la zhes bya ba ni tsan dhi ste dbu au ma la'o //
translated: The goddess herself, he said, is Canda, the head of Uma.

original: legs par pha rol tu phyin pa'i rabs te bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: legs par pha rol tu phyin pa'i rabs te bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourteenth chapter.

original: // / dge dang mi dge las rnams goms byas nas //
analyzed: // / dge dang mi dge las rnams goms byas nas //
translated: When people have cultivated good and bad actions,

original: mi rnams la ni 'dris pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rnams la ni 'dris pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: they become familiar with them.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi rnams la tshe de la goms na tshe de la spyod pa tsam mthong la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi rnams la tshe de la goms na tshe de la spyod pa tsam mthong la /
translated: When people cultivate them in this life, they merely see them practiced in this life.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyar gyur pas tshe de lam bsgoms kyang tshe rabs gzhan la goms pas tshe 'di la rmi lam bzhin du sngon gyi stobs kyis spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyar gyur pas tshe de lam bsgoms kyang tshe rabs gzhan la goms pas tshe 'di la rmi lam bzhin du sngon gyi stobs kyis spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But when a bodhisattva cultivates them in this life, he practices them in other lives as well, like a dream, by the power of his former cultivation.

original: nya'i rabs te bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: nya'i rabs te bco lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifteenth chapter, the Chapter on the Fish.

original: // / cho ga'i zas za zhes bya ba ni dka' thub byed pa'i mi dag 'bras kyi gzegs mas 'tsho bar byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / cho ga'i zas za zhes bya ba ni dka' thub byed pa'i mi dag 'bras kyi gzegs mas 'tsho bar byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The food of rites is the food of those who practice austerities, such as living on grain dust.

original: ngo tsha med par legs par 'tsho ba ni 'phral nyon mi mongs par skyid pa'o //🔽'tsho ba shin tu nyon mongs ldan //
analyzed: ngo tsha med par legs par 'tsho ba ni 'phral nyon mi mongs par skyid pa'o // 'tsho ba shin tu nyon mongs ldan //
translated: Living without shame is living happily without being troubled by the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ni nyon mongs pas gos shing sdig pa dang 'brel pa'o //🔽bdag gi rkang pa ming don med cing 'dab ma med //
analyzed: zhes bya ni nyon mongs pas gos shing sdig pa dang 'brel pa'o // bdag gi rkang pa ming don med cing 'dab ma med //
translated: The line and is full of the afflictions of livelihood means that one is covered by the afflictions and is connected with sin.

original: zhes bya ba ni rkang pa yongs sum rdzogs shing 'dab ma yongs su ma rdzogs pas ming gi don legs par mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rkang pa yongs sum rdzogs shing 'dab ma yongs su ma rdzogs pas ming gi don legs par mi gnas pa'o //
translated: The line my feet are without name and without leaves means that because the feet are incomplete and the leaves are incomplete, the meaning of the name is not well established.

original: 'gro na byar rung ba ni sbyin sreg gi rdzas te 'bras chan dang zho @296a * //🔽la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro na byar rung ba ni sbyin sreg gi rdzas te 'bras chan dang zho @296a * //🔽la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fit for going is the material for the fire offering, such as rice and curd.

original: rgya mtsho'i rlabs dus las mi yol zhing skye bo brten pa yang bslab pa legs par mi 'da' ba bzhin bden pa goms pa'i ngag las ni me yang mi 'da' bas bden pa la goms par bya'o zhes ston pa ni de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pas ston to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i rlabs dus las mi yol zhing skye bo brten pa yang bslab pa legs par mi 'da' ba bzhin bden pa goms pa'i ngag las ni me yang mi 'da' bas bden pa la goms par bya'o zhes ston pa ni de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is taught by Why is that? and so forth.

original: sreg pa'i rabs te bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: sreg pa'i rabs te bcu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixteenth chapter on the lineage of burning.

original: // /'jig rten yongs kyis phal cher dpal ldan na //
analyzed: // /'jig rten yongs kyis phal cher dpal ldan na //
translated: In the world, most people are like the glorious sun.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: dpal gyi rang bzhin shes pa ni 'byor pa la bag yod par bya ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: dpal gyi rang bzhin shes pa ni 'byor pa la bag yod par bya ba shes pa'o //
translated: Knowing the nature of glory is knowing how to be careful with wealth.

original: gzi brjid kyis gzhan zil gyis gnon pas gzi chen nyi ma 'char 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid kyis gzhan zil gyis gnon pas gzi chen nyi ma 'char 'dra'o //
translated: With great splendor, outshining others, like the rising sun.

original: ston gyi zla ba nya ba gang ba mdzes pa ltar lta na sdug pa mdzes pas zla ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ston gyi zla ba nya ba gang ba mdzes pa ltar lta na sdug pa mdzes pas zla ba bzhin no //
translated: Beautiful to behold, like the full autumn moon, beautiful with splendor, like the moon.

original: de ltar khyod kyi sku mdzes thub pa 'ga' zhig lags par gda' ste 'dod chags dang bral ba'am thar pa thob pa'i skye bo zhig yin nam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyod kyi sku mdzes thub pa 'ga' zhig lags par gda' ste 'dod chags dang bral ba'am thar pa thob pa'i skye bo zhig yin nam zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, Your body is beautiful, but are you a sage, or are you one who is free from passion, or one who has attained liberation?

original: chang gi nyes pa bsdus pa ni khyed cag 'jig rten gzhan la mi 'jigs shing //
analyzed: chang gi nyes pa bsdus pa ni khyed cag 'jig rten gzhan la mi 'jigs shing //
translated: The summary of the faults of alcohol is: You are not afraid of another world,

original: tshe 'di la yang brlag pas mi 'jigs na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la yang brlag pas mi 'jigs na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and you are not afraid of being ruined in this life.

original: 'bri sna aan dha dag kyang mi byung nas //
analyzed: 'bri sna aan dha dag kyang mi byung nas //
translated: The story of the Brāhmaṇas and the Andhakas is: Even the Brāhmaṇas and the Andhakas did not appear,

original: dbyig chen thogs te phan tshun thal bar byung //
analyzed: dbyig chen thogs te phan tshun thal bar byung //
translated: but with great clubs in hand, they came forth to kill each other.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'bri sna dang aan dha ni mi'i rigs kyi khyad par te de dag chang gis myos pas dbyig pa chen po thogs te phan tshun bsad cing rang gi nye 'brel mang du bsad pa ste sngon gyi lo rgyus las shes par bya ste bdag
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bri sna dang aan dha ni mi'i rigs kyi khyad par te de dag chang gis myos pas dbyig pa chen po thogs te phan tshun bsad cing rang gi nye 'brel mang du bsad pa ste sngon gyi lo rgyus las shes par bya ste bdag
translated: The Brāhmaṇas and the Andhakas are specific types of people. Intoxicated by alcohol, they took up great clubs and killed each other, killing many of their own relatives. This can be known from the ancient stories.

original: gis legs par thos pa med do //
analyzed: gis legs par thos pa med do //
translated: I have not heard it well.

original: gang gi nyes pas sngon gyi lha rnams myos //
analyzed: gang gi nyes pas sngon gyi lha rnams myos //
translated: By whose faults did the gods of old become intoxicated?

original: lha yi rgyal po'i dpal ni nyams gyur nas //
analyzed: lha yi rgyal po'i dpal ni nyams gyur nas //
translated: The glory of the king of gods has declined.

original: skyabs 'dod phyir ni rgya mtsho'i nang du gab ;
analyzed: skyabs 'dod phyir ni rgya mtsho'i nang du gab ;
translated: Desiring protection, he has hidden in the ocean.

original: / ces pa las sngon gyi gtam rgyud las shes par bya ste bdag gis legs par thos pa med do //
analyzed: / ces pa las sngon gyi gtam rgyud las shes par bya ste bdag gis legs par thos pa med do //
translated: This is known from the ancient stories. I have not heard it well.

original: phan par smra la mchod par bya ba ni //
analyzed: phan par smra la mchod par bya ba ni //
translated: One should worship one who speaks for one's benefit.

original: bsgo ba'i tshig bzhin nyams su len pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgo ba'i tshig bzhin nyams su len pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is to practice according to his instructions.

original: gzhan las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsgrub pa'i mtshod pas mnyes pa yin gyi zang zing gi mchod pas ni mnyes pa ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsgrub pa'i mtshod pas mnyes pa yin gyi zang zing gi mchod pas ni mnyes pa ma yin no zhes so //
translated: It is said that the Tathagata is pleased by the worship of accomplishment, not by the worship of material things.

original: grags dang dpal gyi lam ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: grags dang dpal gyi lam ni 'di yin te //
translated: This is the path of fame and glory.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di'i yon tan te dpal ni 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa mi nyams shing 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di'i yon tan te dpal ni 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa mi nyams shing 'phel ba'o //
translated: This is the virtue of this life. Glory is the non-decline and increase of perfect wealth.

original: nga'i yul la brten ces bya ba ni bdag gang la spyod pa de nyid la @296b spyod cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nga'i yul la brten ces bya ba ni bdag gang la spyod pa de nyid la @296b spyod cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Rely on my country means Practice only what I practice.

original: bum pa'i rabs te bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: bum pa'i rabs te bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the seventeenth chapter, on the vase.

original: // / yon tan la brtags na phyi ma'i bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin la //
analyzed: // / yon tan la brtags na phyi ma'i bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin la //
translated: If one examines his virtues, he is a fit object for the homage of the future.🔽If one examines his faults, he is a fit object for the contempt of his own people.

original: skyon la brtags na nang mi yang smad par bya ba'i gnas su 'gyur bas yon tan skyon las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽snga nas yod pa'i rigs dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan la tshul khrims dang shes pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas /
analyzed: skyon la brtags na nang mi yang smad par bya ba'i gnas su 'gyur bas yon tan skyon las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // snga nas yod pa'i rigs dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan la tshul khrims dang shes pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If one examines his virtues and faults, etc.”

original: lhag par brjod cing mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par brjod cing mdzes pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the virtues of morality and knowledge, he is more highly spoken of and more beautiful than the virtues of his family, form, etc., which existed from the beginning.

original: sa gzhi rab tu bzang po rdo thal gyis byugs pa'i khang bzangs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi rab tu bzang po rdo thal gyis byugs pa'i khang bzangs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ground is very good, the palace, etc., is plastered with lime.

original: thos pa'i don ni khyod kyis yod par byos //
analyzed: thos pa'i don ni khyod kyis yod par byos //
translated: Make the meaning of your learning exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma don med par mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma don med par mi bya ste /
translated: Do not make the day meaningless.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa spyad zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i las kyis khyim du don yod par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa spyad zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i las kyis khyim du don yod par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: Practice generosity, etc. Make the meaning of your home exist through the rites of burnt offerings, etc.🔽That is explained:

original: de nyid bshad pa ni bu mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni bu mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The best son, etc.

original: nan tur drag shul gyi las //
analyzed: nan tur drag shul gyi las //
translated: The activity of harsh punishment

original: sbyugs pa dang gsad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyugs pa dang gsad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: is the killing, etc. of the wicked.

original: bde ba la chags pa spong ba rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: bde ba la chags pa spong ba rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: By what cause is the attachment to pleasure abandoned?

original: bde ba 'grub pa'i nges pa yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba de ji skad du //
analyzed: bde ba 'grub pa'i nges pa yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba de ji skad du //
translated: The statement, There is no certainty of achieving pleasure, is explained in the following:

original: bde ba'i don du las byas kyang //
analyzed: bde ba'i don du las byas kyang //
translated: Even if one does an action for the sake of pleasure,

original: bde 'gyur mi 'gyur gtol med kyis //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: bde 'gyur mi 'gyur gtol med kyis // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o ;
translated: there is no certainty that pleasure will result.

original: / gzhan yang bde ba 'grub kyang gdon mi za bar grags pa med par 'gyur te bde ba la brkam pas sdig pa byas pas mi snyan pa 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gzhan yang bde ba 'grub kyang gdon mi za bar grags pa med par 'gyur te bde ba la brkam pas sdig pa byas pas mi snyan pa 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, even if one does achieve pleasure, it will certainly be without fame, because one will be reviled for having committed evil in the greed for pleasure.

original: gzhan yang bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i yul ma 'thob pa'am thob pa las nyams pa las yid gdung ba skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i yul ma 'thob pa'am thob pa las nyams pa las yid gdung ba skye'o //
translated: Moreover, mental anguish arises from not obtaining an object that is the cause of pleasure, or from losing what one has obtained.

original: de dag ni tshe 'di'i nyes pa yin la tshe gzhan du ngan 'gror ltung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni tshe 'di'i nyes pa yin la tshe gzhan du ngan 'gror ltung ba'o //
translated: These are the faults in this life; in other lives, one falls into miserable realms.

original: yongs su rtogs pa'i don du ma gyur na zhes bya ba bsam pa'i don ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa'i don du ma gyur na zhes bya ba bsam pa'i don ma grub pa'o //
translated: If it does not serve the purpose of thorough understanding, the purpose of intention is not accomplished.

original: 'di la nam zhig ji ltar gang la bde zhes bya ba ni khyim na gnas pa 'di la rgyu mtshan gang gis bde zhing dus nam zhig bde la dngos po gang bde zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la nam zhig ji ltar gang la bde zhes bya ba ni khyim na gnas pa 'di la rgyu mtshan gang gis bde zhing dus nam zhig bde la dngos po gang bde zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, when, how, and in what way is there happiness? means by what reason is there happiness for this one who lives in a house, when is there happiness, and what is the thing that is happiness?🔽The disturbance by the sense objects is the pleasure of sexual intercourse with a beautiful woman of the world, and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyis gtse ba ni yul gyi bzang mo la sogs 'khrig pa'i bde ba yin no zhes 'jig rten la grags mod kyi de la yang bde ba med par ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyis gtse ba ni yul gyi bzang mo la sogs 'khrig pa'i bde ba yin no zhes 'jig rten la grags mod kyi de la yang bde ba med par ston pa ni /
translated: But it is taught that there is no happiness in that, with the words:

original: rmongs pas 'dod chags nye bar spyod pa yang //
analyzed: rmongs pas 'dod chags nye bar spyod pa yang //
translated: Even the enjoyment of passion by the ignorant

original: rma g-ya' 'phrug pa'i bde ba bzhin du zad //🔽@297a * // ces bya ste /
analyzed: rma g-ya' 'phrug pa'i bde ba bzhin du zad // @297a * // ces bya ste /
translated: is like the pleasure of scratching an itch.

original: g-yan pa 'phrug pa'i bde ba lta bu ste go sla'o //
analyzed: g-yan pa 'phrug pa'i bde ba lta bu ste go sla'o //
translated: It is like the pleasure of scratching an itch. It is easy to understand.

original: gzhan yang phal cher ni 'di lta bu yin te zhes bya ba kha zas zos pa'i bde ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang phal cher ni 'di lta bu yin te zhes bya ba kha zas zos pa'i bde ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is mostly like this, means the pleasure of eating food, and so on.

original: yang na 'og ma ston pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'og ma ston pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: Or it is a connection to the teaching of the next verse.

original: de bas na btsun pa bdag gis khyed la gdams ngag tu bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na btsun pa bdag gis khyed la gdams ngag tu bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, O Noble One, the advice I give to you is this:

original: khyim gyi nyes pa dang / dgon pa'i yon tan dang / der gnas par dam bca' ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis rim pa bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: khyim gyi nyes pa dang / dgon pa'i yon tan dang / der gnas par dam bca' ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis rim pa bzhin bstan to //
translated: The faults of the householder life, the virtues of the forest life, and the vow to live in the forest are taught in three verses, respectively.

original: de la khyim gyi nyes pa ni sbrul gdug pa'i tshang dang mtshungs par ston te /
analyzed: de la khyim gyi nyes pa ni sbrul gdug pa'i tshang dang mtshungs par ston te /
translated: The faults of the householder life are shown to be like a nest of vipers.

original: nyon mongs pa sbrul dang 'dra ba'i gnas su gyur pa dang / sbrul gdug pa can gyi tshang du phyin na srog 'jig pa ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas 'jig pa'i phyir dang / sbrul gyi dug gis ma zin par du lus skrangs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa'i rten du gyur pa ltar tshe 'di dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal mang po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni dreg sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sbrul dang 'dra ba'i gnas su gyur pa dang / sbrul gdug pa can gyi tshang du phyin na srog 'jig pa ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas 'jig pa'i phyir dang / sbrul gyi dug gis ma zin par du lus skrangs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa'i rten du gyur pa ltar tshe 'di dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal mang po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni dreg sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The householder life is a nest of vipers because it is the abode of the vipers of the afflictions, and because, if one enters the nest of vipers, one is destroyed by the loss of the bliss of nirvana, and because it is the abode of many sufferings in this life and the next, just as one is the abode of the unbearable suffering of a swollen body until one is seized by the poison of the vipers.

original: phyug po'i rabs te bco brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: phyug po'i rabs te bco brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the eighteenth chapter on the rich man.

original: // / chos dang srid dang de bzhin bde ba 'phel //🔽zhes bya ba la chos ni dge ba'i las so //🔽srid ni rang gi 'khor skyong ba'o //🔽bde ba ni lus dang longs spyod dam chos tshe 'dir 'phel bas 'jig rten phyi ma la yang bde bar 'gyur ro //🔽dge ba rnams kyi brtan pa'i rgyu //🔽rnam par 'phel ba bzhin du mngon pa ni gang zag bsam pa dge ba'i sdug bsngal gyis mi 'phrogs pa brtan pa rnam par 'phro ba ste ches gsal bar rtogs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // / chos dang srid dang de bzhin bde ba 'phel // zhes bya ba la chos ni dge ba'i las so // srid ni rang gi 'khor skyong ba'o // bde ba ni lus dang longs spyod dam chos tshe 'dir 'phel bas 'jig rten phyi ma la yang bde bar 'gyur ro // dge ba rnams kyi brtan pa'i rgyu // rnam par 'phel ba bzhin du mngon pa ni gang zag bsam pa dge ba'i sdug bsngal gyis mi 'phrogs pa brtan pa rnam par 'phro ba ste ches gsal bar rtogs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: 1.1.1.1.1.1.1.1.1. Dharma, prosperity, and likewise happiness increase.🔽Dharma is virtuous action.🔽Prosperity is the protection of one's own retinue.🔽Happiness is the increase of body, wealth, or Dharma in this life, which leads to happiness in the next life.🔽The cause of stability for the virtuous is🔽the increase of the roots of virtue.🔽The manifestation of stability is the unshakability by suffering of the person with a virtuous intention, the stability that is clearly understood, that is, very clearly realized.🔽

original: de bas rab dang 'bring dang tha ma rnams //🔽'di dang pha rol tu yang 'dod pas gsod par byed //🔽ces bya ba la lha dang mi dang ngan 'gro rnams sam /🔽mi nyid kyi bye brag rgyal po la sogs pa rnams dang / phal pa rnams dang / rigs ngan la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de bas rab dang 'bring dang tha ma rnams //🔽'di dang pha rol tu yang 'dod pas gsod par byed //🔽ces bya ba la lha dang mi dang ngan 'gro rnams sam /🔽mi nyid kyi bye brag rgyal po la sogs pa rnams dang / phal pa rnams dang / rigs ngan la sogs pa dag go //

original: dka' thub can gyi rabs te bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: dka' thub can gyi rabs te bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the nineteenth chapter, on the Ascetic.

original: // / ji ltar tshig gcig ba dag gis zhes bya ba tshig bag tsam las ma smras pa'am /🔽tshig gis kyang ma smras par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // / ji ltar tshig gcig ba dag gis zhes bya ba tshig bag tsam las ma smras pa'am / tshig gis kyang ma smras par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As it is said, “Even though he is endowed with all good qualities, he is not a fit vessel for the Dharma because of his miserliness.”

original: 'jungs shing zhes bya ba'i rkang pa gnyis ni yon tan no //
analyzed: 'jungs shing zhes bya ba'i rkang pa gnyis ni yon tan no //
translated: The two lines beginning “Miserly” are the good qualities.

original: de ltar yon tan dang ldan yang skyon gyi rnam pa mi brtan zhing bdag cag nang @297b mi la snying rje med pa 'di ji ltar logs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan dang ldan yang skyon gyi rnam pa mi brtan zhing bdag cag nang @297b mi la snying rje med pa 'di ji ltar logs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though he is endowed with good qualities, he is not a fit vessel because of his instability, his faults, and his lack of compassion.

original: nags tshal dgon par gang btsal ba ni chos bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nags tshal dgon par gang btsal ba ni chos bsgrub pa'o //
translated: “What is sought in the forest” is the practice of the Dharma.

original: de ni khyim du'ang 'grub ste gtsang sbra ste bsod nams sbor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni khyim du'ang 'grub ste gtsang sbra ste bsod nams sbor ba'o //
translated: “That is accomplished at home” is the purification of merit.

original: tshul khrims ni bsnyen gnas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni bsnyen gnas la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Moral discipline” is the one-day vows and so on.

original: nor dang ldan pas sbyin pa bsgrub par nus pa'o //
analyzed: nor dang ldan pas sbyin pa bsgrub par nus pa'o //
translated: “Wealth” is the ability to practice generosity.

original: rjes su mthun zhing chos grogs byed //
analyzed: rjes su mthun zhing chos grogs byed //
translated: “A suitable Dharma friend” is a friend who is in accord with the Dharma.

original: nyes pa med pa ni bud med do //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa ni bud med do //
translated: “A woman who is without fault” is a woman who is without faults.

original: kye ma'o 'dam gyis mnar ba lta //
analyzed: kye ma'o 'dam gyis mnar ba lta //
translated: “Alas, he is afflicted by mud!”

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams de ni da ltar rigs pa na ma bskos pa yin no zhes 'dzer to //🔽gang phyir 'jig rten dag na srid pa ni //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams de ni da ltar rigs pa na ma bskos pa yin no zhes 'dzer to // gang phyir 'jig rten dag na srid pa ni //
translated: This is what worldly people say, “He is not appointed to that office now, but he will be in the future.”

original: bde dang sdug bsngal dag la mtshungs par spyod //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal dag la mtshungs par spyod //
translated: Because in the world, one experiences pleasure and pain equally with those who are dear.

original: zhes pa ni mdza' bshes la sogs pa bde ba'i tshe yang lhan cig spyod de dga' ston la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mdza' bshes la sogs pa bde ba'i tshe yang lhan cig spyod de dga' ston la sogs pa'o //
translated: When those who are dear are happy, one experiences pleasure with them, such as at a festival.

original: sdug bsngal yang lhan cig spyod de shi bar gyur pa'i dus su thams cad kyang yongs su gdung bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang lhan cig spyod de shi bar gyur pa'i dus su thams cad kyang yongs su gdung bar byed do //
translated: When they are suffering, one experiences suffering with them, as when someone dies and everyone grieves.

original: de'i sdug pa de'i tshe yang sdug pa lhan cig spyod pas de bas 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sdug pa de'i tshe yang sdug pa lhan cig spyod pas de bas 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When they are in pain, one is pained by the pain of those who are dear.

original: tshul ngan na zhes pa ni spyod tshul ngan na zhes ba ste skyon la dad cing yon tan 'dor ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshul ngan na zhes pa ni spyod tshul ngan na zhes ba ste skyon la dad cing yon tan 'dor ba nyid do //
translated: When they are in a bad situation, one is in a bad situation because of one’s affection for them. One has faith in their faults and one abandons their good qualities.

original: de ltar gyur na skye bo dge bas spang bar brtsi bar 'gyur te skye bo dam pa brten pa rnams kyis spang pa ste mi brten pa dge ba la sgro ba chung bar brtsi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na skye bo dge bas spang bar brtsi bar 'gyur te skye bo dam pa brten pa rnams kyis spang pa ste mi brten pa dge ba la sgro ba chung bar brtsi bar 'gyur te /
translated: The virtuous will consider them as having little to do with virtue, since they are not steadfast.🔽This is what is meant by “condemned by the holy.

original: dam pas smad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam pas smad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by “condemned by the holy ones.”🔽

original: de bas skye bo re ba skong bar bya //
analyzed: de bas skye bo re ba skong bar bya //
translated: Therefore, one should fulfill the hopes of beings.

original: zhes sbyar te rab tu byung bar re ba de'o //
analyzed: zhes sbyar te rab tu byung bar re ba de'o //
translated: This refers to the hope of going forth.

original: de yang ji ltar sgrub na spang pa dang blang ba gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar sgrub na spang pa dang blang ba gnyis te /
translated: How is this accomplished? By two things: by rejecting and by taking up.

original: dang po ni spyod pa ngan pas nyon mongs khyim spangs nas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni spyod pa ngan pas nyon mongs khyim spangs nas zhes pa ste /
translated: The first is stated: Having renounced the household life with its afflictions due to bad behavior.

original: spyod pa ngan pa'i longs spyod bsgrub pa dang bsrung ba la sogs pa nyon mongs shing gdung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ngan pa'i longs spyod bsgrub pa dang bsrung ba la sogs pa nyon mongs shing gdung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: Bad behavior is a cause of affliction and torment in the pursuit and protection of wealth.🔽The second is stated: Having taken up the virtues of delight in the forest of asceticism.

original: blang ba ni dka' thub nags na dga' ba'i yon tan gyis nyams su blangs te zhes bya ba ste tshul khrims dang de'i mthun rkyen sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blang ba ni dka' thub nags na dga' ba'i yon tan gyis nyams su blangs te zhes bya ba ste tshul khrims dang de'i mthun rkyen sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa'o //
translated: These are morality and the virtues of austerity that are conducive to it.

original: nor dang thabs dang mthu rtsal gang dag gis //
analyzed: nor dang thabs dang mthu rtsal gang dag gis //
translated: By what wealth, means, and power

original: nga la thub par gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nga la thub par gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: have I not been able to overcome them?🔽By what suffering, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa nor gang gis dbul ba ma bzlog pa dang / thabs gang gis nad la sogs par ma gyur pa dang / mthu rtsal gang gis dgra la sogs pa ma bzlog pa'o //🔽de las @298a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa nor gang gis dbul ba ma bzlog pa dang / thabs gang gis nad la sogs par ma gyur pa dang / mthu rtsal gang gis dgra la sogs pa ma bzlog pa'o // de las @298a * //
translated: By what wealth have I not been able to overcome poverty? By what means have I not been able to overcome sickness, etc.? By what power have I not been able to overcome enemies, etc.?

original: nor 'dod pa la nor khyer cig pa dang / gzhan gnyis kyis gnod pa yod ni gnod cing dgra bzlog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor 'dod pa la nor khyer cig pa dang / gzhan gnyis kyis gnod pa yod ni gnod cing dgra bzlog par bya ba'o //
translated: The one who desires wealth should take wealth from there. The other two should do what is necessary to overcome the harm that exists.

original: gang zhig pha rol po de dag rab tu 'byung bar sems na yang bdag nyid phyis su gyur pa ga la srid /
analyzed: gang zhig pha rol po de dag rab tu 'byung bar sems na yang bdag nyid phyis su gyur pa ga la srid /
translated: If one thinks that those opponents will go forth, how could one’s own going forth be later?

original: bya ba nyams kyis mi lcogs pa //
analyzed: bya ba nyams kyis mi lcogs pa //
translated: One is not able to do what is to be done because of weakness.

original: gzhan gyis spang kyang byar mi rung //🔽dge dge zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis spang kyang byar mi rung // dge dge zhes brjod pas /
translated: Even if others abandon it, one is not able to do it.

original: me ru 'jug tu ga la rung //
analyzed: me ru 'jug tu ga la rung //
translated: How could one enter the fire because of the statement, “It is virtuous, it is virtuous”?

original: zhes brjod pa lta bu'o snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa lta bu'o snyam pa yin no //
translated: One should think, “It is like the statement, ‘It is not right.’”

original: mdza' bor 'thams pas zhes bya ba ni mdza' bor byas shing grogs bshes su gyur pa'am gnyen 'brel du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bor 'thams pas zhes bya ba ni mdza' bor byas shing grogs bshes su gyur pa'am gnyen 'brel du gyur pa'o //
translated: Embracing a friend means having made a friend, having become an intimate, having become a relative.

original: rang gi mdza' bo bag med cing tshe 'di la gzhan gyi don las nyams shing gnod pa dang 'brel pa mthong na de las bzlog pa'i phan par 'gyur ba'i lam la sbyor ba la rtsub pa ste drag shul gyi las bya bar rigs na phan zhing 'jam na
analyzed: rang gi mdza' bo bag med cing tshe 'di la gzhan gyi don las nyams shing gnod pa dang 'brel pa mthong na de las bzlog pa'i phan par 'gyur ba'i lam la sbyor ba la rtsub pa ste drag shul gyi las bya bar rigs na phan zhing 'jam na
translated: If one sees one's friend to be heedless, and to be engaged in the affairs of this life, and to be involved in harm, it is proper to engage in harsh action, in the path of benefit that is the opposite of that.

original: smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention that it is proper when it is gentle and beneficial?

original: don de ni nyon mongs bcas kyang 'chos mi byed ces gsungs so //
analyzed: don de ni nyon mongs bcas kyang 'chos mi byed ces gsungs so //
translated: That matter is stated in the line even if one has passion, one does not correct it.

original: da lta ni bag med pa'i gnas su 'jug pa ma yin pas dgag par mi rigs par ston pa ni nags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da lta ni bag med pa'i gnas su 'jug pa ma yin pas dgag par mi rigs par ston pa ni nags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to show that it is not proper to stop it because it is not entering into a state of heedlessness, it says the forest, and so on.

original: nags na gnas par dogs shing 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: nags na gnas par dogs shing 'jigs pa med //
translated: There is no fear or anxiety in dwelling in the forest.

original: tha mal gnas pa yin pa la //
analyzed: tha mal gnas pa yin pa la //
translated: One is in a normal state.

original: de ltar ji ltar mi sems zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar mi sems zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why would one think like that?

original: de la dgos pa ni gzhan dag gis dpyas pa la sogs pa spangs pa'am gzhan gyi sems srung dgos pa yin na de nags na med pa'o //
analyzed: de la dgos pa ni gzhan dag gis dpyas pa la sogs pa spangs pa'am gzhan gyi sems srung dgos pa yin na de nags na med pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to avoid being criticized by others, or to protect the minds of others, but that is not the case in the forest.

original: 'jigs pa ni longs spyod nyams pa'am dgra la sogs te de med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni longs spyod nyams pa'am dgra la sogs te de med pa'o //
translated: Fear is the loss of wealth or enemies and so on, but that is not the case in the forest.

original: de nyid kyis na tha mal par gnas pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rkyen chor ma lta bus ma dkrugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na tha mal par gnas pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rkyen chor ma lta bus ma dkrugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that very reason, one remains in a natural state, because one is not disturbed by conditions that are like thieves that give rise to afflictions.

original: dgra dang dmag 'gyed de dang de dag tu //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dgra dang dmag 'gyed de dang de dag tu // zhes pa ni /
translated: In the case of enemies and battles,

original: dgra dang 'thab pa dang chu las rgal ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dgra dang 'thab pa dang chu las rgal ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: In the case of enemies and battles, and in the case of crossing water and so on,

original: phongs par gyur pa'i tshe na'ang mdza' bo rnams tshul 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: phongs par gyur pa'i tshe na'ang mdza' bo rnams tshul 'chos pa'o //
translated: Even when one is in a difficult situation, friends pretend.

original: mchi mas 'ju zhing 'ong ba'i dpe yang mthong ba ni rang nyid phongs zhing nyam chung ba'o //
analyzed: mchi mas 'ju zhing 'ong ba'i dpe yang mthong ba ni rang nyid phongs zhing nyam chung ba'o //
translated: One sees examples of people coming with tears in their eyes, but they are themselves poor and weak.

original: phan 'dogs mi nus na'ang de rnams mdza' bo gzhan nyam nyes na du ba la sogs pa mthong la /
analyzed: phan 'dogs mi nus na'ang de rnams mdza' bo gzhan nyam nyes na du ba la sogs pa mthong la /
translated: Even if one is unable to help, when other friends are in trouble, one sees them crying and so on.

original: da lta ni phan gdags nus kyang phan mi 'dogs pa ni mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: da lta ni phan gdags nus kyang phan mi 'dogs pa ni mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Now, it is not right to not help those who can be helped.

original: mdza' bo'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: mdza' bo'i rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: This is shown by the verse beginning, “The nature of a friend…”

original: @298b g-yo dang 'thab byed pa ni ji ltar tshul 'chos zhe na phyi bzhin mi 'brang bar /
analyzed: @298b g-yo dang 'thab byed pa ni ji ltar tshul 'chos zhe na phyi bzhin mi 'brang bar /
translated: How is it that one is deceitful and quarrelsome?

original: slar zlog pa'i phyir ni skad 'dzer cing mig nas mchi mas gang bzhin smra ba'o //
analyzed: slar zlog pa'i phyir ni skad 'dzer cing mig nas mchi mas gang bzhin smra ba'o //
translated: One is deceitful and quarrelsome when one does not follow the other, but speaks with a stammering voice and eyes filled with tears in order to turn the other away.

original: tshul 'chos pa la yang bla ma dang 'dra ba ni mgo bos btud de 'di dag phyag 'tshal ba //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa la yang bla ma dang 'dra ba ni mgo bos btud de 'di dag phyag 'tshal ba //
translated: One is deceitful when one bows one’s head to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.

original: de g-yo dang 'thab byed de tshul 'chos pa yin no //🔽mtshungs shing mnyam pas phyag gi gnas su ma gyur pa la yang bla ma la phyag 'tshal ba ltar byed pa dang tshul 'chos pa yin no //
analyzed: de g-yo dang 'thab byed de tshul 'chos pa yin no // mtshungs shing mnyam pas phyag gi gnas su ma gyur pa la yang bla ma la phyag 'tshal ba ltar byed pa dang tshul 'chos pa yin no //
translated: One is deceitful and quarrelsome.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.

original: 'di dag byams na bdag rab tu 'byung ba'i rjes la rab tu 'byung bar rig pa la'o //🔽dam pa'i sems ni ngo mtshar gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di dag byams na bdag rab tu 'byung ba'i rjes la rab tu 'byung bar rig pa la'o //🔽dam pa'i sems ni ngo mtshar gyur pa /
translated: One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does obeisance to them.🔽One is deceitful when one does obeisance to those who are not worthy of honor, as if they were one’s guru, and one is deceitful when one does

original: gar mkhan spyod pa bzhin du mi 'gyur ram //
analyzed: gar mkhan spyod pa bzhin du mi 'gyur ram //
translated: Or is it like the performance of an actor?

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la 'phya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la 'phya ba ste /
translated: This is a reproach to others.

original: gzhan dag phan par 'dod pa'i sems su gyur pa 'dod pa de la dam pa'i sems zhes bya ba gzhan khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag phan par 'dod pa'i sems su gyur pa 'dod pa de la dam pa'i sems zhes bya ba gzhan khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others, who have a mind that wishes to benefit, accept the mind of the highest virtue in that desire.

original: de ni ngo mtshar gyi spyod pa gar mkhan lta bu de res 'ga' gces par mi rigs la res 'ga' gces par 'dzin cing mi gces par mi rig pa la mi gces pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ngo mtshar gyi spyod pa gar mkhan lta bu de res 'ga' gces par mi rigs la res 'ga' gces par 'dzin cing mi gces par mi rig pa la mi gces pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is like the performance of an actor, which is sometimes not cherished and sometimes is cherished, and is not known to be not cherished.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni yon tan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan med pa ni bdag la gzhan gyis phan gdags par mi nus te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni yon tan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan med pa ni bdag la gzhan gyis phan gdags par mi nus te /
translated: The same is taught by the verse beginning with “without good qualities. ” Without good qualities, one is not able to benefit others.

original: bdag dang lhan cig tu 'chi ba'i tshe yang grogs po yod la /
analyzed: bdag dang lhan cig tu 'chi ba'i tshe yang grogs po yod la /
translated: Even at the time of death, one has a friend.

original: yon tan yod la nags su 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: yon tan yod la nags su 'gro ba ni //
translated: But going to the forest with good qualities

original: grogs po gcig kyang med pa ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: grogs po gcig kyang med pa ngo mtshar che //
translated: is wonderful, even without a single friend.

original: zhes bya ba ste go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: yon tan med pa'i tshe grogs yod pa nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni glang chen smyon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: yon tan med pa'i tshe grogs yod pa nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni glang chen smyon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The explanation of the presence of friends when one has no virtues is the verse beginning “The crazy elephant of the mind,” which is easy to understand.

original: de dag yin nam de yang de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ngag kyang ma yin nam yang na bdag kyang yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag yin nam de yang de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ngag kyang ma yin nam yang na bdag kyang yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “ They are not that, nor is that they,” means that they are not speech, nor is that the self.

original: mi gces pa'i tshe bdag ma yin la de'i tshe khyed kyang bdag gi mdza' bshes ma yin na'o //
analyzed: mi gces pa'i tshe bdag ma yin la de'i tshe khyed kyang bdag gi mdza' bshes ma yin na'o //
translated: When one is not cherished, one is not the self, and at that time you are not my friend.

original: gces par 'dzin pa'i tshe bdag kyang yin la khyed kyang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gces par 'dzin pa'i tshe bdag kyang yin la khyed kyang yin pa'o //
translated: When one is cherished, one is the self, and you are the friend.

original: de ltar byams pa med par gyur pa'i yon tan kyang rjes su mi 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar byams pa med par gyur pa'i yon tan kyang rjes su mi 'brang ba'o //
translated: Thus, the absence of love does not follow the presence of virtues.

original: de'i rgyu nyes pa byas pas bdag mi dran na //
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyes pa byas pas bdag mi dran na //
translated: “ If I do not remember because of the fault of his cause,”

original: bdag gi mdza' bo 'di ltar 'khod bzhin du ste bde blag tu gnas bzhin du //
analyzed: bdag gi mdza' bo 'di ltar 'khod bzhin du ste bde blag tu gnas bzhin du //
translated: “while my friend is thus present,” that is, while he is living comfortably,

original: 'di ltar 'gyur ram rung ngam ci zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gyur ram rung ngam ci zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “is this proper?”

original: bdag gi grogs mi byed pa rigs sam ci zhes bya ba'o @299a * //
analyzed: bdag gi grogs mi byed pa rigs sam ci zhes bya ba'o @299a * //
translated: “Is it right for me not to help my friend?”

original: bdag la yon tan med pa de ltar 'brang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yon tan ma mthong ba rnams rjes su mi 'brang ba de ltar rigs kyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la yon tan med pa de ltar 'brang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yon tan ma mthong ba rnams rjes su mi 'brang ba de ltar rigs kyang zhes bya'o //
translated: The line I have no good qualities, so I will not follow means that those who do not see my good qualities will not follow me, and that is right.

original: bdag gis yon tan dag la rjes su chags pa rnams //
analyzed: bdag gis yon tan dag la rjes su chags pa rnams //
translated: The line I am attached to my own good qualities means that those who are attached to their own good qualities will not follow me, and that is right.

original: de ltar 'brang bar nus pa su zhig yod //
analyzed: de ltar 'brang bar nus pa su zhig yod //
translated: Who is able to follow me in this way?

original: de dag ni bdag rjes su 'brang bar rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag rjes su 'brang bar rigs pa'o //
translated: Those are the ones who are right to follow me.

original: 'on kyang mi mkhas pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brtag par mi rigs so zhes shes pa ni gang dag zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi mkhas pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brtag par mi rigs so zhes shes pa ni gang dag zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The line But it is not right to investigate the conceptions of the unwise is the verse that teaches that it is not right to investigate the conceptions of the unwise.

original: di ring bdag 'dor ba ni gti mug yin zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi ldog cing bde ba'i rkyen gyi bar chod byed pa de ni bdag chud gson pa yin la de ni kun tu rmongs pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: di ring bdag 'dor ba ni gti mug yin zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi ldog cing bde ba'i rkyen gyi bar chod byed pa de ni bdag chud gson pa yin la de ni kun tu rmongs pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: The line Today I will abandon the self, which is delusion means that not turning away from the cause of suffering and creating an obstacle to the conditions of happiness is the loss of the self, and that is due to complete delusion.

original: nyes pa de dag mngon du gzhom par bya ba ni bdag la sdig pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa de nyid bdag gis gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa de dag mngon du gzhom par bya ba ni bdag la sdig pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa de nyid bdag gis gzhom par bya'o //
translated: The destruction of those faults is the destruction of that very root of evil in me.

original: chos sgrub pa'i grogs dkon pa ni de tshe gang zag 'gas kyang rab tu byung ba la skul ma ma btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos sgrub pa'i grogs dkon pa ni de tshe gang zag 'gas kyang rab tu byung ba la skul ma ma btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rarity of companions in the practice of Dharma is because at that time no one at all urges one to go forth.

original: tshong dpon gyi rabs te nyi shu pa'o /
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi rabs te nyi shu pa'o /
translated: The Story of the Merchant Chief is the twentieth.

original: // / sbyor ba'i yon tan nges pa ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: // / sbyor ba'i yon tan nges pa ni brtan pa'o //
translated: The quality of application is firmness.

original: de yun ring du gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni yun ring du bslabs pa'o //
analyzed: de yun ring du gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni yun ring du bslabs pa'o //
translated: When that has lasted a long time, means when it has been practiced for a long time.

original: de 'dod pa rnams yongs su spangs nas zhes 'brel to //🔽bud med dag ni bltar yang med par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams yongs su spangs nas zhes 'brel to // bud med dag ni bltar yang med par byed pa ni /
translated: Having abandoned desires, it is connected.🔽Women are not even to be looked at.

original: spyir dka' thub can gzhan dag ste bud med ni nam du yang mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: spyir dka' thub can gzhan dag ste bud med ni nam du yang mi mthong ba'o //
translated: In general, other ascetics do not look at women at all.

original: rgyags pas bsnyems sam gal te ma brtags pa zhes bya ba la gal te pha rol po dregs shing snyems pa ste bdag khyad du gsod pa dang / gal te ma brtags par de gzu lums su bdag la gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pas bsnyems sam gal te ma brtags pa zhes bya ba la gal te pha rol po dregs shing snyems pa ste bdag khyad du gsod pa dang / gal te ma brtags par de gzu lums su bdag la gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: If he is arrogant through pride or if he is reckless, then if the other person is arrogant, i.e., despises me, and if he is reckless, i.e., harms me rashly,

original: sgra'i don thad ka la de yin la de ni snyems pa'i dregs pa rang dbang med par 'byung ba dang ma brtags par 'byung ba gnyis ka spang bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i don thad ka la de yin la de ni snyems pa'i dregs pa rang dbang med par 'byung ba dang ma brtags par 'byung ba gnyis ka spang bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the meaning of the words is that both his arrogance through pride and his recklessness should be avoided.

original: bdag nyid gson bzhin de ni yongs ma gtang //
analyzed: bdag nyid gson bzhin de ni yongs ma gtang //
translated: As long as I am alive, I will not let him go.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol dgra'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol dgra'o //
translated: The other person is the enemy.

original: bdag nyid gson par ma btang ste legs par song bar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
