analyzed: bdag nyid gson par ma btang ste legs par song bar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I will not let him go as long as I am alive, i.e., I will do well to him.

original: yang na bdag nyid ma shi bar du dgra de mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid ma shi bar du dgra de mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Or, I will not let the enemy go as long as I am not dead.

original: don ni rang gi zhe sdang la sbyar ro //
analyzed: don ni rang gi zhe sdang la sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that one should apply this to one's own hatred.

original: da dung gson zhes pa ni da dung cung zad gson de myur du shin legs pa'o //
analyzed: da dung gson zhes pa ni da dung cung zad gson de myur du shin legs pa'o //
translated: As long as I am alive, means as long as I am alive a little while longer, and quickly means well.

original: kye ma'o bdag @299b dgar bgyis pa gang la srid //
analyzed: kye ma'o bdag @299b dgar bgyis pa gang la srid //
translated: Alas! I am pleased with what pleases him,

original: ces pa ni jo bo dgyes rung ma dgyes rung bdag gis dgyes pa ni ma yin kyang bdag nyid kyi dge ba bsgrub pa'i bar chad la sogs pa zhi bar gyur pa'i slad du tshul du 'brangs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni jo bo dgyes rung ma dgyes rung bdag gis dgyes pa ni ma yin kyang bdag nyid kyi dge ba bsgrub pa'i bar chad la sogs pa zhi bar gyur pa'i slad du tshul du 'brangs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means that, whether or not the Lord is pleased, I am pleased with what pleases him, and I follow his way in order to pacify obstacles to the practice of virtue, etc.

original: skyes nas gang zhig mi mngon la //
analyzed: skyes nas gang zhig mi mngon la //
translated: When anger arises, virtue is not manifest.

original: zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba skyes nas dge ba mi mngon zhing 'grib pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba skyes nas dge ba mi mngon zhing 'grib pa'o //
translated: This means that when anger arises, virtue is not manifest and diminishes.

original: de ma skyes na ni dge bar mngon zhing dge ba la 'jug pa'i go skabs yod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma skyes na ni dge bar mngon zhing dge ba la 'jug pa'i go skabs yod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But when it does not arise, virtue is manifest and there is an opportunity to engage in virtue.

original: ma phan 'dod pa'i mi ni dgra ste de dag ni gzhan yid mi bde zhing 'khrugs na dga' bas de nyid kyis na dgra rnams dga' 'gyur zhes pa /
analyzed: ma phan 'dod pa'i mi ni dgra ste de dag ni gzhan yid mi bde zhing 'khrugs na dga' bas de nyid kyis na dgra rnams dga' 'gyur zhes pa /
translated: People who wish to harm are enemies, and they are pleased when others are unhappy and disturbed.

original: mdza' bshes dag gis rab tu gcugs gyur kyang //
analyzed: mdza' bshes dag gis rab tu gcugs gyur kyang //
translated: Even if they are well-disposed by friends,

original: zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes kyis phan btags kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes kyis phan btags kyang ngo //
translated: This means even if friends help them.

original: kun tu rgyu byang chub kyi rabs te nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o /
analyzed: kun tu rgyu byang chub kyi rabs te nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o /
translated: The Story of the Wandering Ascetic Bodha is the twenty-first.

original: // / zla ba'i na chung skar ma rnams //
analyzed: // / zla ba'i na chung skar ma rnams //
translated: The young women of the moon and the stars

original: spyi yi gdong lta me long bzhin //
analyzed: spyi yi gdong lta me long bzhin //
translated: are like mirrors reflecting the general face.

original: zhes bya ba ji ltar na chung rnams kyi byad kyi gzugs brnyan me long la 'char ba ltar zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa na chung mdzes pa de dag gi gzugs brnyan mtsho de'i nang du mtshan mo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ji ltar na chung rnams kyi byad kyi gzugs brnyan me long la 'char ba ltar zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa na chung mdzes pa de dag gi gzugs brnyan mtsho de'i nang du mtshan mo 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as the reflections of the young women's faces appear in the mirror, so at night the reflections of those beautiful young women, the moon and stars, appear in that lake.

original: dga' zhing mi 'jigs yon tan bcas //
analyzed: dga' zhing mi 'jigs yon tan bcas //
translated: With joy and fearlessness, endowed with good qualities,

original: zhes bya ba la rgyal po'i 'khor dang bcas pa dga' zhing mi 'jigs pa sgrogs pas yon tan bcas ti mi 'jigs pa'i yon phul pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rgyal po'i 'khor dang bcas pa dga' zhing mi 'jigs pa sgrogs pas yon tan bcas ti mi 'jigs pa'i yon phul pa'o //
translated: the king and his retinue, with joy and fearlessness, endowed with good qualities, offered the gift of fearlessness.🔽Your gain is also like that.

original: khyod kyi rnyed pa yang de bzhin la zhes bya ba ni blon po bdag bzung bas rgyal po bya dga' stsol ba'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi rnyed pa yang de bzhin la zhes bya ba ni blon po bdag bzung bas rgyal po bya dga' stsol ba'o //
translated: The king gave a reward to the minister who had captured himself.

original: bdag gis gsol ba gnang ste ngang pa'i rgyal po gtang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis gsol ba gnang ste ngang pa'i rgyal po gtang ba'o //
translated: I request permission to release the king of geese.

original: de nas yon tan gzhan yang nga la mang po dga' bar bgyid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas yon tan gzhan yang nga la mang po dga' bar bgyid par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, other good qualities will also bring me much joy.

original: rgyal po dang bcas pa thams cad dga'o //
analyzed: rgyal po dang bcas pa thams cad dga'o //
translated: All, including the king, are delighted.

original: de bas mdza' ba'ang de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: de bas mdza' ba'ang de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, friends will be like that.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngang pa mang po'i mdza' bshes kyi phyogs thams cad kyang dga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngang pa mang po'i mdza' bshes kyi phyogs thams cad kyang dga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means that all the friendly factions of many geese will be delighted.

original: khyod kyi chos kyi sku la rma med dam //
analyzed: khyod kyi chos kyi sku la rma med dam //
translated: Is there no wound in your Dharma body?

original: zhes bya ba ni chos bsgrub pa'i rten gyi lus bde'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos bsgrub pa'i rten gyi lus bde'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means, Is the body that is the basis for accomplishing the Dharma well?

original: yang na tshig rkang pa dang po gnyis kyis rang nyid bde bar bzhugs sam zhes bstan la /
analyzed: yang na tshig rkang pa dang po gnyis kyis rang nyid bde bar bzhugs sam zhes bstan la /
translated: Or, the first two lines indicate, Are you yourself well?

original: tshig rkang pa gzhan gnyis kyis ni 'bangs rnams bde bar gnas sam zhes bstan pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: tshig rkang pa gzhan gnyis kyis ni 'bangs rnams bde bar gnas sam zhes bstan pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The other two lines indicate, Are your subjects well?

original: sku chos kyi sku ni chos kyis bskyang bar bya ba'i 'khor gyi tshogs te de rnams la gnod pa med dam @300a * //
analyzed: sku chos kyi sku ni chos kyis bskyang bar bya ba'i 'khor gyi tshogs te de rnams la gnod pa med dam @300a * //
translated: The Dharma body is the assembly of retinues to be sustained by the Dharma. Is there no harm to them?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bka' lung snyan pas rgya cher dbugs dbyung ngam zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bka' lung snyan pas rgya cher dbugs dbyung ngam zhes pa ste /
translated: In order to clarify that, the king should be consoled with sweet words.

original: rgyal po'am 'bangs yongs su bzung ba'i tshig gis 'bangs rnams bde bar gnas sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'am 'bangs yongs su bzung ba'i tshig gis 'bangs rnams bde bar gnas sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words consoled and well are to be supplied.

original: phan gdags zhes bya ba'i rkang pa gnyis kyis ni gzhan la phan pa bsgrubs sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan gdags zhes bya ba'i rkang pa gnyis kyis ni gzhan la phan pa bsgrubs sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The two lines beginning with benefiting mean have you accomplished the welfare of others?

original: 'bangs rnams glo ba nye zhing phan btags sam zhes pa ni 'bangs kyi bsam pa dang sbyor bas rgyal po yang legs pa'i bya ba byed dam zhes pa'o //🔽blon po mdzangs shing glo ba nye ba rnams //
analyzed: 'bangs rnams glo ba nye zhing phan btags sam zhes pa ni 'bangs kyi bsam pa dang sbyor bas rgyal po yang legs pa'i bya ba byed dam zhes pa'o // blon po mdzangs shing glo ba nye ba rnams //
translated: The line beginning with loyal means have you, by the attitude and actions of your subjects, caused the king to perform good deeds?

original: brtag pa'i thabs kyis legs par brtags lags sam //
analyzed: brtag pa'i thabs kyis legs par brtags lags sam //
translated: The two lines beginning with wise mean have you, by means of the methods of investigation, properly investigated the wise and loyal ministers?

original: zhes bya ba ni blon po'i khyad par bya ba'i khyad par so so bsgrub pa la brtags shing bskos sam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni blon po'i khyad par bya ba'i khyad par so so bsgrub pa la brtags shing bskos sam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The line beginning with appointed means have you appointed the ministers individually to the particular tasks to be done?

original: ji skad du 'char byed kyi mdo las 'tshal za gus pa dang nus pa dang shes pa brtags nas legs par bskos shing de dag la tshul dang mthun pa'i bsnyen bkur byed pa'i yon tan dang bzlog pa'i nyes pa rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du 'char byed kyi mdo las 'tshal za gus pa dang nus pa dang shes pa brtags nas legs par bskos shing de dag la tshul dang mthun pa'i bsnyen bkur byed pa'i yon tan dang bzlog pa'i nyes pa rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the Udayana-sutra says, “Having examined the suitability, respectfulness, ability, and knowledge of the one who is to be appointed, he is well appointed. The qualities of the proper service and the faults of the opposite are extensively taught.”

original: de dag ma mkhyen par ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de dag ma mkhyen par ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan pa'i thabs so //
translated: “Without knowing them” means the means of helping others.

original: dpa' zhing thabs la mkhas pa'i bka' nan gyis zhes bya ba ni snying stobs dang shes rab kyis blon po'i khyad par bskos pas rgyal phran rnams legs par bsgrubs sam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' zhing thabs la mkhas pa'i bka' nan gyis zhes bya ba ni snying stobs dang shes rab kyis blon po'i khyad par bskos pas rgyal phran rnams legs par bsgrubs sam zhes pa'o //
translated: “By the command of the one who is heroic and skilled in means” means that the king has appointed a special minister through his courage and wisdom.

original: thams cad du yang bsam pa bzang ste chos kyi don du 'gyur bas thugs rje chen po'i mdzes pa mchis lags sam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang bsam pa bzang ste chos kyi don du 'gyur bas thugs rje chen po'i mdzes pa mchis lags sam zhes pa'o //
translated: “In all things, his intentions are good,” because they are for the sake of the Dharma. “Is there beauty in his great compassion?”

original: blo gtad par mi 'os pa'i tshal za ba la sogs pa la blo gtad pa ni nyes pa yin pas /
analyzed: blo gtad par mi 'os pa'i tshal za ba la sogs pa la blo gtad pa ni nyes pa yin pas /
translated: “To trust those who are untrustworthy” is a fault.

original: thugs rje bag med par mi mnal grang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thugs rje bag med par mi mnal grang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and that your compassion does not sleep, that is, does not become cold.

original: chos ni dge ba bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni dge ba bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Dharma is the practice of virtue.

original: bde ba ni de'i longs spyod kyi 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni de'i longs spyod kyi 'byor pa'o //
translated: Happiness is the wealth of its enjoyment.

original: srid ni 'bangs rnams ma 'khrug pa'i bka' bsgos pas nyan pa'o //
analyzed: srid ni 'bangs rnams ma 'khrug pa'i bka' bsgos pas nyan pa'o //
translated: Sovereignty is the listening to the commands of the people who are not disturbed.

original: de gsum mthun lags sam zhes bya ba ste rdzogs par yod dam zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: de gsum mthun lags sam zhes bya ba ste rdzogs par yod dam zhes pa'o ;
translated: Are these three in harmony? that is, Are they complete?

original: / bdag gi yon tan gyi stobs gyis tsher ma bcad pa'i dgra rnams las khyad par du gyur zhing zil gyis gnon tam zhes khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / bdag gi yon tan gyi stobs gyis tsher ma bcad pa'i dgra rnams las khyad par du gyur zhing zil gyis gnon tam zhes khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the power of my good qualities, have I become superior to and overcome those enemies who cut off the thorns? You, and so on.

original: rgyal po chen po khyod la brten cing lta zhes pa ni bdag bya'i rgyal po yang mi'i rgyal po la brten cing lta ste ltos pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya @300b ba'o ;
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyod la brten cing lta zhes pa ni bdag bya'i rgyal po yang mi'i rgyal po la brten cing lta ste ltos pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya @300b ba'o ;
translated: Great King, I depend on you and look up to you means that even the king of birds depends on and looks up to the king of men, that is, he is dependent.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na khyod ni mgron la dga' zhing yon tan 'dod ces smos te de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na khyod ni mgron la dga' zhing yon tan 'dod ces smos te de'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it so? You are fond of guests and desire good qualities, that is why.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa nges par goms pa'i yon tan zhes smos pa ste yon tan la dga' zhing mgron rnams sbyin pa'i zhing 'grus pa yang sngon goms pa'i yon tan yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa nges par goms pa'i yon tan zhes smos pa ste yon tan la dga' zhing mgron rnams sbyin pa'i zhing 'grus pa yang sngon goms pa'i yon tan yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One who delights in good qualities and is diligent in giving to guests is also one who has the quality of being habituated to good qualities.

original: 'bangs la phan phyir rgyal po'i tshul 'dzin pa //
analyzed: 'bangs la phan phyir rgyal po'i tshul 'dzin pa //
translated: You hold the royal way of life for the benefit of your subjects.

original: khyod kyi rang gi yon tan ngang gis gnas zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi rang gi yon tan ngang gis gnas zhes sbyar ro //
translated: You naturally abide in your own good qualities.

original: de'i don ni rgyal srid kyi bde ba la brkam pas rgyal srid bzung ba ma yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i don ni rgyal srid kyi bde ba la brkam pas rgyal srid bzung ba ma yin gyi //
translated: The meaning is that you do not hold the kingdom out of greed for the pleasures of royalty.

original: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir rgyal srid bzung bas khyod ni yon tan dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir rgyal srid bzung bas khyod ni yon tan dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: Since you hold the kingdom for the benefit of others, you have good qualities.

original: ji ltar drang srong mnyam gzhag dka' thub 'bad pa bzhin te 'jig rten pa'i dang srong sems byams pa la sogs pa mnyam par 'jog cing tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'bad pa ni yon tan dang ldan pa yin pas nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar drang srong mnyam gzhag dka' thub 'bad pa bzhin te 'jig rten pa'i dang srong sems byams pa la sogs pa mnyam par 'jog cing tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'bad pa ni yon tan dang ldan pa yin pas nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Just as the sage who is concentrated and strives in austerities, the worldly sage who is concentrated in loving kindness and so on and strives in morality and so on has good qualities and is peaceful.

original: rang bzhin dul pa khyod lha lags kyang mod zhes pa ste drang srong dang 'dra bar ston to //
analyzed: rang bzhin dul pa khyod lha lags kyang mod zhes pa ste drang srong dang 'dra bar ston to //
translated: You are naturally disciplined, and so you are a god even now. In this way he is like a sage.

original: de pas spod par 'os pa'i yon tan bde ste bde bar de bsgrub po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de pas spod par 'os pa'i yon tan bde ste bde bar de bsgrub po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, you are worthy of praise, meaning that you have attained happiness.

original: 'byung po'i nyes pa'i gcong rong zhes bya ba ni skye bo dag nyes pa la bcug pa'i nyes pa ni gcong rong gi gnas ltar sdug bsngal ba'i gnas yin pas der mi 'dod zhing dor ro zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'byung po'i nyes pa'i gcong rong zhes bya ba ni skye bo dag nyes pa la bcug pa'i nyes pa ni gcong rong gi gnas ltar sdug bsngal ba'i gnas yin pas der mi 'dod zhing dor ro zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The abyss of the faults of beings is a place of suffering, like a pit, into which people are thrown because of their faults. Therefore, I do not want to fall into it, meaning that I will avoid it.

original: 'khor yul ni 'khor ram yongs spyod do //
analyzed: 'khor yul ni 'khor ram yongs spyod do //
translated: The sphere of activity is the retinue or domain.

original: rgyal po yon tan can gyis thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal po yon tan can gyis thob par 'gyur //
translated: The king who has good qualities will attain it.

original: zhes bya ba ni dul ba dang bzod pa dang shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan da lta yod cing sngon goms pa'i rgyu dge ba de las 'dod pa thob po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dul ba dang bzod pa dang shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan da lta yod cing sngon goms pa'i rgyu dge ba de las 'dod pa thob po zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that I have attained what I want because of the cause of virtue, which is the good qualities of self-discipline, patience, wisdom, and so forth, which I have now and which I have cultivated in the past.

original: lha'i rgyal po'i dpal ni brgya byin la sogs ba'i 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po'i dpal ni brgya byin la sogs ba'i 'byor pa'o //
translated: The glory of the king of gods is the wealth of Indra and so forth.

original: yon tan yod na rgyud kyang rab tu 'phel ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i rigs brgyud kyang dbang bskur bar 'os shing rgyal srid kyi rgyun brtan te /
analyzed: yon tan yod na rgyud kyang rab tu 'phel ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i rigs brgyud kyang dbang bskur bar 'os shing rgyal srid kyi rgyun brtan te /
translated: If there are good qualities, the lineage also increases. Even a family with good qualities is worthy to be consecrated and the continuity of the kingdom is stable.

original: rgyal po snga ma'i rjes su rgyal po phyi ma yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal po snga ma'i rjes su rgyal po phyi ma yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the later king follows the earlier king.

original: bdag nyid chen po'i mthu ni dgra 'dul ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po'i mthu ni dgra 'dul ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of the great being is the subjugation of enemies and so on.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni zla ba'i 'od las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni zla ba'i 'od las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of that is “from the light of the moon” and so on.

original: don gyi mchog ni dgos pa'i mchog ste ji ltar don gyi mchog yin zhen /
analyzed: don gyi mchog ni dgos pa'i mchog ste ji ltar don gyi mchog yin zhen /
translated: The supreme purpose is the supreme goal. How is it the supreme purpose?

original: rgyal po chos la dga' bar gyur na ni zhes smos te phan 'dogs shing byams sems dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba'i @301a * //🔽tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyal po chos la dga' bar gyur na ni zhes smos te phan 'dogs shing byams sems dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba'i @301a * //🔽tha tshig go //
translated: It is said, “When the king delights in the Dharma,” which means he is helpful and has a loving mind.

original: bdag gi grogs mang sdug bsngal 'bad pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni ra nga pa'i tshogs rnams rje dpon med pas sdug bsngal bas de dag bdag 'bod pa ltar de dag gi drung du 'gro dgos so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi grogs mang sdug bsngal 'bad pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni ra nga pa'i tshogs rnams rje dpon med pas sdug bsngal bas de dag bdag 'bod pa ltar de dag gi drung du 'gro dgos so snyam pa'o //
translated: The line my friends are many, and they suffer, means that since the group of kinsmen are without a lord, they suffer. So you should go to them as if you were their lord.

original: ngang pa'i rabs te nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: ngang pa'i rabs te nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o /
translated: The story of the geese is the twenty-second.

original: // / bsod nams bzhi las 'bar ba'i yon tan rnams //
analyzed: // / bsod nams bzhi las 'bar ba'i yon tan rnams //
translated: The qualities that blaze from the four kinds of merit

original: nan tan sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan sgrub pa'o //
translated: are attained through practice.

original: byin gyis dga' bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bsod nams kyi stobs kyis bsgrubs pa'i yon tan tshe 'di la yang 'bad pas bsgrub pa'i nyams su len pa'i de ni de'i mthus skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //

translated: If a person who is dependent on me does not harm me and does not have to be used for the sake of others, like other necessary things, then when it is necessary to use him, at that time he does not repay the favor.

analyzed: ba byas kyang rgyal po'i chos lugs kyi nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: But even if he does not repay the favor, there is no fault in the king's dharma.

analyzed: yon tan goms pa ni byas pa la drin du gzo ba'i yon tan no //
translated: Cultivating good qualities is the good quality of repaying a favor.

original: nyes pa byas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la brnyas shing smad pa'o//
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la brnyas shing smad pa'o//
translated: Doing wrong is despising and disparaging a bodhisattva.

original: bdag gi lta ba yang gnod pa'i tshig gang gis gzhan la smod byed pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad la nyes pa mdor ston te /
analyzed: bdag gi lta ba yang gnod pa'i tshig gang gis gzhan la smod byed pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad la nyes pa mdor ston te /
translated: And my view is also harmed by the words of contempt that I use to disparage others. This is a brief teaching on the faults of all of them.

original: rgyu med na byang chub sems dpas ma byas pa med cing dbang phyug rgyu yin na yang des byas pas gzhan la bsgo bar mi rigs pa dang / las rgyu yin na yang spre'u de nyid kyi las yin pas byang chub sems dpa' la nyes pa brjod par mi rigs pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu med na byang chub sems dpas ma byas pa med cing dbang phyug rgyu yin na yang des byas pas gzhan la bsgo bar mi rigs pa dang / las rgyu yin na yang spre'u de nyid kyi las yin pas byang chub sems dpa' la nyes pa brjod par mi rigs pa dang /
translated: If karma is the cause, then it is the karma of the monkey itself, so it is not right to blame the Bodhisattva.

original: las byas pa chud ze na yang de dang 'dra ba dang / rgyal rigs kyi gzhung lugs bden na yang bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i yan /
analyzed: las byas pa chud ze na yang de dang 'dra ba dang / rgyal rigs kyi gzhung lugs bden na yang bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i yan /
translated: If the karma that is done is lost, then it is the same. If the royal law is true, then it is the law of the king himself, so it is not right to blame me.

original: (byang chub sems dpas spre'u bsad ces/) lag yin pas bya bar 'os pas bdag gi nyes pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: (byang chub sems dpas spre'u bsad ces/) lag yin pas bya bar 'os pas bdag gi nyes pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: If it is right to do it, then it is right to do it, so it is not my fault.

original: rgyas par re re nas 'og tu ston no //🔽gzhan gyis mi snyan sgrogs de ni /
analyzed: rgyas par re re nas 'og tu ston no // gzhan gyis mi snyan sgrogs de ni /
translated: This will be shown in detail below.

original: bdag la gnod pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, He who proclaims what is unpleasant to others is one who does harm to me.

original: bdag la ci phyir sdig gyur bsad du ma zad dam zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pas gsad du ma zad dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la ci phyir sdig gyur bsad du ma zad dam zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pas gsad du ma zad dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why should I be sinful? Do not kill! Not only that! Because there is no cause, do not kill!

original: gal te padma'i sdong bu skyes la sogs 'dra na zhes bya ba ni de dag dang 'dra bar rgyu med na'o //
analyzed: gal te padma'i sdong bu skyes la sogs 'dra na zhes bya ba ni de dag dang 'dra bar rgyu med na'o //
translated: If it is like the arising of the lotus stalk, etc., then it is like those, i.e., without a cause.

original: dpe ma grub pa yin te 'o na rtag tu rgyu med par yang cis mi 'gyur de padma'i sdong bu la sogs pa res 'ga' ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa yin te 'o na rtag tu rgyu med par yang cis mi 'gyur de padma'i sdong bu la sogs pa res 'ga' ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The example is not established. Then why is it not always without a cause? It follows that the lotus stalk, etc., are not occasional.

original: de dag la yang rgyu 'bras kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de dag la yang rgyu 'bras kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par ston pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that they have the characteristics of cause and effect is

original: chu la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “water, etc.”

original: gtan tshigs bcas par rgyu med zer ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bcas par rgyu med zer ba ni /
translated: The statement that it is causeless, together with the reason,

original: bdag nyid kyis ni khas 'ches sun dbyung ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni khas 'ches sun dbyung ngo //
translated: is refuted by one’s own assertion.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa la shes byed 'god par 'dod na ni rgyu la ltos par 'dod la rgyu med par yang khas lan pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa la shes byed 'god par 'dod na ni rgyu la ltos par 'dod la rgyu med par yang khas lan pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: If one wishes to adduce a proof for causelessness, one asserts dependence on a cause, and one also asserts causelessness. Therefore, one contradicts oneself,

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'am smra ba thams cad ba rdzun no zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'am smra ba thams cad ba rdzun no zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: just as if one says “inference is a valid means of knowledge,” or “all speech is false.”

original: rgyu la bltos nas 'bras bu 'grub par shugs las khas blangs te de lta ma yin na gzhan la ba ltos par bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu la bltos nas 'bras bu 'grub par shugs las khas blangs te de lta ma yin na gzhan la ba ltos par bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The effect is established by implication in dependence on the cause. Otherwise, the statement of the reason because it depends on another would be pointless.

original: dngos su ni dngos po thams @302a * //
analyzed: dngos su ni dngos po thams @302a * //
translated: In fact,

original: cad rgyu med par dam bcas pas shugs la khas blangs pa dngos su smras pa 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cad rgyu med par dam bcas pas shugs la khas blangs pa dngos su smras pa 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the assertion is contradicted by the explicit statement, because all things are asserted to be without cause.🔽If the reason is not stated, then the opponent will not understand, and so one's own assertion will not be established.🔽The statement of this is:

original: gal te rtags mi ston na ni gzhan gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur bas 'dod pa mi 'grub po zhes ston pa ni nga ste gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rtags mi ston na ni gzhan gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur bas 'dod pa mi 'grub po zhes ston pa ni nga ste gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If one does not state the reason,🔽the opponent will not understand,🔽and so one's own assertion will not be established.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni rgyu med par smra ba'i gang zag go //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni rgyu med par smra ba'i gang zag go //
translated: The word one refers to the person who advocates causelessness.

original: kha cig tu ni rgyu med rkyen med mthong bas zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni rgyu med rkyen med mthong bas zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten la sogs pa'o //
translated: In some cases, one sees that there is no cause and no condition refers to the world of the environment, and so on.

original: de'i rgyu rkyen sems can gyi thun mong gi las yin pa ma mthong zhing ma shes pas dngos po thams cad rgyu med par smra na du ba me'i rgyu dang bcas par mthong bas mthong ba dang 'gal ba'o //🔽ma mthong ba de nyid du yang med par gzhag par mi nus par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu rkyen sems can gyi thun mong gi las yin pa ma mthong zhing ma shes pas dngos po thams cad rgyu med par smra na du ba me'i rgyu dang bcas par mthong bas mthong ba dang 'gal ba'o // ma mthong ba de nyid du yang med par gzhag par mi nus par ston pa ni /
translated: If one does not see and does not understand that the cause and condition of that is the common karma of sentient beings, and if one maintains that all things are without cause, then that is contradicted by the fact that one sees that smoke has a cause in fire.🔽The following verse shows that it is impossible to maintain that one does not see what does not exist.

original: gal te gang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: If it were the case that...

original: thams cad dbang phyug gis byas na dbang phyug mnyes par bya ba'i phyir mchod pa la sogs pa bya bar mi rigs te de'i byed pa po yang dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni /🔽dbang phyug la ni re ba yis //
analyzed: thams cad dbang phyug gis byas na dbang phyug mnyes par bya ba'i phyir mchod pa la sogs pa bya bar mi rigs te de'i byed pa po yang dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa ni / dbang phyug la ni re ba yis //
translated: If everything were created by God, it would be unreasonable to perform worship, etc. in order to please God, because God would also be the agent of that.🔽The following verse shows that.🔽Why do you worship, etc.

original: ci phyir phyag la sogs pa 'tshal zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci phyir phyag la sogs pa 'tshal zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in the hope of pleasing God?

original: khyod kyi de ni rang 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi dbang phyug mchod pa de ni dbang phyug rang las byung gi byed pa po gzhan med pa'i phyir gang gis byas pa de'i las yin te thams cad des byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi de ni rang 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi dbang phyug mchod pa de ni dbang phyug rang las byung gi byed pa po gzhan med pa'i phyir gang gis byas pa de'i las yin te thams cad des byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is done by him is his action, because everything is done by him.

original: de nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni mchod sbyin khyod kyis gang byas pa de ni dbang phyug gis mi byed pa ma yin te thams cad des byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni mchod sbyin khyod kyis gang byas pa de ni dbang phyug gis mi byed pa ma yin te thams cad des byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is clarified: Whatever is done by you, O sacrifice, is not done by I§vara, because everything is done by him.

original: de yang dogs pa gang gis phyir byed na bdag nyid 'byor pa thob par bya ba'i phyir de dbang phyug rang gi bsnyen bkur la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gang byed pa'i dbang phyug de nyid byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dogs pa gang gis phyir byed na bdag nyid 'byor pa thob par bya ba'i phyir de dbang phyug rang gi bsnyen bkur la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gang byed pa'i dbang phyug de nyid byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if he does it out of what fear, it is in order to obtain the prosperity of his own self, because he does it in order to accomplish his own worship, etc.

original: de ltar na dbang phyug la byas pa don med dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang phyug la byas pa don med dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said, “Is the worship of Iśvara meaningless?”

original: gzhan yang thams cad kyi byed pa po dbang phyug ni skye dgu la gnod pa dang 'brel par byed pas gus pa'i yul du mi rung ngo zhes ston pa ni sdig pa chen po zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad kyi byed pa po dbang phyug ni skye dgu la gnod pa dang 'brel par byed pas gus pa'i yul du mi rung ngo zhes ston pa ni sdig pa chen po zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since the creator of everything, God, is related to the harm of living beings, he is not a suitable object of respect. This is taught by the verse “He is a great evildoer.”

original: da yang dbang phyug 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: da yang dbang phyug 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Moreover, if God changes,

original: chos sam gzhan las 'gyur grang na //
analyzed: chos sam gzhan las 'gyur grang na //
translated: is it from a property or from something else?

original: zhes bya ba ni de yang 'gro ba rnams la dbang med pa'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur bar 'dod na @302b dbang phyug nyid kyi rang bzhin chos zhes bya bas 'gro ba rnams bskyed par 'dod nas rkyen gzhan la ltos nas byed par 'gyur zhes phyogs gnyis su brtags
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de yang 'gro ba rnams la dbang med pa'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur bar 'dod na @302b dbang phyug nyid kyi rang bzhin chos zhes bya bas 'gro ba rnams bskyed par 'dod nas rkyen gzhan la ltos nas byed par 'gyur zhes phyogs gnyis su brtags
translated: If you assert that God is the powerless creator of living beings, then you must investigate whether God creates living beings from his own nature, called a property, or whether he creates them in dependence on other conditions.

original: pa'o // de la gal te chos las 'gyur na ni de'i snga rol dbang phyug min zhes smos te chos dang mi ldan pa'i tshe skyed par mi nus pas dbang phyug ma yin par gyur la /
analyzed: pa'o // de la gal te chos las 'gyur na ni de'i snga rol dbang phyug min zhes smos te chos dang mi ldan pa'i tshe skyed par mi nus pas dbang phyug ma yin par gyur la /
translated: If it is from a property, then before that he is not God. Since he is unable to create when he is not endowed with a property, he is not God.

original: gal te dbang phyug de yang chos dang ldan na skyed byed ma tshang ba med par yod pas cig car skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shugs la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug de yang chos dang ldan na skyed byed ma tshang ba med par yod pas cig car skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shugs la rig par bya'o //
translated: If that God is endowed with virtue, since the cause of creation is complete, it would follow that creation would occur simultaneously.

original: phyogs gnyis pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: The second position is refuted:

original: gang dag gzhan gyis byas 'gyur ba //🔽de ni bran du 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang dag gzhan gyis byas 'gyur ba // de ni bran du 'gyur ba //
translated: If he were created by another,🔽he would be a slave.

original: de ni bran du 'gyur ba nyid //🔽ces smos te /
analyzed: de ni bran du 'gyur ba nyid // ces smos te /
translated: He would be a slave.

original: gzhan la bltos pa rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir bran dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la bltos pa rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir bran dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since he would depend on another, he would not be independent, like a slave.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu skyed pa rkyen la bltos na de nyid kyang rkyen gzhan la bltos dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu skyed pa rkyen la bltos na de nyid kyang rkyen gzhan la bltos dgos te /
translated: Moreover, if the effect that is created depends on conditions, then those conditions would also have to depend on other conditions.

original: ji ltar dbang po rnam shes skyed pa yul gyi rkyen la bltos pas dbang po nyid rgyu gzhan la bltos pa lta bu'o snyam du bsams pas /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po rnam shes skyed pa yul gyi rkyen la bltos pas dbang po nyid rgyu gzhan la bltos pa lta bu'o snyam du bsams pas /
translated: Just as the cause of the arising of the consciousness of the sense faculties depends on the condition of the object, the sense faculties themselves depend on other causes.

original: dbang phyug de ni ci'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang phyug de ni ci'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, why is that God

original: rgyu yis byas par ma gyur kye //🔽zhes smos so //
analyzed: rgyu yis byas par ma gyur kye //🔽zhes smos so //
translated: not a product of causes?

original: bdag gis bsad kyi sngon gyi las ma yin zhes bya ba ni las kho na ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis bsad kyi sngon gyi las ma yin zhes bya ba ni las kho na ma yin pa ste /
translated: “It is not the case that the prior karma is destroyed by the later karma, but rather that the later karma destroys the effect of the prior karma.”

original: 'phral gyi skyes bu'i byed pa yang khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'phral gyi skyes bu'i byed pa yang khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not so, because we accept that the present action of the person is the cause of the effect.

original: gal te las dang las kyi rgyu yang 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te las dang las kyi rgyu yang 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that karma and the cause of karma exist,

original: de lta yin na su yang grol mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta yin na su yang grol mi 'gyur //

translated: The wise are praised, their virtue grows in this and other lives,
