analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba ston to /
translated: One verse on the qualities that are beneficial to others:

original: gzhan la gnod pa rtag tu sngo mi shes //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa rtag tu sngo mi shes //
translated: The wise are never hostile to others,🔽are always patient, and are not discouraged.🔽The wise are never hostile to others, are always patient, and are not discouraged.🔽The wise are always patient, and are not discouraged.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa spang ba dang / snying stobs can gyi chos nyid yid du 'ong ba ni gzhan gyis brnyas kyang rma mi phyin pas gzhan yang dga' bar 'gyur te /🔽gtsug phud byang chub yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa spang ba dang / snying stobs can gyi chos nyid yid du 'ong ba ni gzhan gyis brnyas kyang rma mi phyin pas gzhan yang dga' bar 'gyur te / gtsug phud byang chub yin no //
translated: The wise are always patient, and are not discouraged.

original: yon tan mngon bsgrub bzod pa mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan mngon bsgrub bzod pa mdzes pa'o //
translated: The wise are always patient, and are not discouraged.

original: mi ni 'bras bu'i ming gis rgyu la btags @304b pa ste mdzes pa bsgrub pas yang dang yang 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: mi ni 'bras bu'i ming gis rgyu la btags @304b pa ste mdzes pa bsgrub pas yang dang yang 'dren pa'o //
translated: Man is a name for the cause designated by the effect, since he is repeatedly drawn by the accomplishment of beauty.

original: snying rjes bka' stsal 'jig rten don byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni snying rjes de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa dang mthun pa'i gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i rgyu nyid du ston to //
analyzed: snying rjes bka' stsal 'jig rten don byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni snying rjes de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa dang mthun pa'i gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i rgyu nyid du ston to //
translated: The statement, ...because of compassion, the Tathagata speaks and acts for the sake of the world, shows that he is the cause for accomplishing the aims of others in accordance with the teachings of the Tathagata out of compassion.

original: rgyan dang stobs dang chu dang go cha dang me tog gi dpe yis ston pa lnga mthu dang ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gnyis ka'i tshe la don med zhi bar byed //
analyzed: rgyan dang stobs dang chu dang go cha dang me tog gi dpe yis ston pa lnga mthu dang ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gnyis ka'i tshe la don med zhi bar byed //
translated: The statement, ...the five teachers who are powerful, etc., shows the five teachers by means of the examples of the ornament, strength, water, armor, and flower.

original: ces bya ba ni tshe 'di dang gzhan gyi gnod pa rab tu spong pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni tshe 'di dang gzhan gyi gnod pa rab tu spong pa'o //
translated: The statement, ...at both times, they are pacified without purpose, shows the abandonment of harm at both the present and future times.

original: de'i grags pa'i yan lag ni lus can te aa ga ni lus dang yan lag nyi ga'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de'i grags pa'i yan lag ni lus can te aa ga ni lus dang yan lag nyi ga'i ming ngo //
translated: The statement, ...the limbs of fame of embodied beings, shows the abandonment of harm to embodied beings.

original: thar pa thob par byed pas mi mthun pa 'joms pa ni rkang pa gcig go //
analyzed: thar pa thob par byed pas mi mthun pa 'joms pa ni rkang pa gcig go //
translated: The statement, ...the attainment of liberation, the destruction of the adverse, shows the one foot of liberation.

original: gnyen po 'phel ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gnyen po 'phel ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The statement, ...the increase of the antidote, the two, shows the two feet of liberation.

original: thar pa tsam gyi dbang du byas na rnam par thar pa'i bde ba'ang bzod pas 'thob zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa tsam gyi dbang du byas na rnam par thar pa'i bde ba'ang bzod pas 'thob zhes pa'o //
translated: In terms of mere liberation, the bliss of liberation is also attained through patience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas de'i grags pa'i yan lag zhes bya ba ste pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa la gnas na phan pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas nas de'i grags pa'i yan lag zhes bya ba ste pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa la gnas na phan pa ste /
translated: In terms of becoming the cause of omniscience, it is called the branch of its fame. When one abides in the practice of the perfections, it is beneficial.

original: gzhan la phan pa mchog tu gyur pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa mchog tu gyur pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob par ston to //
translated: It shows that all the supreme benefits for others are attained through omniscience.

original: de ltar don che bas bzod pa bsgrub par gdams pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar don che bas bzod pa bsgrub par gdams pa ni /
translated: Thus, the instruction to practice patience through its great benefit is:

original: bzod pa de ni ma byed su zhig yod //🔽ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzod pa de ni ma byed su zhig yod // ces bya ba'o //
translated: Who is there who would not practice that patience?

original: bden pa bzhin du mthar phyin cing zhes bya pa ni bden pa mthong ba 'khor ba las nges par 'da' bar ston pa'o //🔽thub pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhin du mthar phyin cing zhes bya pa ni bden pa mthong ba 'khor ba las nges par 'da' bar ston pa'o // thub pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa bzhin du'o //
translated: The line having perfected the four truths shows that one who sees the truths will definitely transcend cyclic existence.🔽 The line like the Sage means like an arhat.🔽 The line like a doctor means like a doctor who is not skilled in medicine.

original: 'di ltar sman pa skal pa med las gyur pa ni dbul ba dge ba ma bsags pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sman pa skal pa med las gyur pa ni dbul ba dge ba ma bsags pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The line due to lack of fortune means due to poverty and lack of merit.

original: de lta bu 'gro ba la mang du yod pa de'i phyir bdag gis sems yid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de lta bu 'gro ba la mang du yod pa de'i phyir bdag gis sems yid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Since there are many such people in the world, the verse says, “I will not be like that,” and so on.

original: gdams ngag la ni dam pas gsungs pa'i rgyal po'i spyod tshul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag la ni dam pas gsungs pa'i rgyal po'i spyod tshul bstan pa'o //
translated: Advice means the teaching on the conduct of kings as taught by the wise.

original: chos ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: chos ni dge ba'o //
translated: Dharma means virtue.

original: srid ni 'bangs bsrangs pa'o //
analyzed: srid ni 'bangs bsrangs pa'o //
translated: Restraint means the protection of the people.

original: bde ba ni lus dang longs spyad kyi 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni lus dang longs spyad kyi 'byor ba'o //
translated: Happiness means the resources of body and wealth.🔽One should also say that the stability of resources is impermanent.

original: 'byor pa mi rtag pa brtan pa la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i mthu phun sum tshogs pa de ma thag tu nyams pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa mi rtag pa brtan pa la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i mthu phun sum tshogs pa de ma thag tu nyams pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood from the immediate loss of the king’s perfect power.

original: bzod par smra ba'i rabs te nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: bzod par smra ba'i rabs te nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the story of the proponents of patience, the twenty-eighth chapter of the glorious tantra of the great master of the path of the means of achieving the ten virtues.

original: // / bsam gtan goms par byas pas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste 'bras @305a * //
analyzed: // / bsam gtan goms par byas pas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste 'bras @305a * //
translated: By cultivating meditative concentration, one is born in the Brahma world. This means the first meditative concentration.

original: bu skye ba'i bsam gtan so sor skye ba ni de'i rgyu snyoms 'jug so so ba la bltos te /
analyzed: bu skye ba'i bsam gtan so sor skye ba ni de'i rgyu snyoms 'jug so so ba la bltos te /
translated: The meditative concentration that is the result of birth in each of the meditative concentrations is dependent on the individual absorptions that are its cause.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽By the fourth meditation, which is the abandonment of

original: 'dod spyod dga' dang bde dang sdug bsngal dang // rnam par spangs pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa yis //🔽tshangs dang 'od gsal dag dang dge rgyas dang // 'bras bu che lha rnams dang skal mnyam 'thob //
analyzed: 'dod spyod dga' dang bde dang sdug bsngal dang // rnam par spangs pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa yis // tshangs dang 'od gsal dag dang dge rgyas dang // 'bras bu che lha rnams dang skal mnyam 'thob //
translated: the pleasures of desire, of joy, of pain, and of ease,🔽one attains the fortune of the gods of Brahma,

original: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: of Abhasvara, of Subhakrtsna, and of the Great Fruit.

original: khyod kyi zhabs dang phyag mdzes padma gnyis //
analyzed: khyod kyi zhabs dang phyag mdzes padma gnyis //
translated: Your feet and hands are beautiful like lotuses.

original: zhes bya ba ni de gnyis mdzes pa ni padma gnyis lta bu'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de gnyis mdzes pa ni padma gnyis lta bu'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The beauty of those two is like two lotuses.

original: nam mkha' sa bzhin yongs su 'dzin par bgyid pa ni de la ltung ba med par gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: nam mkha' sa bzhin yongs su 'dzin par bgyid pa ni de la ltung ba med par gnas pa'o ;
translated: You are the support like the earth in the sky.

original: / bsam gtan tshul khrims dri ma med pa dang // dbang po rnams ni rab tu bsdams pa dag / zhes bya ba la bsam gtan dang po tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i dngos kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: / bsam gtan tshul khrims dri ma med pa dang // dbang po rnams ni rab tu bsdams pa dag / zhes bya ba la bsam gtan dang po tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i dngos kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The first meditation is the direct cause of rebirth in the Brahma world.

original: tshul khrims dri ma med pa ni bsam gtan de'i rgyu ste tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni 'gyod pa med pas ting nge 'dzin skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dri ma med pa ni bsam gtan de'i rgyu ste tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni 'gyod pa med pas ting nge 'dzin skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Pure morality is the cause of that meditative concentration, because one who has pure morality is free from regret and thus meditative concentration arises.

original: dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa ni gnyi ga'i rgyu ste des tshul khrims rnam par dag par yang 'gyur la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa bsrabs pas bsam gtan la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa ni gnyi ga'i rgyu ste des tshul khrims rnam par dag par yang 'gyur la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa bsrabs pas bsam gtan la gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Restraint of the sense faculties is the cause of both, because by that one attains pure morality and one abides in meditative concentration because discursive thoughts of desire, etc. are reduced.

original: yang na tshul khrims dri ma med pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims dri ma med pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, pure morality is the vow of meditative concentration.

original: mngon sum la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa bsdu'o //
translated: Inference is included in direct perception, etc.

original: yid gcugs pa'i tshig gis bstan pa ni lung ste yid brtan du rung ba nyes pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid gcugs pa'i tshig gis bstan pa ni lung ste yid brtan du rung ba nyes pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Teaching by means of trustworthy words is scripture, i.e. that which is reliable and free from erroneous words.

original: brtag pa'i rim pa ni de la brten nas brtag pa ste lung la brten pa'i rjes dpag go //
analyzed: brtag pa'i rim pa ni de la brten nas brtag pa ste lung la brten pa'i rjes dpag go //
translated: The process of investigation is investigation based on that, i.e. inference based on scripture.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang rnal 'byor pa kha cig la mngon sum du snang ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang rnal 'byor pa kha cig la mngon sum du snang ste /
translated: And the other world is also directly perceived by some yogis.

original: nyi zla skar mas brgyan pa dang / dud 'gro rnam pa thun mong du snang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //🔽'di la the tshom blo ngan khyod ma skyed //
analyzed: nyi zla skar mas brgyan pa dang / dud 'gro rnam pa thun mong du snang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe'o // 'di la the tshom blo ngan khyod ma skyed //
translated: The example is: “just as the sun, moon, stars, and so on, and the animals are commonly perceived.”

original: ces bya ba ni the tshom gyi sgo nas yid mi ches pa mi skyed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni the tshom gyi sgo nas yid mi ches pa mi skyed ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Do not generate the bad mind of doubt in this matter” means do not generate disbelief through doubt.

original: de ni gzhan gyis gzhan gyi 'jig rten pha rol shes pa'o //🔽tshe rabs dran pa'ang de dang de na yod //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyis gzhan gyi 'jig rten pha rol shes pa'o // tshe rabs dran pa'ang de dang de na yod //
translated: This is the knowledge of another’s other world by another.

original: ces bya ba ni rang gi'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rang gi'o //
translated: “The memory of former lives is also there” is one’s own.

original: 'jig rten pha rol de las rjes su dpag zhes bya ba ni lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol de las rjes su dpag zhes bya ba ni lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: “The other world should be inferred from that” is an inference based on scripture.

original: de skad gsungs pas na @305b bdag la 'jig rten gzhan yod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de skad gsungs pas na @305b bdag la 'jig rten gzhan yod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because it is said so, I should know that I have another world” is the conclusion.

original: de la lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i don ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yod pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi tshe rabs shes pa yod par gsungs pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa thob pa rnams kyis rang gi tshe rabs gzhan dran pa gsungs pas na bdag la yang tshe rabs gzhan yod du rung ngo zhes bya ba ste rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de la lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i don ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yod pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi tshe rabs shes pa yod par gsungs pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa thob pa rnams kyis rang gi tshe rabs gzhan dran pa gsungs pas na bdag la yang tshe rabs gzhan yod du rung ngo zhes bya ba ste rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The meaning of the inference based on scripture is that those who have the superknowledge that knows death and rebirth say that there is knowledge of others' lives and those who have attained the superknowledge that recollects past lives say that they remember their own other lives, so it is suitable that I also have other lives.🔽That is a natural inference.

original: de bdag las kyang mngon par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ste dngos po stobs zhugs kyi rjes su dpag pa ste gang dang gang 'bras bu mi 'dra ba de dang de ni rgyu mi 'dra ba sngon du 'gro ba mthong ste /
analyzed: de bdag las kyang mngon par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ste dngos po stobs zhugs kyi rjes su dpag pa ste gang dang gang 'bras bu mi 'dra ba de dang de ni rgyu mi 'dra ba sngon du 'gro ba mthong ste /
translated: It is also not manifest from itself is an inference based on the power of things. Whatever has a different effect is seen to be preceded by a different cause.

original: dper na du ba dang myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na du ba dang myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, smoke and a sprout.

original: 'di dag dang gzhan gyi lus mi 'dra ba yang sngon gyi rgyu mi 'dra ba la bltos so zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di dag dang gzhan gyi lus mi 'dra ba yang sngon gyi rgyu mi 'dra ba la bltos so zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The difference in bodies of these and others is due to the difference in their previous causes.

original: gal te tshe 'di'i rgyu mi 'dra ba las 'bras bu mi 'dra ba yin la tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyu la mi ltos so snyam na /
analyzed: gal te tshe 'di'i rgyu mi 'dra ba las 'bras bu mi 'dra ba yin la tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyu la mi ltos so snyam na /
translated: If you think that the difference in effects is due to the difference in causes in this life and that it does not depend on the causes of other lives,

original: de'i rgyu mi 'dra ba snga ma byas pa de yang de'i snga ma la bltos pa yin te de lta ma yin na da ltar ba 'di yang snga ma la mi bltos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mi 'dra ba snga ma byas pa de yang de'i snga ma la bltos pa yin te de lta ma yin na da ltar ba 'di yang snga ma la mi bltos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the difference in their previous causes is due to the difference in their earlier causes. If it were not so, then this present life would not depend on the past.

original: gal te snga ma snga ma yod kyang 'byung la snga ma ni gzugs yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: gal te snga ma snga ma yod kyang 'byung la snga ma ni gzugs yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: If you think that the earlier ones arise even though they exist earlier, but that it cannot be said that the earlier ones are form,

original: de lta'i shes pa snga ma rgyur mthong la shes pa snga ma de ni gzugs snga ma yin na rgyu mi 'dra ba 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'i byed pa po ma yin pas mtha' dag gi sna tshogs kyi rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te gtan tshigs 'og🔽ma'i khyab pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: de lta'i shes pa snga ma rgyur mthong la shes pa snga ma de ni gzugs snga ma yin na rgyu mi 'dra ba 'bras bu mi 'dra ba'i byed pa po ma yin pas mtha' dag gi sna tshogs kyi rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te gtan tshigs 'og ma'i khyab pa dang mthun no //
translated: The former consciousness is seen to be the cause of the latter consciousness. But if the former consciousness is the cause of the latter form, then the creator of different effects from different causes does not exist, and the diversity of all things would be causeless. The pervasion is the same as in the previous argument.

original: snga ma'i blo las phyi ma'i blo 'grub na //
analyzed: snga ma'i blo las phyi ma'i blo 'grub na //
translated: If the later cognition is established from the earlier cognition,

original: 'jig rten pha rol po dang de las mngon //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol po dang de las mngon //
translated: then the world beyond and the one in this world would be manifest.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyab pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyab pa brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the pervasion.

original: mngal na 'dug pa'i snga rol blo de ni //
analyzed: mngal na 'dug pa'i snga rol blo de ni //
translated: The cognition prior to being in the womb

original: zhes bya ba ni mngal du zhugs ma thag pa'i blo zhes bya ba ste chos can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngal du zhugs ma thag pa'i blo zhes bya ba ste chos can no //
translated: is called “the cognition of the one who has just entered the womb.” This is the subject.

original: de ma thag pa'i tshe rabs snga ma'i blo zhes bya ba de'i gong ma'i blo la bltos so zhes bya ba bsgrub bya'o //🔽blo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i tshe rabs snga ma'i blo zhes bya ba de'i gong ma'i blo la bltos so zhes bya ba bsgrub bya'o // blo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir //
translated: “It depends on the cognition that precedes it in the previous life” is the probandum.

original: zhes bya ba gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Because it has the nature of cognition” is the reason.

original: shes pa ni yul la ltos par grags la mngal na gnas pa'i blo'i yul du yang tshe 'di'i gzugs la sogs pa mi rung @306a * //
analyzed: shes pa ni yul la ltos par grags la mngal na gnas pa'i blo'i yul du yang tshe 'di'i gzugs la sogs pa mi rung @306a * //
translated: It is well known that consciousness depends on an object, and the object of the mind of one in the womb is not the form, etc. of this life.

original: bas gzhan du mthong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: bas gzhan du mthong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the form, etc. seen in other lives is the object of the mind of one in the womb.

original: de ltar na tshe rabs gzhan 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni shes bya rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar na tshe rabs gzhan 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni shes bya rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig go //
translated: Thus, the verse “If there were no other life, how could one understand objects of knowledge?” and so on explains the establishment of other lives.

original: gal te tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyu med na pha ma'i rkyen tsam las yin pas bu rnams 'dra bar rag pa las mi 'dra ba du ma dmigs te /
analyzed: gal te tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyu med na pha ma'i rkyen tsam las yin pas bu rnams 'dra bar rag pa las mi 'dra ba du ma dmigs te /
translated: If there were no cause of other lives, then since they would arise from the mere conditions of parents, all children would be similar, but many dissimilar children are observed.

original: gang tha mi dad kyang gang tha dad pa de ni de tsam gyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang tha mi dad kyang gang tha dad pa de ni de tsam gyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: That which is not different is not the effect of that.

original: rdza mkhan tha mi dad kyang bum pa'i bye brag dmigs pas bum pa de rdza mkhan tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes pa'i don 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: rdza mkhan tha mi dad kyang bum pa'i bye brag dmigs pas bum pa de rdza mkhan tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes pa'i don 'chad pa ni /
translated: For example, although the potter is not different, the specific vase is observed, and therefore the vase is not the effect of the potter alone.

original: skye dgu bde ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig go //
analyzed: skye dgu bde ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig go //
translated: The verse “If there were no other life, how could one understand objects of knowledge?” and so on explains this point.

original: gang dang gang rang gi las la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa de ni snga ma goms pa la bltos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang rang gi las la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa de ni snga ma goms pa la bltos pa yin te /
translated: Whatever one naturally engages in with regard to one's own actions depends on prior habituation.

original: dper na bzo bo la sogs pa'i sems kyi bye brag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bzo bo la sogs pa'i sems kyi bye brag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the various mental states of an artist and so on.🔽The presentation of the reason of effect is:

original: nu zho 'thung ba dang kha zas za ba la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rtags ston pa ni /
analyzed: nu zho 'thung ba dang kha zas za ba la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rtags ston pa ni /
translated: Because of naturally engaging in drinking milk and eating food.

original: blo'i mthu stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: blo'i mthu stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: The two phrases the power of the mind and so on are the thesis.

original: phyed dang gnyis ni 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: phyed dang gnyis ni 'thad pa'o //
translated: One and a half lines are the logical entailment.

original: phyed ni de'i khyab pa'o //
analyzed: phyed ni de'i khyab pa'o //
translated: Half a line is the pervasion.

original: sus kyang ma bstan par nu zho 'thung ba tsam gyis snga ma'i goms pa la ltos par ma nges te /
analyzed: sus kyang ma bstan par nu zho 'thung ba tsam gyis snga ma'i goms pa la ltos par ma nges te /
translated: It is not certain that naturally engaging in drinking milk alone depends on prior habituation, without being taught by anyone.

original: sus kyang ma brtan par nyi ma'i mthus padma 'bye ba lta bu zhes ma nges par dgos pa ni de la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sus kyang ma brtan par nyi ma'i mthus padma 'bye ba lta bu zhes ma nges par dgos pa ni de la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is uncertain, like a lotus opening due to the power of the sun. The purpose of this uncertainty is stated by in that case and so on.

original: de'i lan gyi don ni padma ni bsam pa la cung zad kyang mi ltos kyi nu zho 'thung ba ni bsam pa la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lan gyi don ni padma ni bsam pa la cung zad kyang mi ltos kyi nu zho 'thung ba ni bsam pa la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the reply is that the lotus does not depend at all on intention, but drinking the milk depends on intention.

original: bsam pa la bltos pa bsam pa snga ma goms par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa la bltos pa bsam pa snga ma goms par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And that depends on intention because of the prior habituation to intention.

original: bdag nyid ngan pas 'di la 'ang nor gyi bskyin pa ster ba med cing tshe gzhan du'ang nor gyi bskyin pa ster mi nus te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ngan pas 'di la 'ang nor gyi bskyin pa ster ba med cing tshe gzhan du'ang nor gyi bskyin pa ster mi nus te /
translated: Because of his bad character, he does not give the wages in this life, and he is not able to give wages in another life.

original: de las tshe 'di las ngan pa las ni nor mi 'byung ba ni 'di la yang zhes pa ste tshe 'di la yang ngo //
analyzed: de las tshe 'di las ngan pa las ni nor mi 'byung ba ni 'di la yang zhes pa ste tshe 'di la yang ngo //
translated: From that, in this life, wealth does not arise from bad karma. In this life also, he does not give wealth.

original: nor ni mi gtong zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: nor ni mi gtong zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The wages are not given.

original: tshe 'di'i 'byor pa bdag nyid ngan pa ste pha rol bslu ba dag go //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i 'byor pa bdag nyid ngan pa ste pha rol bslu ba dag go //
translated: The wealth of this life is bad character, that is, deceiving others.

original: slu ba ma yin yang snyam pa ste dang por bslu ba'i bsam pa med kyang chags pas phyis 'jal bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: slu ba ma yin yang snyam pa ste dang por bslu ba'i bsam pa med kyang chags pas phyis 'jal bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Even if he is not a deceiver, that is, if he does not have the intention to deceive at first, he does not pay later because of attachment.

original: chags nas bdag gir byed pa med kyang le los mi 'jal bar sdod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags nas bdag gir byed pa med kyang le los mi 'jal bar sdod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though one is not attached and does not appropriate it as one’s own, one remains because of laziness.

original: de la gtong na nor gyi mtha' ni de @306b nyid yin te phyis mi 'phrad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la gtong na nor gyi mtha' ni de @306b nyid yin te phyis mi 'phrad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one gives it away, that is the end of one’s wealth, because one will not meet with it again.

original: de las bzlog pa la byin pa ni phyis chud mi za ba yin pas gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa la byin pa ni phyis chud mi za ba yin pas gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is giving that is not wasted later on.

original: bdag nyid ngan pas ni tshe gzhan du yang bu lon sbyin par mi nus te //
analyzed: bdag nyid ngan pas ni tshe gzhan du yang bu lon sbyin par mi nus te //
translated: Because of one’s own poverty, one is not able to repay a debt in another life.

original: bdag nyid ngan pa'i skyon gyi ngan 'gror skyes pa bu lon 'jal ba'i nus pa med do zhes ston pa ni 'jig rten gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ngan pa'i skyon gyi ngan 'gror skyes pa bu lon 'jal ba'i nus pa med do zhes ston pa ni 'jig rten gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The verse shows that because of the fault of one’s own poverty, one is born in a bad destiny and is not able to repay a debt.

original: bu lon gzhal bar bya ba khyod la su zhig skul zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: bu lon gzhal bar bya ba khyod la su zhig skul zhes sbyar te /
translated: Who will remind you to repay the debt?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyod ni rang nyid las kyi nyes pas dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod ni rang nyid las kyi nyes pas dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of the fault of one’s own karma, one will be born in hell.

original: 'jal ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jal ba'i mthu med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One does not have the power to repay it.

original: gal te zhing de la byin pas rnam smin 'thob po snyam na yang ngan par lta ba spyod pa khyod la ni /
analyzed: gal te zhing de la byin pas rnam smin 'thob po snyam na yang ngan par lta ba spyod pa khyod la ni /
translated: If you think that you will obtain a ripened result by giving to that field, then:

original: nor rnams byin yang don ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: nor rnams byin yang don ni med par 'gyur //
translated: Even if you give wealth to them, it is useless.

original: zhes bya ba ste gtan med ma yin mod kyi zhing gi skyon gyis gal te mi 'byung ba'am shin tu chung ba nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gtan med ma yin mod kyi zhing gi skyon gyis gal te mi 'byung ba'am shin tu chung ba nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is not that there is absolutely no result, but it is as if there is none, or it is very small, due to the fault of the field.

original: de na zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'i gnas de na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de na zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'i gnas de na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There means in the hell realms.

original: mi'i 'jig rten na nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od kyis shar ba la sogs pa'i sa phyogs gang mthong na dga' ba skye bas na chu lta bu ste /
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten na nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od kyis shar ba la sogs pa'i sa phyogs gang mthong na dga' ba skye bas na chu lta bu ste /
translated: The light of the sun and moon shines in the human world, and one feels joy when one sees the light.

original: phyogs de mi snang ba zhes bya ba ste nyi ma dang zla ba dang bral bas mun gyis g-yogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs de mi snang ba zhes bya ba ste nyi ma dang zla ba dang bral bas mun gyis g-yogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That place is called “the place where there is no light,” because it is covered with darkness, being devoid of the sun and moon.

original: gzhan yang ku mud rgyas pa'i mtsho lta bu'i nam mkha' yang de ni mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni skar ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ku mud rgyas pa'i mtsho lta bu'i nam mkha' yang de ni mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni skar ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the sky, like a lake on which the kumuda flowers open, is not seen there.

original: grang ba'i sdug bsngal bshad pa ni med par lta ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba'i sdug bsngal bshad pa ni med par lta ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The suffering of cold is explained in the verse beginning with “the view of non-existence.”

original: mun nag ces bya ba la sogs pas tsha ba'i dmyal ba'i gnod pa ston to //
analyzed: mun nag ces bya ba la sogs pas tsha ba'i dmyal ba'i gnod pa ston to //
translated: Darkness, etc. shows the harm of the hot hells.

original: de bas mun nag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni yang sos kyi gnod pa gtsor ston to //
analyzed: de bas mun nag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni yang sos kyi gnod pa gtsor ston to //
translated: Therefore, the two verses beginning with “darkness” primarily show the harm of the Reviving Hell.

original: shing mkhan bzhin du dang gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni thig nag gi gnod pa'o //
analyzed: shing mkhan bzhin du dang gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni thig nag gi gnod pa'o //
translated: The two verses beginning with “like a woodcutter” show the harm of the Black Line Hell.

original: kha cig 'bar ba'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bshad gnyis kyis ni bsdus 'joms kyi gnod pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig 'bar ba'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bshad gnyis kyis ni bsdus 'joms kyi gnod pa'o //
translated: The two verses beginning with “some burn” show the harm of the Crushing Hell.

original: lcags gtun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bshad gcig gis ni du 'bod kyi gnod pa'o //
analyzed: lcags gtun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bshad gcig gis ni du 'bod kyi gnod pa'o //
translated: The one verse beginning with “iron mortar” shows the harm of the Howling Hell.

original: byi ru zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bshad gnyis kyis ni ngu 'bod chen po'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: byi ru zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bshad gnyis kyis ni ngu 'bod chen po'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The two verses beginning with “coral” describe the harm of the great wailing hell.

original: kha cig sa gzhi zhes bya ba @307a * //
analyzed: kha cig sa gzhi zhes bya ba @307a * //
translated: The two verses beginning with “some on the ground”

original: la sogs pa'i tshigs bshad gnyis ni tsha ba'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i tshigs bshad gnyis ni tsha ba'i gnod pa'o //
translated: describe the harm of the hot hell.

original: kha cig me zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lhag pa'i gnod pa nye 'khor gyi gnod pas te tshigs su bcad pa dang pos chu bo rab med kyi gnod pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig me zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lhag pa'i gnod pa nye 'khor gyi gnod pas te tshigs su bcad pa dang pos chu bo rab med kyi gnod pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning with “some in fire” describes the harm of the adjoining hell. The first verse describes the harm of the Vaitaraṇī river.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ro myags mi gtsang ba'i 'dam rdzab kyi gnod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ro myags mi gtsang ba'i 'dam rdzab kyi gnod pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning with “some” describes the harm of the swamp of rotting corpses.

original: kha cig zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ni me ma mur gyi 'obs kyi gnod pa'o //🔽gzhan zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ni mtshon chas gtams pa'i tshal ston te tshigs bcad gnyis so //
analyzed: kha cig zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ni me ma mur gyi 'obs kyi gnod pa'o // gzhan zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas ni mtshon chas gtams pa'i tshal ston te tshigs bcad gnyis so //
translated: The verse beginning with “some” describes the harm of the pit of burning embers.🔽The verse beginning with “others” describes the harm of the forest of swords.

original: la la sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa ni ral gri lo ma'i tshal na yod pa'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: la la sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa ni ral gri lo ma'i tshal na yod pa'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning with “some in the forest of sword leaves” describes the harm of the forest of sword leaves.🔽The verse beginning with “some in the forest of razor leaves” describes the harm of the forest of razor leaves.

original: lcags kyi rdza chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni rab tu tsha ba'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: lcags kyi rdza chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni rab tu tsha ba'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning “The great iron pot” describes the harm of the Extremely Hot Hell.

original: sa gzhi me 'bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni mnar med pa'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi me 'bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni mnar med pa'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The two verses beginning “The ground is burning iron” describe the harm of the Avīci Hell.

original: mjug bsdu ba ni bu yug ces bya ba la sogs pa ste grang ba'i dmyal bas sdud pa ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis yin la lhag ma gnyis ni tsha ba'i dmyal ba mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba ni bu yug ces bya ba la sogs pa ste grang ba'i dmyal bas sdud pa ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis yin la lhag ma gnyis ni tsha ba'i dmyal ba mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The summary is the verse beginning “Snow, hail, and sleet,” which summarizes the cold hells in one verse, and the remaining two verses summarize the hot hells.

original: sngon gyi rgyal po yon tan dga' ba rnams kyi slob mchog tshul te de dag gi slob ma mchog gi tshul gyis la dge sbyong dang bram ze dang 'bangs la rang gi spyod tshul snying rje dang ldan par bstan cing gdams pa dang / sbyin pa dang phan gdags pa byas na de ni grags pa rgya chen po 'thob pe //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal po yon tan dga' ba rnams kyi slob mchog tshul te de dag gi slob ma mchog gi tshul gyis la dge sbyong dang bram ze dang 'bangs la rang gi spyod tshul snying rje dang ldan par bstan cing gdams pa dang / sbyin pa dang phan gdags pa byas na de ni grags pa rgya chen po 'thob pe //
translated: The former kings, who delighted in virtue, were the disciples of the supreme teacher. The way of their disciples was to teach and instruct their monks, brahmins, and subjects with compassion in their own conduct, and to give and benefit them. In that way, they attained great fame.

original: mtho ris su 'gro ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the path that leads to the higher realms.🔽The phrase the ascertainment of reality that is taught refers to the ascertainment of the reality of the karmic law of cause and effect that is taught by the wise.

original: chos nyid nges pa gang dag bstan la rtogs zhes bya ba ni las rgyu 'bras kyi chos nyid nges pa gang dag mkhas pa'i skye bos bstan pa la rang nyid rnam par dpyod cig pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid nges pa gang dag bstan la rtogs zhes bya ba ni las rgyu 'bras kyi chos nyid nges pa gang dag mkhas pa'i skye bos bstan pa la rang nyid rnam par dpyod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should investigate for yourself means that you should examine it for yourself.

original: khyod kyi bsam pa yang dag lta dge zhing //
analyzed: khyod kyi bsam pa yang dag lta dge zhing //
translated: The phrase your thoughts should be directed toward the correct view and virtue means that you should direct your thoughts toward the correct view and virtue.

original: sbyor ba rgyal po'i tshul gyis te //
analyzed: sbyor ba rgyal po'i tshul gyis te //
translated: The phrase your practice should be in accord with the king's way of life means that you should practice in accord with the king's way of life.

original: chos dang mthun pa'i rgyal srid bsgrub pa'i tshul lam lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gro bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa'i rgyal srid bsgrub pa'i tshul lam lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gro bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should proceed to obtain the desired result by means of the path that is the way to achieve a kingdom in accord with the Dharma means that you should proceed to obtain the desired result by means of the path that is the way to achieve a kingdom in accord with the Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba nyid ji ltar sems pa yin zhe na /🔽yon tan mi dge'i sems de med par byos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba nyid ji ltar sems pa yin zhe na / yon tan mi dge'i sems de med par byos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: How is it that the correct view is the thought?🔽 The phrase you should eliminate the thought of nonvirtue and so on.

original: bsam pa de'i sbyor ba ni tshul khrims brtan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs @307b pa'o ;
analyzed: bsam pa de'i sbyor ba ni tshul khrims brtan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs @307b pa'o ;
translated: The practice of that thought is indicated by the passage beginning with the words you should be firm in your morality and so on.

original: / rang gi bsod nams rgyal po'i dpal gyi gzi brjid ces bya ba ni rgyal po'i gzi brjid gzhan zil gyis gnon pa ni /
analyzed: / rang gi bsod nams rgyal po'i dpal gyi gzi brjid ces bya ba ni rgyal po'i gzi brjid gzhan zil gyis gnon pa ni /
translated: The splendor of the king's glory of merit is the splendor of the king that overwhelms others.

original: sngon bsod nams byas pa 'dir gzhan zil gyis gnon pa'am /
analyzed: sngon bsod nams byas pa 'dir gzhan zil gyis gnon pa'am /
translated: It is the merit that he has previously created that overwhelms others here.

original: yang na tshe gzhan gyi don du bsod nams bsgrubs pa nyid gzi brjid yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshe gzhan gyi don du bsod nams bsgrubs pa nyid gzi brjid yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the splendor is the very accomplishment of merit for the sake of another life.

original: mdza' bshes dang 'bangs rnams la yid du 'ong ba'i sgra bsgrags te dge ba la sbyar te de rnams kyi sdug bas la  bsal zhing phan gdags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang 'bangs rnams la yid du 'ong ba'i sgra bsgrags te dge ba la sbyar te de rnams kyi sdug bas la  bsal zhing phan gdags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He should proclaim the pleasant sound to his friends and subjects, and should apply them to virtue. He should remove their suffering and should benefit them. This is the meaning of the verse beginning with friends.

original: rang gi bya ba bsgrub pa ni bdag gi zhes pa'i rkang pa gcig go //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba bsgrub pa ni bdag gi zhes pa'i rkang pa gcig go //
translated: The accomplishment of his own aims is the one verse beginning with himself.

original: rang gzhan gnyi ga'i don bsgrub pa ni dpe'i sgo nas bsgrub nas sgrub par byed de da ltar shing rta'i bdag po ded dpon lta bus rang gi gnas su 'gro bar 'dod pa la shing rta nyid dang mig 'jam pa dang 'khor lo zung du gyur pa dang
analyzed: rang gzhan gnyi ga'i don bsgrub pa ni dpe'i sgo nas bsgrub nas sgrub par byed de da ltar shing rta'i bdag po ded dpon lta bus rang gi gnas su 'gro bar 'dod pa la shing rta nyid dang mig 'jam pa dang 'khor lo zung du gyur pa dang
translated: For example, a caravan leader who is the owner of a wagon wishes to go to his destination. The wagon itself, the smooth eyes, the two wheels,

original: / 'khor lo'i srog shing dang ldan pa dang / rta dul bas drangs shing sra ba skyogs kyis kha srabs pa dang / lcag gis rta bsgul ba dang / shing rta'i nang du sgra la sogs pa bzlog pa'i mtshon cha rnon po dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: / 'khor lo'i srog shing dang ldan pa dang / rta dul bas drangs shing sra ba skyogs kyis kha srabs pa dang / lcag gis rta bsgul ba dang / shing rta'i nang du sgra la sogs pa bzlog pa'i mtshon cha rnon po dang ldan pa dang /
translated: the axle of the wheel, the well-trained horses, the strong straps, the whip to stimulate the horses, and the sharp weapons inside the wagon to ward off sounds and so on are the causes for the caravan leader to go to his destination.

original: lam du 'gro ba'i kha zas la sogs pa'i yo byad dang ldan pa dang / bdag la shing rta'i nang na grogs po bzang po dang ldan pa dang / shing rta'i gnya' shing rta la 'gel bas gnya' shing dang ldan pa dang / 'gro ba rtag pa dang tshegs kyi sgra med pa dang /
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba'i kha zas la sogs pa'i yo byad dang ldan pa dang / bdag la shing rta'i nang na grogs po bzang po dang ldan pa dang / shing rta'i gnya' shing rta la 'gel bas gnya' shing dang ldan pa dang / 'gro ba rtag pa dang tshegs kyi sgra med pa dang /
translated: The chariot is equipped with provisions such as food for the journey, and so on. The chariot is accompanied by good friends. The chariot has a yoke to which the oxen are harnessed. The oxen are strong and steady.

original: shing gi skad cung zad grag pa dang / mtshams ma phye ba dang / lam drang po nas 'gro ba dang / de lta bu'i theg pa'am bzhon pa ru mtshon phyar ba dang / khal du ma bkal ba dang / rgyal mtshan mthon po btsugs pa ste /

original: de lta bu dag dang mthun par bdag nyid kyi sems dang lus kyi rgyud 'jam zhing sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la gnas te dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang ldan pa dbang po'i sgo dran pas bsdams shing shes bzhin dang mang du thos pa dang ldan zhing
analyzed: de lta bu dag dang mthun par bdag nyid kyi sems dang lus kyi rgyud 'jam zhing sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la gnas te dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang ldan pa dbang po'i sgo dran pas bsdams shing shes bzhin dang mang du thos pa dang ldan zhing
translated: In accordance with such a way of life, one’s mind and body should be gentle, one should abide in generosity and discipline, and one should be endowed with the aspiration for virtuous qualities. One should restrain the doors of the senses with mindfulness and be endowed with alertness and much learning.

original: de tshe shes pa dang spyod lam mdzes pas bzod pa dang des pa dang ldan par byas te tshig gis nyes pa med pa yid du 'ong ba'i tshig gis gzhan la smra zhing tshul khrims nyams pa dang drang po'i rang bzhin gyi theg pa lta bu'i lam snying
analyzed: de tshe shes pa dang spyod lam mdzes pas bzod pa dang des pa dang ldan par byas te tshig gis nyes pa med pa yid du 'ong ba'i tshig gis gzhan la smra zhing tshul khrims nyams pa dang drang po'i rang bzhin gyi theg pa lta bu'i lam snying
translated: At that time, one should be endowed with patience and gentleness through the beauty of one’s knowledge and conduct. One should speak to others with pleasant words that are free from verbal faults. One should have the nature of an upright person whose discipline is unimpaired. One should have the path of the vehicle that is the essence of the Dharma.

original: rjes sems can gyi don khur bzod cing thob par bya ba'i go 'phang mya ngan las 'das pa'i @308a * //
analyzed: rjes sems can gyi don khur bzod cing thob par bya ba'i go 'phang mya ngan las 'das pa'i @308a * //
translated: One should be patient in bearing the burden of benefiting sentient beings. One should attain the stage that is to be attained, which is nirvana.

original: 'thob par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: 'thob par byed pa de ni /
translated: That is what one should accomplish.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don chen por 'gyur gyi dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan 'gror 'gro bar lta ga la gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don chen por 'gyur gyi dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan 'gror 'gro bar lta ga la gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: How could they go to the miserable destinies, such as the hells?

original: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las gru'i dpes nye bar mtshon pas theg pa chen po'i lam bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las gru'i dpes nye bar mtshon pas theg pa chen po'i lam bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said in the noble Ratnakuta, in the section on the Parable of the Raft, the path of the Great Vehicle is explained.

original: tshangs pa chen po'i rabs te nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po'i rabs te nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-ninth chapter, on the Lineage of Great Brahma.

original: // / khros pa nyid rlung dang 'dra ste rlung gis yul gzhan du 'phen pa ltar khros pa'i rgyus de dag kyang yul gzhan du bskrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / khros pa nyid rlung dang 'dra ste rlung gis yul gzhan du 'phen pa ltar khros pa'i rgyus de dag kyang yul gzhan du bskrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Anger is like the wind, for just as the wind blows from one place to another, so also those who are angry are expelled from one good destiny to another.

original: rnam rtog ngan pa'i tshig gis gdams su med //
analyzed: rnam rtog ngan pa'i tshig gis gdams su med //
translated: They are not fit to be advised by the words of bad thoughts.

original: ces bya ba ni shes rab chung bas gdams ngag gi snod du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni shes rab chung bas gdams ngag gi snod du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: This means that they are not fit vessels for advice because of their small understanding.

original: ma btags stod g-yogs zhes bya ba ni thags su ma btags pa'i rang byung gi ras kyi stod g-yogs so //
analyzed: ma btags stod g-yogs zhes bya ba ni thags su ma btags pa'i rang byung gi ras kyi stod g-yogs so //
translated: They are not fit to wear the upper robe, for they are not fit to wear the upper robe of the self-originated cloth that is not woven on a loom.

original: bsnyems pas gad pa snyoms pa'i mtshan ma can //
analyzed: bsnyems pas gad pa snyoms pa'i mtshan ma can //
translated: They are arrogant, and their signs are the same as those of the proud.

original: zhes bya ba ni snyems shing dregs pas gad pa la sogs pa 'dral cing 'jig pa gang gis mtshon cing de'i mtshan ma gang yin na de ni mche ba gnyis pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snyems shing dregs pas gad pa la sogs pa 'dral cing 'jig pa gang gis mtshon cing de'i mtshan ma gang yin na de ni mche ba gnyis pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The two fangs are the two kinds of pride and arrogance, which are the signs of the two kinds of destruction and ruin, which are indicated by the two fangs.

original: ae ma'o rang bzhin 'phags pa phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: ae ma'o rang bzhin 'phags pa phun sum tshogs //
translated: Oh! The perfection of the noble nature

original: don bzhin bsgrubs pa 'di yis bstan par 'gyur //
analyzed: don bzhin bsgrubs pa 'di yis bstan par 'gyur //
translated: will be shown by this practice according to the truth.

original: ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de ni bdag cag gi don bzhin rab tu bsgrubs pa'i lus btang ba 'dis bstan par gyur cing gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gzhan las khyad par du 'phags pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de ni bdag cag gi don bzhin rab tu bsgrubs pa'i lus btang ba 'dis bstan par gyur cing gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva's noble nature, which is superior to that of others, will be shown, will be made clear, by this giving up of the body, which is a practice according to the truth.🔽The Chapter of the Elephant

original: glang po che'i rabs te sum cu pa'o /
analyzed: glang po che'i rabs te sum cu pa'o /
translated: is the thirtieth.

original: // / nor med na ni rgyal po'i dpal de yang /
analyzed: // / nor med na ni rgyal po'i dpal de yang /
translated: Even that glory of a king, if he has no wealth,🔽is not delightful, it is said.

original: dga' bar ma gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis dga' bar mi byed cing brnyas par byed de /
analyzed: dga' bar ma gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis dga' bar mi byed cing brnyas par byed de /
translated: It is said that it is not delightful because it is not delightful to others, and it is despised.

original: smad 'tshong bud med bzhin te bud med smad 'tshong ma skyes bu dbul po la brnyas shing khyad du gsod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: smad 'tshong bud med bzhin te bud med smad 'tshong ma skyes bu dbul po la brnyas shing khyad du gsod pa bzhin no //
translated: Like a prostitute, a woman is like a prostitute who despises and insults a poor man.

original: gang zhig thos nas yid ni dad gyur nas //
analyzed: gang zhig thos nas yid ni dad gyur nas //
translated: Having heard it, the mind becomes faithful,

original: legs par dga' la brtan pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: legs par dga' la brtan pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: and having become faithful, one becomes well disposed and steadfast.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos thos pas dad pa'i bsam pa rtas pa de'i sgo nas dge ba'i las la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos thos pas dad pa'i bsam pa rtas pa de'i sgo nas dge ba'i las la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This shows the perfection of application to virtuous actions through the growth of the intention of faith by hearing the Dharma.🔽Even though one knows it oneself, one should know how to buy it.

original: rang gis shes kyang de ni nyo bar rig / ces bya ba ni 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i @308b mdo las bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe zla ba gcig gi bar du sha srang gsum gsum bcad de
analyzed: rang gis shes kyang de ni nyo bar rig / ces bya ba ni 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i @308b mdo las bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe zla ba gcig gi bar du sha srang gsum gsum bcad de
translated: This is like in the noble Great Nirvana Sutra, where the Blessed One, when he was a bodhisattva in the past, cut off three ounces of flesh

original: yon du byin nas tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam zin pa lta bu dang / tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi phyir yang brag la lus bor ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yon du byin nas tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam zin pa lta bu dang / tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi phyir yang brag la lus bor ba lta bu'o //
translated: and gave it as a gift for a month, and then received a single verse, and for half a verse he threw himself off a cliff.

original: gti mug ni mun pa lta bu ste yang dag pa'i don rtogs pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug ni mun pa lta bu ste yang dag pa'i don rtogs pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Delusion is like darkness, because it is an obstacle to the realization of the truth.

original: de ni phyi rol gyi snang ba dang mi 'gal gyi shes rab kyi snang ba dang 'gal bas sgron ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol gyi snang ba dang mi 'gal gyi shes rab kyi snang ba dang 'gal bas sgron ma lta bu'o //
translated: It is not opposed to external light, but to the light of wisdom, so it is like a lamp.

original: thos pa ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi khongs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun gyi khongs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: Learning is included among the seven jewels of the noble ones.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dad dang tshul khrims gtang dang thos pa ni //
analyzed: dad dang tshul khrims gtang dang thos pa ni //
translated: Faith, morality, generosity, learning,

original: dri med ngo tsha shes dang khrel yod dang / shes rab nor bdun lags par thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: dri med ngo tsha shes dang khrel yod dang / shes rab nor bdun lags par thub pas gsungs //
translated: stainless conscience and shame, and wisdom: these are the seven jewels, the Buddha said.

original: don gzhan phal pa don ma mchis rtogs mdzod //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: don gzhan phal pa don ma mchis rtogs mdzod // ces gsungs te /
translated: Know that other worldly wealth is meaningless.

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi nor las khyad par 'phags par thogs med kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi nor las khyad par 'phags par thogs med kyis gsungs so //
translated: Asanga says that this is superior to worldly wealth.

original: der gzhan gyis dbral bar nus pa dang mi nus pa'i khyad par yang gsungs so //
analyzed: der gzhan gyis dbral bar nus pa dang mi nus pa'i khyad par yang gsungs so //
translated: He also says that there is a difference between what can and cannot be taken away by others.

original: rmongs pa ni dgra yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa ni dgra yin te /
translated: Delusion is the enemy.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bde ba 'dod kyang gti mug pas /
analyzed: bde ba 'dod kyang gti mug pas /
translated: Though you want happiness, through delusion

original: (/'phags pa klu sgrub kyis bshes pa'i 'phrin yig las/) rang gi bde ba dgra ltar 'joms //
analyzed: (/'phags pa klu sgrub kyis bshes pa'i 'phrin yig las/) rang gi bde ba dgra ltar 'joms //
translated: Your own happiness is destroyed as if by an enemy.

original: sdug bsngal 'dor 'dod sems yod ('jig rten pa'i nor/) kyang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'dor 'dod sems yod ('jig rten pa'i nor/) kyang /
translated: You have a mind that wants to avoid suffering,

original: (/ thos pa'i nor/) sdug bsngal nyid la mngon par rgyug / ces bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: (/ thos pa'i nor/) sdug bsngal nyid la mngon par rgyug / ces bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: but you rush right into suffering.

original: kun tu rmongs pa ni nyes pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba lta bu yin la de 'joms pas mtshon cha lta bu'o //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa ni nyes pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba lta bu yin la de 'joms pas mtshon cha lta bu'o //
translated: Ignorance is like the root of all faults, and wisdom is like a weapon to destroy it.

original: grogs po bzang po ni thabs kyi khyad par bstan pas phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: grogs po bzang po ni thabs kyi khyad par bstan pas phan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: A good friend is helpful because he or she teaches special methods.

original: ji ltar ded dpon seng ge 'dzin gyis tshong pa rnams thar bar byas pa lta bu yin la de'i bya ba yang chos thos pa las 'grub pas grogs kyi mchog go //
analyzed: ji ltar ded dpon seng ge 'dzin gyis tshong pa rnams thar bar byas pa lta bu yin la de'i bya ba yang chos thos pa las 'grub pas grogs kyi mchog go //
translated: He or she is like a captain who helps merchants reach their destination, and this activity is accomplished through listening to the Dharma.

original: mdza' bshes bzang po ni phongs pa'i tshe mi 'dor ba ste /
analyzed: mdza' bshes bzang po ni phongs pa'i tshe mi 'dor ba ste /
translated: A good friend is someone who does not abandon you when you are in need.

original: ji ltar ngang pa'i rgyal po yul 'khor srung snyis zin pa la blon po bzhin bzangs kyis grogs byas pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar ngang pa'i rgyal po yul 'khor srung snyis zin pa la blon po bzhin bzangs kyis grogs byas pa lta bu yin te /
translated: It is like the case of the king of geese, Suparni, who was seized by a serpent, but was helped by his minister, Sumukha.

original: de yang thos pa la yod de de ni dus kun tu mi 'bral zhing grogs kyi bya ba byed de rgud pa las 'da' ba dang 'byor ba thob pa'i thabs shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang thos pa la yod de de ni dus kun tu mi 'bral zhing grogs kyi bya ba byed de rgud pa las 'da' ba dang 'byor ba thob pa'i thabs shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is to say, learning is a friend who never abandons one and who performs the function of a friend, because it knows the means of avoiding misfortune and attaining prosperity.🔽It is a medicine that cures the disease of grief,

original: mya ngan gyis gdung ba nad lta bu sel bas @309a * //🔽gnod pa med pa'i sman te gnod pa'i sman ni sman dka' ba la sogs pa yin na de yang med la mya ngan kyang sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan gyis gdung ba nad lta bu sel bas @309a * // gnod pa med pa'i sman te gnod pa'i sman ni sman dka' ba la sogs pa yin na de yang med la mya ngan kyang sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: like the medicine that cures the disease of grief.

original: ji ltar gnas byed kyi bu dang rus mthun pa'i bram ze mo de bzhin gshegs pa la chos thos pa'i mya ngan bral pa'i rtogs pa brjod pa dper bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas byed kyi bu dang rus mthun pa'i bram ze mo de bzhin gshegs pa la chos thos pa'i mya ngan bral pa'i rtogs pa brjod pa dper bya'o //
translated: It is like the case of the brahmin woman who was related to the son of Vasistha and who attained realization by hearing the Dharma from the Tathagata and becoming free from grief.

original: nyes pa chen po'i dpung ni nyes pa mang po'i dpung ste nyes pa dang des kun nas bslangs pa'i sdig pa'i las te de rnams 'joms pas dpung lta bu yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa chen po'i dpung ni nyes pa mang po'i dpung ste nyes pa dang des kun nas bslangs pa'i sdig pa'i las te de rnams 'joms pas dpung lta bu yin te /
translated: The army of great faults is the army of many faults, and the sinful karma motivated by them. It is like an army because it conquers them.

original: dmag gi dpung ni gang zag gcig gis thub par mi nus kyi rang gi dmag tshogs mang po la bltos pa lta bu yin pas de dang chos mthun te mang po 'joms pa thos pa la du ma yod pas dpung zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dmag gi dpung ni gang zag gcig gis thub par mi nus kyi rang gi dmag tshogs mang po la bltos pa lta bu yin pas de dang chos mthun te mang po 'joms pa thos pa la du ma yod pas dpung zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The army of a single person cannot be conquered, but depends on many of his own troops. It is similar to that, since it conquers many.

original: yang na thos pa nyid du ma ste /🔽mi sdug pa thos pa ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin la /
analyzed: yang na thos pa nyid du ma ste / mi sdug pa thos pa ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin la /
translated: Or, learning itself is many.🔽Learning the unappealing is the antidote to attachment,

original: byams pa thos pa ni zhes dang gi gnyen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas thos pa nyid du ma yin pa de skad ces bya'o ;
analyzed: byams pa thos pa ni zhes dang gi gnyen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas thos pa nyid du ma yin pa de skad ces bya'o ;
translated: learning love is the antidote to hatred, and so on.

original: / grags dang dpal ni gter gyi mchog kyang yin //
analyzed: / grags dang dpal ni gter gyi mchog kyang yin //
translated: It is also the supreme treasure of fame and glory.

original: zhes bya ba ni rin po che snod du bcug nas sbas pa ni rin po che'i gter te 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rin po che snod du bcug nas sbas pa ni rin po che'i gter te 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: A treasure of jewels is a treasure of jewels because it is a source of jewels.

original: de bzhin du mang du thos pa yang grags pa'i 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mang du thos pa yang grags pa'i 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: Likewise, much learning is the source of fame.🔽The ocean of much learning is proclaimed in many ways.

original: mang du thos pa rgya mtsho lta bu ni rnam pa du mar bsgrags te byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum par chud pa dag kyang tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi ched du yang 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba brgal nas chos nyan par gsungs pa'i
analyzed: mang du thos pa rgya mtsho lta bu ni rnam pa du mar bsgrags te byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum par chud pa dag kyang tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi ched du yang 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba brgal nas chos nyan par gsungs pa'i
translated: Even those who have entered the third bodhisattva stage, in order to hear the Dharma, cross over a world realm filled with fire for the sake of a single verse.

original: phyir ro // dpal ni 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyir ro // dpal ni 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Glory is the perfection of wealth.

original: mang du thos pa shes rab dang ldan pa'i mkhas pa'i yo byad kyi 'byor pas phongs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mang du thos pa shes rab dang ldan pa'i mkhas pa'i yo byad kyi 'byor pas phongs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The wise person who has much learning and is endowed with wisdom is not poor because of the wealth of the requisites of learning.

original: gzhan gyis bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is honored by others.

original: ji skad du gong du sbyin bdag rnams kyis gsol ba btab pas nor ni rgya che bar 'gyur ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gong du sbyin bdag rnams kyis gsol ba btab pas nor ni rgya che bar 'gyur ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it was said above, “Wealth is abundant because of the supplications of benefactors.”

original: yang na dpal ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dpal ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Or else, glory is the perfection of the supramundane.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa las /
translated: The Inconceivable Secrets of the Tathagata states:🔽The great treasures of the world are exhausted

original: 'jig rten gter chen rnams ni rgyal po dang // rkun po me chus bslas pas zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten gter chen rnams ni rgyal po dang // rkun po me chus bslas pas zad par 'gyur //
translated: by the king, thieves, fire, and water.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gter chen ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gter chen ni //
translated: The great treasure of the tathagatas

original: bskal pa bye ba mang por chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba mang por chud mi za //
translated: is not exhausted in many millions of eons.

original: sems can don @309b brtson byang chub sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: sems can don @309b brtson byang chub sems dpa' ni //
translated: The treasure of the bodhisattvas who strive for the welfare of sentient beings🔽is not exhausted even when they give to all.

original: tshul bzhin nyid kyi dben sems gang yin dang / rtag tu bag yod 'chi med rgyu yin te //
analyzed: tshul bzhin nyid kyi dben sems gang yin dang / rtag tu bag yod 'chi med rgyu yin te //
translated: The cause of immortality is the conscientious attitude of solitude and constant heedfulness.

original: yongs su 'dzin med bde ba kun gyi rgyu //🔽zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin med bde ba kun gyi rgyu // zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of all happiness is the absence of possessiveness.

original: ya rabs rnams dang phrad na skyes kyi mchog ni dam pa rnams thos pa las rtogs pa 'thob pas phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa nyid don du gnyer zhing gzhan la yang de nyid 'chad kyi nor la sogs pa'i skyes ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ya rabs rnams dang phrad na skyes kyi mchog ni dam pa rnams thos pa las rtogs pa 'thob pas phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa nyid don du gnyer zhing gzhan la yang de nyid 'chad kyi nor la sogs pa'i skyes ni ma yin te /
translated: When they meet with the righteous, the best gift is the Dharma, because the holy attain understanding from hearing it. Therefore, they seek unmistaken learning itself and teach it to others, but not material gifts and so on.

original: nyer rgyal gyis bdud rtsi thob pa'i don nyid bang nas skyes kyis zhus shing dpe bshad pas chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyer rgyal gyis bdud rtsi thob pa'i don nyid bang nas skyes kyis zhus shing dpe bshad pas chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba lta bu'o //
translated: The meaning of the attainment of nectar was requested by Ajatashatru, and the Dharma eye, which is free from dust and impurities, was attained by means of the explanation of the parable.

original: tshogs kyi nang na mkhas pa dag dga' bar 'gyur ba ni dper na dbul po des pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang na mkhas pa dag dga' bar 'gyur ba ni dper na dbul po des pa lta bu ste /
translated: The wise rejoice in the assembly, like the poor honest one.
