analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni lhag ma tshig rkang gsum mo // 'chi ba'i 'du shes bskyed pa'i bsngags pa brjod par bya ba la sogs pa la 'chi ba'i 'du shes dang 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa ni shin tu don che ba ste /
translated: The remaining three lines explain that.🔽The praise of generating the perception of death, etc., is as follows: The perception of death, the perception of dissatisfaction with the whole world, etc., are extremely meaningful,

original: bslab pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi sdug pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa bcu'i gnyen por mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi sdug pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa bcu'i gnyen por mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: because the perception of impurity, the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering in the impermanent, the perception of the repulsiveness of food, the perception of nondelight in the entire world, the perception of death, the perception of the body, and the perception of being limited by the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are the antidotes to the ten unwholesome things that are adverse to the city of nirvana, which is reached by means of the three trainings.

original: sdug bsngal la bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes dang / snang ba'i 'du shes dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes dang / snang ba'i 'du shes dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the perception of the absence of self in suffering, the perception of food as repulsive, the perception of the dislike of all the world, the perception of light, the perception of freedom from passion, the perception of cessation,

original: 'chi ba'i 'du shes so zhes don che bar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'du shes so zhes don che bar gsungs so //
translated: and the perception of death.

original: lcags kyi khyim nas skyes pa'i rabs te sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: lcags kyi khyim nas skyes pa'i rabs te sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-second chapter, on the “Birth Stories of the Iron House.”

original: // / las kyi dbang gis de ltar de gyur tam //
analyzed: // / las kyi dbang gis de ltar de gyur tam //
translated: Or is it that he became so by the power of karma?

original: sngon snying rje la sogs pa goms kyang tshul khrims ngan pa'i rgyus ngan 'gror skye ba srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: sngon snying rje la sogs pa goms kyang tshul khrims ngan pa'i rgyus ngan 'gror skye ba srid pa nyid do //
translated: Even though he had previously practiced compassion and so forth, it is possible that he was born in a bad rebirth because of bad moral discipline.

original: de nyid mthu yis de ni de ltar gyur ces bya ba la mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i 'phen pa de dang de las 'bras bu @311b ngan 'gro'i lus dang de dang de lta bu sta tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po des ni las kyi nus
analyzed: de nyid mthu yis de ni de ltar gyur ces bya ba la mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i 'phen pa de dang de las 'bras bu @311b ngan 'gro'i lus dang de dang de lta bu sta tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po des ni las kyi nus
translated: By the power of that, it is like that. By the power of that projection of the cause of the unwholesome fruition, the body of the lower realms and that and that kind of result are like that.

original: pa'i stobs shin tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: pa'i stobs shin tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: By those two verses, the power of the potential of karma is made very clear.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba la dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba la dbang thob pa'o //
translated: This is the attainment of mastery over birth.

original: las kyi dbang gis yin pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ji skad du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis yin pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ji skad du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the power of karma is made clear by as it is said and so on.

original: las kyi stobs kyis skye ba la yang dge bas ngan 'gror mi 'gro bas mi dge ba nyid kyi las kyis nus pa yod par ston pa ni mi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi stobs kyis skye ba la yang dge bas ngan 'gror mi 'gro bas mi dge ba nyid kyi las kyis nus pa yod par ston pa ni mi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even in birth by the power of karma, since one does not go to the lower realms by virtue, it shows the existence of the potential of unwholesome karma alone.

original: las kyi bag chags kyis de dang de brten te de lta de ltar gyur ces bya ba la mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i 'phen pa de dang de las 'bras bu ngan 'gro'i lus de dang de lta bu ste /
analyzed: las kyi bag chags kyis de dang de brten te de lta de ltar gyur ces bya ba la mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i 'phen pa de dang de las 'bras bu ngan 'gro'i lus de dang de lta bu ste /
translated: The latent impressions of karma are the cause of the maturation of non-virtue. Based on that and that means that from that and that cause, the effect is the body in the lower realms, that and that.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa des ni las kyi nus pa'i stobs shin tu gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa des ni las kyi nus pa'i stobs shin tu gsal bar byed do //
translated: The second verse makes the power of the potential of karma very clear.

original: rab tu rnam par 'gyur bar byed ces bya ba ni rnam par 'tshe zhing mtho 'tsham par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'gyur bar byed ces bya ba ni rnam par 'tshe zhing mtho 'tsham par byed pa'o //
translated: It says it causes great transformation meaning it causes harm and injury.

original: dman pa'i tshul gyi spyod pa ni shin tu snying rje ba la sogs par ston pa'i g-yo byed pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i tshul gyi spyod pa ni shin tu snying rje ba la sogs par ston pa'i g-yo byed pa'o //
translated: The conduct of the inferior way is the deceitfulness of showing great compassion and so on.

original: tsha zhing drod che rtsub pas sgrub pa'i zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i sman gyis bsam pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tsha zhing drod che rtsub pas sgrub pa'i zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i sman gyis bsam pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: It says accomplished by heat, great heat, and roughness meaning that medicine of that kind should be accomplished with intention.

original: de ni bsil ba dang 'jam pa dang mngar ba la sogs pa'i sman gyis 'phel ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bsil ba dang 'jam pa dang mngar ba la sogs pa'i sman gyis 'phel ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It says it increases with cool, soft, sweet, and so on meaning medicine of that kind increases.

original: de las gzhan pa don med ci 'dra zhig ces bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa che ba la gnod par sems pa ni drin med pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa don med ci 'dra zhig ces bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa che ba la gnod par sems pa ni drin med pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since he is ungrateful, he thinks that he is harming the one who is of great benefit.

original: yon tan rnams la mi dga' zhing //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la mi dga' zhing //
translated: He does not delight in virtues.

original: zhes bya ba ni bzod pa la mi dga' bar ma byas na yang nus pa su zhig yod ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzod pa la mi dga' bar ma byas na yang nus pa su zhig yod ces sbyar ro //
translated: Even if he is not made to delight in patience, what power does he have?

original: sbyor ba'i sgo nas mi srun pa ni ma btul na //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgo nas mi srun pa ni ma btul na //
translated: He is not tamed by the method of application.

original: zhes pa dang / bsam pa'i sgo nas bzod pa sdom pa ma btang na zhes sbyar /🔽gzhan la gnod pa byas pa'i bde ba'am /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / bsam pa'i sgo nas bzod pa sdom pa ma btang na zhes sbyar / gzhan la gnod pa byas pa'i bde ba'am /
translated: Even if he does not give up the vow of patience by the method of thought,🔽he is not tamed by the method of thought.🔽The desire for the pleasure that arises from harming others🔽or the desire for the suffering of others to occur🔽is not accomplished by the wise.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba dgag par 'dod pa de'i zhes bya ba la gzhan la gnod pa byas pas bdag la bde ba dang bdag la sdug bsngal 'byung ba dgag par 'dod pa zhes bya ba de mi 'grub pas mkhas de mi byed do zhes bya ba tshig phyi🔽ma gnyis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba dgag par 'dod pa de'i zhes bya ba la gzhan la gnod pa byas pas bdag la bde ba dang bdag la sdug bsngal 'byung ba dgag par 'dod pa zhes bya ba de mi 'grub pas mkhas de mi byed do zhes bya ba tshig phyi🔽ma gnyis so //
translated: Therefore, the wise do not do it.

original: de ltar rang gi don gyi bzod pa'i sogs pa bstan nas gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba'i dgos pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don gyi bzod pa'i sogs pa bstan nas gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba'i dgos pa ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, having taught the patience that is for one's own sake, he teaches the necessity of that which is for the sake of others.

original: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig go //
analyzed: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig go //
translated: One verse on that necessity.

original: de bas bdag gis bzod pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: de bas bdag gis bzod pa la gnas nas /
translated: Therefore, having patience, I will stay

original: thabs kyis @312a * //
analyzed: thabs kyis @312a * //
translated: and with skillful means

original: bsgo yang gal te mi go na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgo yang gal te mi go na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if he does not understand,

original: gnod pa byed pa nyid la yang don gyis bzod pa bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa nyid la yang don gyis bzod pa bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: he will be taught patience by implication.

original: gal te de la ma phan na yang gzhan bzod pa la gnas par 'gyur ba ni bzod pa chung ba gzhan dag yod pas na /
analyzed: gal te de la ma phan na yang gzhan bzod pa la gnas par 'gyur ba ni bzod pa chung ba gzhan dag yod pas na /
translated: Even if he does not benefit, others will be caused to practice patience.🔽He will be turned away from the wrong path.

original: de dag 'di ni log pa'i lam las bzlog / ces bya ba ste de ni gnod pa byed pa'i gang zag la phan pa'i dbang du ma byas kyi gnod pa byed pa la mi bzod pa'i skye ba la phan pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'di ni log pa'i lam las bzlog / ces bya ba ste de ni gnod pa byed pa'i gang zag la phan pa'i dbang du ma byas kyi gnod pa byed pa la mi bzod pa'i skye ba la phan pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is not from the point of view of benefiting the person who does the harm, but from the point of view of benefiting the person who is impatient with the one who does the harm.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa des na skye bo de lta bus brnyas byas na ;
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa des na skye bo de lta bus brnyas byas na ;
translated: By that benefit to self and other, if such a person is despised,

original: bdag lta bu'ang de ltar de mi byed ces bya ba ste bdag lta bu phar gnod pa nus kyang de ltar gnod pa de mi byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag lta bu'ang de ltar de mi byed ces bya ba ste bdag lta bu phar gnod pa nus kyang de ltar gnod pa de mi byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: I too am like that, and do not do that. That is, even though one like me is able to harm in return, I do not do that kind of harm.

original: pha rol gyis kyang nyes dmigs mthong na de ltar phyis mi byed pas 'on tang bdag ni gnod pa de las thar bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyis kyang nyes dmigs mthong na de ltar phyis mi byed pas 'on tang bdag ni gnod pa de las thar bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the other person also sees the disadvantage, and will not do that again, Well then, I am freed from that harm.

original: ma he'i rabs te sum cu rtsa gsum pa'o /
analyzed: ma he'i rabs te sum cu rtsa gsum pa'o /
translated: The thirty-third chapter, called “The Ox.”

original: // / bdud rtsir gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / bdud rtsir gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Becoming nectar” means

original: mi 'chi bar gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'chi bar gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “May they not die.”

original: phan btags drin med bandu'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: phan btags drin med bandu'i me tog bzhin //
translated: “Like the bandhu-jīva flower, ungrateful for help”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: shing bandu'i zhes bya ba'i me tog las 'bras bu mi 'byung ba dang 'dra bar ngan pa la phan btags kyang phan pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shing bandu'i zhes bya ba'i me tog las 'bras bu mi 'byung ba dang 'dra bar ngan pa la phan btags kyang phan pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that just as a flower called bandhu-jīva does not produce fruit, so also no benefit arises from helping the wicked.

original: yon tan grags dang bcas pa'i lus bkrus pas /
analyzed: yon tan grags dang bcas pa'i lus bkrus pas /
translated: “Having bathed the body together with the fame of good qualities”🔽means

original: glang po che'i tshul du spyad par mi 'gyur ram /🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glang po che'i tshul du spyad par mi 'gyur ram / zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or will it be like the elephant?

original: snga ma chud gzan pa'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma chud gzan pa'i nyes pa ste /
translated: This is the fault of wasting the former.

original: phan btags pa la gnod pa byas na ni phan btags pa'i bsod nams dang phan btags pa'i grogs po gnyis ka nyams par byas pa'i phyir te /🔽ji ltar glang po che lus gyi dri ma bkru ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phan btags pa la gnod pa byas na ni phan btags pa'i bsod nams dang phan btags pa'i grogs po gnyis ka nyams par byas pa'i phyir te / ji ltar glang po che lus gyi dri ma bkru ba'i phyir /
translated: If you harm one who has helped you, you destroy both the merit of helping and the friendship.🔽Just as an elephant,🔽having entered a lake to wash his body,

original: mtshor zhugs la yang skom pa'i phyir bye ma la 'dres pas snga ma chud gzan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshor zhugs la yang skom pa'i phyir bye ma la 'dres pas snga ma chud gzan pa lta bu'o //
translated: destroys the former by trampling the mud.

original: drin med pa'i nyes pa ston pa ni pha rol zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: drin med pa'i nyes pa ston pa ni pha rol zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning with the other shows the fault of ingratitude.

original: pha rol la nyes pa yod kyang bdag de la nyes pa med par byed pa ni //
analyzed: pha rol la nyes pa yod kyang bdag de la nyes pa med par byed pa ni //
translated: Even if the other has a fault, one should make oneself faultless toward him.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽bya shing rta mo'i rabs te sum cu rtsa bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // bya shing rta mo'i rabs te sum cu rtsa bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is shown by the verse beginning with here.🔽This completes the thirty-fourth chapter in the glorious Kalidasa's Birth Stories.

original: // / @312b skyes pa'i rabs kyi rgyud kyi tshig gi cha dka' ba rnam par 'grel pa //
analyzed: // / @312b skyes pa'i rabs kyi rgyud kyi tshig gi cha dka' ba rnam par 'grel pa //
translated: Commentary on the difficult parts of the words of the Jataka Tantra

original: slob dpon b'irya sing has mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon b'irya sing has mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The treatise composed by Master Haribhadra is complete.
